Title: Maryland Paint Stewardship
Synopsis: Requiring producers of architectural paint or a representative organization to submit a plan for the establishment of a Paint Stewardship Program to the Department of the Environment by July 1, 2025, and in accordance with certain requirements; requiring the Department to review and approve certain plans, including a certain assessment; prohibiting the sale of certain architectural paint beginning January 1, 2026 unless an approved Paint Stewardship Program has been implemented by certain producers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Paint Stewardship Program in Maryland requiring producers of architectural paint to submit a plan for managing postconsumer paint, including collection, recycling, and disposal. It sets up assessments on paint sales to fund the program, mandates implementation timelines, and creates oversight and reporting requirements for compliance.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment, Office of Recycling
stakeholders: Producers of architectural paint, retailers, consumers, and local governments in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to create a structured and funded system for managing postconsumer paint, which could reduce small business failures related to waste management costs and regulatory compliance.

Title: Property Taxes - Authority of Counties to Establish a Subclass and Set a Special Rate for Vacant and Abandoned Property
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county to establish, by law, a subclass of real property consisting of vacant lots or improved property cited as vacant and unfit for habitation or other authorized use on a certain violation notice and to set a special property tax rate for certain vacant and abandoned property; requiring the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county that enacts a special tax rate to submit a certain report by December 1 each year; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City and counties to establish a special property tax rate for vacant and abandoned properties, and requires annual reporting on the use and impact of this rate.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Mayor and City Council or the governing body of each county
stakeholders: Property owners of vacant and abandoned properties, local governments, and communities affected by property vacancy and abandonment
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets vacant and abandoned properties, not small businesses, so its direct impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Institutions of Higher Education - Admissions Standards - Prohibition on Consideration of Legacy Preference or Donor Preference
Synopsis: Prohibiting institutions of higher education that receive State funds from considering a legacy preference or donor preference as an eligible criterion for admissions standards at the institution; and allowing an institution of higher education to ask applicants for information regarding familial relationships to alums of the institution for data collection purposes.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits Maryland institutions of higher education that receive state funds from considering legacy or donor preferences as criteria for admissions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Higher Education
stakeholders: Applicants to Maryland higher education institutions, especially those related to alumni or donors
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses, but it may influence higher education access and diversity.

Title: Criminal Law - Indecent Exposure Within the Presence of a Minor
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing the common law crime of indecent exposure; prohibiting a person from, with prurient intent, committing the common law crime of indecent exposure when the person knows or reasonably should know that a minor is present and the minor is at least 2 years old and is more than 4 years younger than the person; and establishing a penalty of 5 years of imprisonment or a fine of up to $10,000 or both on conviction for a crime of indecent exposure in the presence of a minor.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to prohibit indecent exposure when committed with prurient intent in the presence of a minor who is at least 2 years old and more than 4 years younger than the offender. It increases penalties for violations, including imprisonment and fines.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Minors, general public, law enforcement, legal system
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Housing Innovation Pilot Program and Housing Innovation Fund - Establishment (Housing Innovation Pilot Program Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing the Housing Innovation Fund to provide loans for local housing authorities and county governments to develop mixed-income, cross-subsidized housing; establishing the Housing Innovation Pilot Program in the Department of Housing and Community Development to assist public housing authorities and county governments in increasing housing production and to reward counties pursuing solutions to the problem of housing scarcity; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Fund in certain fiscal years; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Housing Innovation Pilot Program and the Housing Innovation Fund in Maryland to provide loans for developing mixed-income, cross-subsidized housing projects. It aims to increase housing production, especially affordable housing, by supporting local authorities and county governments with funding and resources.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Local housing authorities, county governments, and residents seeking affordable housing options in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is designed to support innovative housing projects, which can contribute to a more stable housing market and potentially reduce small business failures related to housing instability and economic challenges.

Title: Residential Property - Affordable Housing Land Trusts - Authority to Establish Condominium Regimes
Synopsis: Authorizing a condominium regime to be established on certain land owned by an affordable housing land trust.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the establishment of condominium regimes on properties owned by affordable housing land trusts in Maryland, facilitating the development of affordable housing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Affordable housing land trusts, residents seeking affordable housing, and developers involved in affordable housing projects
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts affordable housing development and land trusts, with indirect benefits for small businesses involved in housing development and related services.

Title: Tax Sales - Homeowner Protection Program - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring each collector of property taxes to include with each property tax bill a separate insert that describes the Homeowner Protection Program and encourages taxpayers to make a voluntary donation to the Program through a website maintained by the State Department of Assessments and Taxation.
bill_summary: The bill requires property tax collectors in Maryland to include a description of the Homeowner Protection Program and encourage voluntary donations to it on each property tax bill. It establishes a website for donations, allocates fees from tax sale certificates to the program, and funds the program to help prevent low-income, elderly, and disabled homeowners from losing their homes to tax sale foreclosure.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation, State Tax Sale Ombudsman, and the Department responsible for property tax collection.
stakeholders: Low-income, elderly, and disabled homeowners at risk of losing their homes due to tax sale foreclosure.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to provide assistance to vulnerable homeowners, which can help prevent foreclosures and stabilize communities, potentially reducing small business failures related to community decline.

Title: Charter Counties - Comprehensive Plans - Affirmatively Furthering Fair Housing
Synopsis: Altering requirements for the housing element of a charter county's comprehensive plan to include requirements related to affirmatively furthering fair housing; requiring the housing element of a comprehensive plan that is enacted or amended on or after January 1, 2025, to include an assessment of fair housing to ensure that the county is affirmatively furthering fair housing; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires charter counties in Maryland to include an assessment of fair housing and affirmatively furthering fair housing in their comprehensive plans, especially the housing element, starting from January 1, 2025. It also mandates that counties incorporate existing fair housing assessments into their plans when amended after January 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning, Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, and the planning commissions of charter counties.
stakeholders: Charter counties in Maryland, local government planning agencies, and residents seeking affordable and fair housing.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on fair housing and urban planning, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure reduction.

Title: Natural Resources - Northern Snakehead - Common Name
Synopsis: Establishing the common name of the northern snakehead as the "Chesapeake Channa".
bill_summary: The bill establishes the common name for the northern snakehead fish as 'Chesapeake Channa' and sets regulations for licensing and fishing methods for this species in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Fishermen, recreational anglers, and environmental agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill introduces a licensing program and regulations for fishing northern snakehead, which could support small fishing businesses and promote sustainable fishing practices.

Title: Agriculture - Pollinator Habitat Plan - Requirements for State Highway Administration
Synopsis: Requiring the State Highway Administration's pollinator habitat plan to include policies and procedures regarding the use of pollinator habitat areas along State highways; requiring the Administration to track and evaluate federal programs that provide funding for pollinator habitats, native plants, and invasive species control and to apply for any funding that the Administration determines appropriate and beneficial to pollinator habitats; requiring the Administration to update the plan by October 1 each year; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Highway Administration to develop and update a pollinator habitat plan that includes policies for creating and maintaining pollinator-friendly areas along highways, and to track and apply for federal funding for pollinator habitats. It also mandates the inclusion of best management practices and public education efforts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Pollinators, local communities, environmental groups, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it promotes environmental and ecological initiatives that could benefit local economies and small businesses involved in ecological services and landscaping.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - Qualified Health Plans - Dental Coverage
Synopsis: Repealing a certain provision of law providing that a qualified health plan is not required under certain circumstances to provide essential benefits that duplicate the minimum benefits of qualified dental plans; and repealing the authority of the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to require children enrolling in a qualified health plan to have essential pediatric dental benefits required by the federal Secretary of Health and Human Services.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain provisions that required qualified health plans in Maryland to include essential pediatric dental benefits and clarifies the requirements for dental coverage in health plans, effective January 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Individuals enrolled in or purchasing health plans through the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange, including children and families needing dental coverage.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's changes to dental coverage requirements may streamline plan offerings and reduce compliance burdens, potentially lowering small business failure rates related to health plan compliance.

Title: Small, Minority, and Women-Owned Businesses Account - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the type of financial assistance that may be provided by eligible fund managers who receive grants from the Small, Minority, and Women-Owned Businesses Account in the Department of Commerce to allow grants of up to $10,000 in conjunction with a loan.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Small, Minority, and Women–Owned Businesses Account managed by the Maryland Department of Commerce, allowing eligible fund managers to provide financial assistance in the form of loans and grants, with specific provisions for disaster and emergency areas, and for clean energy industry businesses.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Small, minority, and women–owned businesses in Maryland, including those affected by disasters or emergencies and those in the clean energy industry.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve access to financial assistance for small, minority, and women–owned businesses, which could help reduce their failure rate by providing targeted funding and support.

Title: Health Insurance – Conformity With Federal Law
Synopsis: Conforming provisions of State health insurance law with existing federal requirements, including updating effective dates for federal regulations, clarifying federal consumer protection regulations resulting from changes to the federal No Surprises Act, altering the material errors that trigger special enrollment periods, and authorizing the Maryland Health Benefits Exchange to adopt an expanded open enrollment period under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland's health insurance laws to conform with federal regulations, including changes to the No Surprises Act, emergency services, and open enrollment periods, and authorizes the Maryland Health Benefits Exchange to expand open enrollment under certain circumstances.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Health Benefits Exchange
stakeholders: Individuals purchasing health insurance in Maryland, including those affected by emergency services, enrollment errors, and open enrollment periods.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions on open enrollment and emergency services are expected to reduce administrative burdens and improve coverage options, potentially lowering small business health plan failure rates.

Title: Property Tax - Submission of Building Permits to Supervisor of Assessments - Estimated Construction Cost
Synopsis: Requiring local permit offices to include a construction cost estimate when submitting a copy of a building permit to the supervisor of assessments of the county where the building is located.
bill_summary: The bill requires local permit offices to include an estimated construction cost when submitting a copy of a building permit to the county supervisor of assessments.
responsible_party: Local permit offices and county supervisors of assessments
stakeholders: Property owners, builders, and local government assessment offices in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By providing accurate construction cost estimates, the bill may help improve property assessment accuracy, potentially reducing disputes and financial issues for small builders and developers.

Title: Insurance - Protections After Loss or Damage to Property
Synopsis: Prohibiting a public adjuster, or anyone acting on behalf of a public adjuster, from soliciting or attempting to solicit a client between the hours of 8:00 p.m. and 8:00 a.m.; altering the statements that are required to be included in a public adjuster contract; altering a certain rescission period for public adjuster contracts; and requiring a public adjuster to provide notice to the Commissioner, in a form and manner the Commissioner determines, within 1 business day after the public adjuster has entered into a contract.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations for public adjusters, including restrictions on solicitation times after a loss, contract requirements, and notice obligations to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner. It also addresses fraudulent practices by contractors related to insurance deductibles.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Insurance policyholders, public adjusters, insurance companies, and contractors involved in property damage claims.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to prevent fraudulent practices and improve transparency, which could reduce small business failures related to insurance claims and contractor fraud.

Title: Baltimore City - Motor Vehicle Off-Street Parking Requirements Near Mass Transit Stations
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City from adopting or enforcing a local law that requires the creation of new motor vehicle off-street parking for a development that includes residential use and that is located within a 0.25-mile radius of a present or planned MARC, Baltimore MTA Light Rail, Red Line, or Metro station.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits Baltimore City from requiring new off-street parking for residential developments within 0.25 miles of certain transit stations, including MARC, Baltimore MTA Light Rail, Red Line, or Metro stations.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Mayor and City Council
stakeholders: Residential developers and residents near transit stations in Baltimore City
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on parking requirements are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Residential Service Agencies - Reimbursement - Personal Assistance Services (Homecare Worker Rights Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Department of Health to reimburse a residential service agency for personal assistance services only if the personal assistance services are provided by an individual classified as an employee.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Health to reimburse residential service agencies for personal assistance services only if those services are provided by individuals classified as employees.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residential service agencies, personal assistance service providers, and individuals receiving personal assistance services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially reduce small business failure by clarifying reimbursement conditions, which may improve financial stability for residential service agencies.

Title: Public Health - Public Health Services and Protections - Revisions
Synopsis: Repealing the exceptions that allow the sale, distribution, or purchase of tobacco products, tobacco paraphernalia, and electronic smoking devices to or for certain individuals who are active duty members of the military; authorizing the Maryland Department of Health to reallocate from one county to another county certain projected unspent grant funding relating to cancer to address certain funding needs; altering the duties of the State Council on Child Abuse and Neglect; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's laws on tobacco and electronic smoking device sales, including raising the minimum purchase age to 21, removing exceptions for active military members, and establishing signage and enforcement strategies. It also revises responsibilities related to child abuse and neglect reporting, funding, and data collection, and reallocates certain grant funds.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services and Policy.
stakeholders: Tobacco and electronic smoking device consumers, especially those under 21 and active military members, children and families involved in child abuse and neglect cases, and local health and law enforcement agencies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions on signage, enforcement, and penalties aim to improve compliance and reduce violations, which can help small retailers avoid legal issues and penalties, potentially decreasing small business failure related to non-compliance.

Title: Motor Vehicle Registration - Exceptions for Golf Carts - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing counties and municipalities to designate certain highways in their respective jurisdictions on which a person may operate a golf cart; authorizing a person with a valid driver's license to operate a golf cart only on a highway with a maximum posted speed limit of not more than 30 miles per hour or 35 miles per hour in Golden Beach Patuxent Knolls, St. Mary's County, between dawn and dusk, and if the golf cart is equipped with certain lighting devices; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to designate specific highways where golf carts can be operated, repeals previous authorizations for golf carts on certain local highways, and clarifies regulations for golf cart operation and registration.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and local county and municipal governments
stakeholders: Golf cart operators, local residents, and visitors in Maryland counties and municipalities
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but clarifies regulations that could impact local businesses involved in golf cart rentals or related services.

Title: Natural Resources - Sale, Barter, or Exchange of Mounted Specimens From Decedent's Estate
Synopsis: Authorizing the sale, barter, or exchange of a legally acquired mounted specimen of a game bird, excluding a migratory game bird, or game mammal, from a decedent's estate and the specimen is part of the personal property being liquidated or distributed.
bill_summary: The bill allows for the sale, barter, or exchange of mounted specimens of game birds or mammals from a decedent's estate under certain conditions, specifically when the original owner is deceased and the specimen is part of the estate being liquidated or distributed.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Estate owners, collectors, and individuals involved in the liquidation or distribution of decedent's personal property containing mounted game specimens.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily clarifies legal conditions for handling mounted specimens from estates rather than providing direct economic support or business development programs.

Title: Public Health - Maryland Pediatric Cancer Fund and Commission
Synopsis: Altering the use of the Maryland Pediatric Cancer Fund to require that the Fund be used only for pediatric cancer research instead of only for pediatric cancer research, prevention, and treatment and to allow funds from the Fund to be used for administrative expenses; and establishing the Pediatric Cancer Research Commission to oversee the award of competitive grants from the Fund and to develop criteria and a process for reviewing grant applications.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Pediatric Cancer Fund to restrict its use solely for pediatric cancer research and administrative expenses, removing the previous allowance for prevention and treatment. It establishes the Pediatric Cancer Research Commission to oversee grant awards from the Fund, sets funding levels, and details the composition and responsibilities of the Commission.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Health, specifically the Secretary of Health, is responsible for implementing the programs, including administering the Fund and overseeing the Pediatric Cancer Research Commission.
stakeholders: Pediatric cancer patients, their families, pediatric cancer researchers, hospitals, laboratories, and educational institutions involved in pediatric cancer research in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on research grants and oversight is unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it primarily involves state-funded research initiatives and a commission overseeing grant awards.

Title: State Employees - Parental Bereavement Leave
Synopsis: Providing that certain State employees are entitled to use up to 10 days of parental bereavement leave with pay within 60 days after the death of the employee's child; providing that certain State employees are entitled to use up to 60 days of parental bereavement leave within 60 days after the employee experiences a stillbirth or the death of the employee's infant; and prohibiting certain State entities from requiring State employees entitled to parental bereavement leave under the Act to use any other paid leave available to the employee.
bill_summary: The bill provides parental bereavement leave with pay for certain State employees in the event of the death of a child or a stillbirth, with specific provisions on the duration and notification requirements.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Department of Personnel and Pensions, specifically the Secretary of the department, is responsible for implementing the regulations governing parental bereavement leave.
stakeholders: State employees in Maryland, including those in the executive, judicial, and legislative branches, as well as employees of public institutions of higher education.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is focused on State employees and does not directly impact small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Property Tax - Transfer to Heir or Legatee - Payment Plans
Synopsis: Exempting a grant of land transferring residential real property from the estate of a decedent to an heir or a legatee of the decedent from certain requirements for the payment of taxes on real property if the heir or legatee of the decedent enters into a payment plan to pay all the taxes due and owed on the property; exempting a grant of land that is subject to a payment plan for property taxes from certain requirements for the payment of taxes if the grantee agrees to assume the grantor's obligations under the payment plan; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allows for property tax payment plans for residential real property transferred from a decedent to an heir or legatee, exempts such transfers from certain tax payment requirements if a payment plan is entered into, and authorizes counties and municipal governments to establish installment payment programs for delinquent property taxes and taxes in arrears.
responsible_party: The Department of Assessments and Taxation, county and municipal tax collectors, and the State Tax Sale Ombudsman.
stakeholders: Homeowners, heirs, and legatees of decedents, especially those transferring residential property, and residents with delinquent or in-arrears property taxes.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets residential property transfers and homeowner tax payment assistance, with no direct provisions affecting small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Commission on Veterans and Military Families
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Commission on Veterans and Military Families to study developing and implementing a statewide strategic plan to make Maryland the best state for veterans and military families, including legislative and budgetary recommendations; requiring the Commission to consult with the Office of Military and Federal Affairs and the Maryland Military Installation Council as part of the study process; and requiring the Commission to report its findings to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Commission on Veterans and Military Families to develop a strategic plan to make Maryland the best state for veterans and military families, including making recommendations on legislation and budgets.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs and the Maryland Commission on Veterans and Military Families.
stakeholders: Veterans, military families, military service members, and organizations advocating for these groups in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but the strategic plan may include workforce development and health care initiatives that could indirectly support small businesses.

Title: Rehabilitation Services - Disability - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "disability" relating to the provision of rehabilitation services in the State to align with the federal Rehabilitation Act of 1973; and defining "disability" as any physical or mental impairment that constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment or independent living.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'disability' in Maryland's education law to align with federal standards, clarifying that it includes physical or mental impairments that substantially impede employment or independent living.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Individuals with physical or mental impairments seeking rehabilitation services and employment support in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on disability and rehabilitation services does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: State Employee Rights and Protections - Personnel Actions and Harassment - Investigation of Complaints
Synopsis: Increasing, from 30 days to 60 days, the time period during which an investigation must be conducted and a written decision must be issued regarding a complaint filed by an applicant or employee alleging discrimination or harassment by an employer; and authorizing certain applicants and employees to provide written authorization to increase by an additional 30 days the time period during which an investigation of a complaint and a written decision must be completed.
bill_summary: The bill extends the investigation period for complaints of discrimination or harassment filed by state employees from 30 days to 60 days, with an option to extend by an additional 30 days if the employee provides written authorization.
responsible_party: State Personnel and Pensions Department
stakeholders: State employees who file complaints of discrimination or harassment
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Property Tax - Credit for Dwelling House of Disabled Veterans - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering eligibility for a certain property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax on the dwelling house of certain disabled veterans to include individuals who have been declared by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs to have a nonpermanent service-connected disability of 100% that results from blindness or any other disabling cause; authorizing a county or municipal corporation, notwithstanding certain provisions of the Act, to enact a law limiting eligibility for the tax credit; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to expand eligibility for a property tax credit for disabled veterans by including those with a nonpermanent, service-connected disability rating of 100%, and allows local governments to limit eligibility further if they choose.
responsible_party: The governing body of each county or municipal corporation in Maryland responsible for enacting laws to grant the property tax credit.
stakeholders: Disabled veterans and their families in Maryland, particularly those with nonpermanent, service-connected disabilities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates; it focuses on property tax credits for disabled veterans.

Title: Property Tax Credits - Public School Employees, Health and Safety Improvements, and Property Used for Local Housing Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a certain property tax credit for certain residential real property owned by a public school employee under certain circumstances; authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a certain property tax credit for certain buildings if the owner made certain health or safety improvements on or after July 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local governments in Maryland to grant property tax credits for certain residential properties, including those owned by public school employees, buildings that have made health or safety improvements, and properties used for local housing programs for homeless individuals or families.
responsible_party: The governing bodies of Baltimore City, counties, or municipal corporations in Maryland.
stakeholders: Public school employees, residents of apartment and condominium buildings, owners of buildings used for local housing programs, and homeless individuals or families.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets residential properties and public employees, with no direct provisions aimed at small business failure reduction.

Title: Insurance - Penalties - Unauthorized Insurers, Insurance Producers, and Public Adjusters
Synopsis: Altering the maximum civil penalty to which an unauthorized insurer or person that violates certain provisions of State insurance law is subject for each violation; and altering the maximum civil penalty that the Maryland Insurance Commissioner may impose, in addition to suspending or revoking the license, on the holder of an insurance producer license or a public adjuster licensee for each violation of State insurance law.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum civil penalties for violations by unauthorized insurers and insurance licensees, and modifies enforcement provisions related to licensing, misconduct, and penalties for insurance professionals in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Insurance companies, insurance producers, public adjusters, and consumers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on penalties and enforcement may improve the integrity of the insurance market, indirectly supporting small business stability, but it does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Continuing Care Retirement Communities - Transparency, Grievances, and Unit Reoccupancy
Synopsis: Requiring a provider to post the provider's most recent disclosure statement on the provider's website; increasing from yearly to quarterly the number of times a provider is required to hold a meeting open to all the provider's subscribers; requiring at the last quarterly meeting of the year an officer of the provider to give an aggregated, deidentified summary of internal grievances; requiring a provider to submit a written report to a subscriber or a beneficiary if the subscriber's unit has not been reoccupied within 9 months; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances transparency, governance, grievance procedures, and unit reoccupancy policies for Continuing Care Retirement Communities in Maryland, including requirements for disclosure statements, governing body composition, and refund processes.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Residents of Continuing Care Retirement Communities and their families in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions aim to improve operational transparency and resident relations, which could reduce small business failures in the senior housing sector by fostering better governance and resident trust.

Title: Higher Education - Teacher Development and Retention Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "institution of initial eligibility" to include community colleges as eligible institutions as part of the criteria for applicants for the Teacher Development and Retention Program; altering the evaluation requirements for the Program; requiring the Higher Education Commission to conduct an evaluation of the effectiveness of the Program and report the results to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 1, 2030; and altering the termination date from June 30, 2029 to June 30, 2030.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Maryland Teacher Development and Retention Program to include community colleges as eligible institutions, extends the program's duration, and authorizes the use of the Teacher Development and Retention Fund for administrative expenses. It aims to incentivize students to pursue teaching careers, especially in high-need areas, through stipends and service commitments.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Department of Education and the Maryland Higher Education Commission are responsible for implementing the program and managing the fund.
stakeholders: Prospective teachers, students at community colleges and higher education institutions, and students in high-need schools in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is focused on teacher development and retention, not directly on small business support, so its impact on small business failure rates is likely minimal.

Title: Health Occupations - Pharmacists - Administration of Vaccines
Synopsis: Authorizing a pharmacist to order and administer certain vaccinations to individuals in certain age groups if certain requirements are met; altering the vaccinations that a pharmacist can administer to individuals at least 3 years old; and altering the circumstances under which a pharmacist may administer certain vaccinations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes pharmacists in Maryland to order and administer certain vaccines, including influenza, COVID-19, and others in response to public health emergencies, to individuals as young as 3 or 5 years old under specified conditions, with training and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy and Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals of all ages in Maryland, especially children and adults receiving vaccinations from pharmacists
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By expanding pharmacists' authority to administer vaccines, the bill may help increase vaccination rates and reduce barriers to healthcare, potentially lowering small business failure related to health crises.

Title: Maryland Environmental Service – Governance and Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of the Board of Directors of the Maryland Environmental Service to delegate certain responsibilities to an employee of the Service; altering the obligations of the Service after receiving a request for services and after entering into a contract;  requiring that an audit be made of the financial books, records, and accounts of the Service by November 15 each year; and requiring the Service to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on its activities by November 15 each year.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the governance, reporting, and operational procedures of the Maryland Environmental Service, including adjusting quorum requirements, delegation of responsibilities, and reporting deadlines.
responsible_party: The Maryland Environmental Service and its Board of Directors, with oversight and approval from the Secretary of Natural Resources.
stakeholders: The Maryland Environmental Service, local governments, and the general public who rely on the services provided by the Maryland Environmental Service.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill facilitates the Service's ability to enter into contracts with municipalities and persons, potentially streamlining operations and reducing financial uncertainties for small businesses involved.

Title: Hospitals and Urgent Care Centers - Sepsis Protocol (Lochlin's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring, on or before January 1, 2025, each hospital and urgent care center in the State to implement an evidence-based protocol for the early recognition and treatment of a patient with sepsis, severe sepsis, or septic shock that is based on generally acceptable standards of care; requiring a specialty psychiatric hospital to establish a certain process; and requiring hospitals and urgent care centers to require periodic training in the implementation of the protocol for certain staff.
bill_summary: The bill requires all hospitals and urgent care centers in Maryland to implement evidence-based protocols for early recognition and treatment of sepsis, severe sepsis, and septic shock by January 1, 2025. It mandates staff training, adherence to CDC guidelines, and data collection for quality improvement.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Hospitals, urgent care centers, and patients with sepsis in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: While primarily focused on healthcare protocols, the bill may indirectly support small healthcare providers by standardizing sepsis care, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Public and Nonpublic Schools - Bronchodilators - Use, Availability, Training, and Policies
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education, in consultation with certain groups, to develop training for certain school personnel to identify symptoms of anaphylaxis, asthma, and respiratory distress in students; requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with county boards, and authorizing nonpublic schools to establish a policy to obtain, administer, and train certain school personnel to administer emergency bronchodilators to a student who is determined to be, or is perceived to be, experiencing asthma-related symptoms; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes public and nonpublic schools in Maryland to establish policies allowing trained school personnel to administer auto-injectable epinephrine and bronchodilators to students experiencing severe allergic reactions, asthma, or respiratory distress. It also mandates training for school staff, outlines procedures for emergency response, and provides for funding and liability protections.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health and licensed healthcare providers.
stakeholders: Students with allergies, asthma, or respiratory issues; school nurses and personnel; parents and guardians of students; schools and school districts in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions for grants and donations to fund the purchase of emergency medications, which could help schools manage health emergencies more effectively, potentially reducing disruptions and associated costs that could contribute to small business failures.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Immediate Vesting
Synopsis: Providing that an individual serving as the State Superintendent of Schools shall immediately vest in the State Retirement and Pension System.
bill_summary: The bill provides that the State Superintendent of Schools shall immediately vest in the State Retirement and Pension System upon taking office.
responsible_party: State Retirement Agency and the Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: The State Superintendent of Schools and the employees of the State Retirement and Pension System
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Insurance - Hearing Representation
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Insurance Commissioner to allow corporations, partnerships, limited liability companies, and sole proprietorships that are small employers to be represented by certain authorized individuals rather than an attorney in certain hearings held by the Commissioner.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Insurance Commissioner to allow small business entities that are small employers to be represented by authorized individuals other than attorneys during certain hearings.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Small business entities classified as small employers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By allowing small businesses to be represented by designated individuals rather than attorneys, the bill aims to make hearing processes more accessible and less costly, potentially reducing business failures related to insurance disputes.

Title: Resources and Education for All Prisons (REAP) Act
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to assist incarcerated individuals in accessing federal Pell Grants for higher education; requiring the Department to set goals for the number of incarcerated individuals in postsecondary education programs, establish tracking systems for their progress in postsecondary education programs, and forward certain data to the Maryland Higher Education Commission; requiring the Commission to assist the Department in establishing the tracking systems; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to assist incarcerated individuals in accessing federal Pell Grants and to establish tracking systems for their participation and progress in postsecondary education programs within correctional facilities. It also involves collaboration with higher education institutions and allocates funding for marketing and tracking systems.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals in Maryland correctional facilities seeking higher education opportunities
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Landlord and Tenant - Termination of Residential Lease - Limitation of Liability for Rent
Synopsis: Limiting a tenant's liability for rent to not more than 2 months' rent after the date on which the tenant vacates a leased premises if a physician or psychologist completes a form specifying that the tenant has a mental disorder, the management of which is substantially limited by the leased premises.
bill_summary: The bill limits a tenant’s liability for unpaid rent if a licensed healthcare professional certifies that the tenant has a certain disability or medical condition that affects their ability to live in the leased premises, and the tenant vacates the property.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Tenants with disabilities or medical conditions that impact their ability to live in their leased premises
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily affects tenant-landlord legal liabilities and healthcare certification processes.

Title: Correctional Services - Inmate Employment - Agricultural Work
Synopsis: Repealing the authority of the Division of Correction to arrange for inmates not needed or being used by the State Highway Administration to perform emergency road work to be employed in agricultural work during any part of the year at a camp in Queen Anne's County or any other county with a similar camp.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the authority of the Maryland Division of Correction to employ inmates in agricultural work in certain camps, removing the previous provisions that allowed such employment and related activities.
responsible_party: Division of Correction, Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Inmates in correctional facilities, agricultural employers, and the general public interested in prison labor policies
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's repeal of inmate agricultural employment authority is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Health - Newborn Screening Program - Implementation of Testing
Synopsis: Repealing a certain requirement related to the inclusion of a core condition in the system for newborn screening; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to implement testing for a core condition listed in the Recommended Uniform Screening Panel within a certain time period after the core condition is added to the Panel; authorizing the Department to screen for any condition recommended by the Advisory Council and approved by the Secretary; requiring the Department to implement testing for Krabbe leukodystrophy at a certain time; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's newborn screening program to include testing for Krabbe leukodystrophy within a specified timeframe after federal recommendations are issued. It repeals previous requirements for approval timelines and mandates implementation of testing for conditions on the federal Recommended Uniform Screening Panel, including Krabbe disease.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Newborn infants in Maryland and their families, healthcare providers, hospitals, and laboratories involved in newborn screening
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by establishing standardized protocols and potentially reducing health complications, it may indirectly support small healthcare providers involved in screening.

Title: Baby Food - Toxic Heavy Metals - Testing and Labeling (Rudy's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning January 1, 2025, manufacturers of baby food to test a representative sample of each production aggregate of the manufacturer's final baby food product for certain toxic heavy metals; requiring, beginning January 1, 2026, manufacturers of baby food to make certain information related to the testing and a link to certain guidance available on the manufacturer's website; requiring a consumer to report to the Maryland Department of Health if the consumer believes that baby food is being sold with toxic heavy metals; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires baby food manufacturers in Maryland to test their products for toxic heavy metals before sale, disclose test results on their websites and labels, and provide QR codes linking to health information. Consumers can report products they believe exceed safety limits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Parents and caregivers of babies and young children in Maryland, baby food manufacturers, and consumers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's requirements for testing and reporting may increase compliance costs for small baby food manufacturers, but it aims to ensure product safety and consumer trust, potentially reducing product recalls and failures.

Title: Criminal Law – Sexual Solicitation of a Minor Through Child Pornography – Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting an individual from knowingly and with a certain intent soliciting a minor or law enforcement officer posing as a minor to engage in certain prohibited sexual acts with the minor by a certain means.
bill_summary: The bill enhances laws against soliciting minors for sexual acts through electronic means and expands prohibitions related to child pornography and sexual conduct involving minors, including solicitation and distribution of obscene material.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, Maryland State Police, or the Maryland Attorney General's Office
stakeholders: Minors, law enforcement agencies, and the general public concerned with child protection and online safety
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Motorcycles - Passenger Restrictions
Synopsis: Requiring a rear passenger on a motorcycle to be able to firmly position the passenger's feet on the footrests of the motorcycle, subject to an exception for permanent physical disability.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to require motorcycle passengers to be able to firmly place their feet on the footrests, with an exception for passengers with permanent disabilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (MVA) and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Motorcycle riders and passengers in Maryland, especially those with disabilities
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Dental Services - Coverage and Rate Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to study the feasibility of including removable full and partial dentures and setting adequate reimbursement rates for providers on a per-patient basis for house calls and extended care facility calls among the coverage offered by the Maryland Healthy Smiles Dental Program; and requiring the Department to report its findings from the study to the Senate Finance Committee and the House Health and Government Operations Committee by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to study the feasibility of expanding dental coverage and adjusting reimbursement rates under the Maryland Healthy Smiles Dental Program, including coverage for dentures and provider house calls, and to report findings by December 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Low-income populations in Maryland who rely on Medicaid dental services and dental care providers participating in the program.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates but aims to improve dental care access and provider reimbursement, which could indirectly support dental practices.

Title: Drunk Driving Offenses - Expungement and the Ignition Interlock System Program
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to file a petition for expungement of certain records relating to a probation before judgment for driving while impaired or driving while under the influence; requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to require persons convicted of or granted probation before judgment for certain criminal offenses related to driving while impaired by alcohol, a drug, drug combination, or a combination of drugs and alcohol to participate in the Ignition Interlock System Program for certain periods of time; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes expungement of certain records related to probation before judgment for specific drunk driving offenses and mandates participation in the Ignition Interlock System Program for certain offenders convicted of or granted probation for drunk driving. It also establishes reporting requirements for the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (MVA) and the courts
stakeholders: Individuals convicted of or granted probation for drunk driving offenses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by streamlining legal processes and reporting, it may indirectly support economic stability.

Title: Baltimore County Board of Education - Nonstudent Member Compensation and Student Member Scholarships - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the annual compensation of certain nonstudent members of the Baltimore County Board of Education from $7,500 to $16,500; providing that the chair of the county board is entitled to receive $17,500 annually as compensation; and increasing the amount that a student member of the board is granted for a certain scholarship from $7,500 to $10,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual compensation for nonstudent members of the Baltimore County Board of Education, including the chair, and raises the scholarship amount for student members upon completing a full term.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of Education
stakeholders: Members of the Baltimore County Board of Education and student members of the board
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Natural Resources - Submerged Aquatic Vegetation - Alteration or Removal Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing certain persons to alter certain submerged aquatic vegetation in a certain manner and in accordance with certain requirements; authorizing a public utility company or telecommunications carrier to alter certain submerged aquatic vegetation in a certain manner and in accordance with certain requirements; and altering certain requirements related to the alteration or removal of certain submerged aquatic vegetation.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain persons, including public utility companies and telecommunications carriers, to alter submerged aquatic vegetation in Maryland's tidal waters under specific conditions and requirements, streamlining the process for maintenance and utility work while maintaining environmental protections.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Property owners, utility companies, telecommunications carriers, environmental groups, and the general public using Maryland's tidal waters.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies the process for utility companies and telecommunications carriers to maintain submerged aquatic vegetation, potentially reducing delays and costs associated with environmental permitting, which could help prevent small business failures in these sectors.

Title: Persons Doing Public Business – Disclosure Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring a person to file a registration statement with the State Board of Elections within a certain time period after the award of a contract that causes the person to be doing public business; requiring persons doing public business to update information on beneficial ownership included in the registration statement in accordance with regulations adopted by the State Board; altering the time at which a person doing public business is required to file a certain initial statement with the State Board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires persons doing public business with the Maryland government to file registration and beneficial ownership disclosures, update this information regularly, and certify filings when awarded contracts. It also mandates governmental entities to verify and report these filings, and repeals certain existing business filing requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and the Maryland Department of General Services (or equivalent state agencies responsible for procurement and disclosures)
stakeholders: Businesses doing public business with the Maryland government, government agencies, and the general public interested in transparency and accountability.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on transparency and disclosure requirements, which may indirectly support small business success by promoting fair practices, but it does not explicitly aim to reduce small business failure rates.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Horse Riding - Helmet Requirement for Minors
Synopsis: Prohibiting an adult from allowing certain minors to ride a horse, donkey, mule, or pony on a highway, a public horse-riding path, or the grounds of a facility for which the primary purpose is recreational, educational, therapeutic, or competitive equestrian activities unless the minor is wearing a properly secured helmet that meets or exceeds the standards of the American Society of Testing and Materials for protective headgear used in equestrian riding.
bill_summary: The bill requires that minors riding horses on certain properties must wear helmets that meet specific safety standards, and prohibits adults from allowing minors to ride without helmets under these conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local authorities responsible for enforcing vehicle and safety laws.
stakeholders: Minors who ride horses on public or private property, horse owners, and supervisors of minors involved in horseback riding.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Victims' Rights - Notification of Release From Confinement (Jaycee Webster Victims' Rights Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a certain commitment unit to include in a notification given to a victim, victim's representative, or witness regarding the release from confinement of a sentenced defendant or child respondent the telephone number of the Maryland Crime Victims Resource Center.
bill_summary: The bill requires a commitment unit to include the telephone number of the Maryland Crime Victims Resource Center when notifying victims, witnesses, or their representatives about the release from confinement of a defendant or child respondent.
responsible_party: The Maryland Crime Victims Resource Center and the commitment units within the criminal justice system.
stakeholders: Victims, witnesses, and their representatives involved in criminal cases in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Department of Natural Resources - Maryland Geological Survey Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Geological Survey Fund to finance certain direct and indirect costs, including long-term budgeting and planning for survey projects, procurements, and equipment purchases; establishing the Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund in the Department of Natural Resources; and requiring interest earnings of the Fund to be credited to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Geological Survey Fund as a nonlapsing fund within the Department of Natural Resources to finance geological surveys, mapping, and resource assessment activities, with interest earnings credited to the fund.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Geologists, environmental agencies, researchers, and the public interested in Maryland's geology and natural resources.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by funding geological surveys and resource assessments, it may indirectly support industries reliant on geological data.

Title: Public Health - Giving Infants a Future Without Transmission (GIFT) Act
Synopsis: Altering certain HIV and syphilis reporting and testing requirements for hospitals and health care providers for pregnant women and newborns; providing that certain documents related to certain HIV and syphilis reports are not discoverable and are not admissible in evidence in any criminal or administrative action; and altering certain penalties related to the disclosure of personal identifying health information acquired for the purpose of HIV and AIDS reporting under certain provisions of law.
bill_summary: The GIFT Act updates Maryland's HIV and syphilis testing and reporting requirements for healthcare providers and hospitals, including confidentiality protections, testing procedures for pregnant women and newborns, and penalties for unauthorized disclosure of health information.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and local health departments
stakeholders: Pregnant women, newborns, healthcare providers, hospitals, and public health agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on public health reporting and confidentiality, with no direct provisions aimed at reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation - Loans
Synopsis: Altering a certain loan program to authorize the Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation to provide loans of up to $10,000 for each seasonal full-time job; expanding eligibility for the Maryland Watermen's Microloan Program within the Corporation to include, starting July 1, 2025, individuals who are residents of the State and hold a commercial fishing license to catch finfish, crabs, clams, or oysters issued by the Potomac River Fisheries Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Maryland Watermen’s Microloan Program to include residents with certain commercial fishing licenses, and authorizes the Maryland Agricultural and Resource–Based Industry Development Corporation to provide loans to support seafood processing projects and watermen. It also modifies loan terms and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Agricultural and Resource–Based Industry Development Corporation
stakeholders: Commercial fishermen, seafood processing businesses, and residents involved in commercial fishing in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides targeted loans and support to watermen and seafood businesses, which can help reduce business failures in the seafood industry.

Title: Division of Parole and Probation - Criteria for Earned Compliance Credit - Exception for Supervision Fees
Synopsis: Altering a certain condition regarding the payment of certain restitution, fines, and fees that a certain supervised individual must satisfy to accrue certain earned compliance credit while under the supervision of the Division of Parole and Probation in the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the criteria for earning compliance credits for individuals under supervision by the Division of Parole and Probation, specifically excluding the requirement to be current on supervision fees for earning credits. It also clarifies the assessment and payment of supervision fees for supervised individuals.
responsible_party: Division of Parole and Probation, Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals under supervision by the Division of Parole and Probation in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns supervision and fee payment criteria for individuals under correctional supervision.

Title: Courts – Military Records – Recordation and Inspection
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law relating to the recordation and inspection of certain military records kept by the clerk of a circuit court to authorize the clerk to keep an electronic record instead of a book to record and index the discharge papers of a person who has served in the uniformed services of the United States; and requiring the clerk to deny inspection of the electronic record except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill modifies laws regarding the recordation and inspection of military discharge records kept by Maryland circuit courts, including provisions for redacting social security numbers and conditions for inspection and copying.
responsible_party: Clerk of the circuit court of each Maryland county
stakeholders: Military veterans, their families, legal professionals, and government agencies involved in legal proceedings
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to military record management.

Title: Public Health - Nonoccupational Postexposure Prophylaxis (nPEP) Standing Order Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Nonoccupational Postexposure Prophylaxis (nPEP) Standing Order Program to authorize pharmacists to dispense nPEP under certain circumstances; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to adopt regulations necessary for the administration of the Program and that address the needs of certain populations, including victims of sexual assault and pediatric patients; and authorizing the Department to administer the Program, collect certain fees, and establish guidelines for training related to the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Nonoccupational Postexposure Prophylaxis (nPEP) Standing Order Program in Maryland, allowing pharmacists and certain healthcare providers to dispense nPEP medications under specific guidelines to reduce HIV transmission after potential exposure.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals at risk of HIV exposure, including victims of sexual assault and injection drug users
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is designed to streamline access to HIV prevention medication, which could reduce healthcare costs and improve public health outcomes, potentially decreasing small business failures related to health crises.

Title: Housing Development Permit Applications - Local Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring local jurisdictions with at least 150,000 residents to report certain information for each building or development permit application that includes a residential housing component as part of the development to the Department of Housing and Community Development and the Department of Planning on or before July 1 each year; and requiring a local jurisdiction to make a copy of the report publicly available on its website.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland local jurisdictions with at least 150,000 residents to annually report detailed data on building and development permit applications that include residential components. These reports must be made publicly available on the jurisdiction's website or through other reasonable means.
responsible_party: Local jurisdictions with at least 150,000 residents, Department of Housing and Community Development, Department of Planning
stakeholders: Residents, developers, and local government agencies involved in housing development and permitting processes in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By increasing transparency and streamlining reporting requirements for housing development permits, the bill aims to facilitate smoother approval processes, which could help small developers succeed and reduce their risk of failure.

Title: Employment Standards, Prevailing Wage, and Living Wage - Employer Adverse Actions and Enforcement
Synopsis: Prohibiting employers from taking or threatening to take adverse action against an employee because the employee takes certain actions regarding rights and responsibilities, complaints, investigations, proceedings, or hearings; authorizing the Commissioner of Labor and Industry, within 90 days after receipt of a written complaint, to investigate a violation and attempt to resolve the issue informally through mediation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits employers from taking adverse actions against employees for exercising their rights under certain employment laws, such as making complaints or participating in investigations. It establishes procedures for investigations, enforcement, and penalties for violations, including protections against malicious complaints.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Industry, specifically the Commissioner of Labor and Industry
stakeholders: Employees and employers in Maryland, particularly those involved in employment rights, complaints, and investigations under employment standards laws.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on protecting employee rights and enforcing employment standards, which may indirectly support small business stability by ensuring fair practices and compliance, but it does not specifically target small business failure reduction.

Title: Civil Actions - Civil Immunity - Educator Intervention
Synopsis: Providing that a member of the administrative, educational, or support staff of any public, private, or parochial school, acting in an official capacity, is not civilly liable for personal injury or property damage resulting from intervention in a student altercation or other student disturbance if the staff member intervened in a reasonably prudent manner and the actions taken do not constitute grossly negligent, willful, wanton, or intentionally tortious conduct.
bill_summary: The bill grants civil immunity to school staff members who intervene in student altercations or disturbances, protecting them from liability for personal injury or property damage if their actions are reasonable and not grossly negligent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and local school districts
stakeholders: School staff, students, and school communities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts school staff and does not directly relate to small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Landlord and Tenant - Notice of Utility Bills in Residential Leases - Gas and Electric Services
Synopsis: Adding gas and electric utility services to the types of services for which landlords of buildings that contain six or more residential units are required to provide a written notice to a tenant, before the initiation of a lease and each term thereafter, notifying the tenant of the total utility costs billed to the landlord in the immediately preceding year, disaggregated by utility type; and applying certain requirements relating to payment of utility services to landlords of buildings that contain five or fewer residential dwelling units.
bill_summary: The bill requires landlords to accept financial assistance from the Office of Home Energy Programs for utility costs paid by tenants, and mandates landlords to provide tenants with utility bill information and documentation necessary for eligibility for assistance. It also extends certain notice requirements about utility costs to landlords of buildings with more than five units.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services, Office of Home Energy Programs
stakeholders: Tenants paying utility bills, landlords of residential buildings, utility service providers, and the Department of Human Services
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts residential landlords and tenants, with minimal direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Condominiums - Sales Contracts - Asbestos Disclosure
Synopsis: Establishing the unenforceability of contracts for the sale of condominium units that do not contain a statement by the vendor or unit owner as to whether the vendor or unit owner has actual knowledge of the presence of asbestos in the condominium, including a description of the location of the asbestos, whether abatement has been performed, and the date of any abatement.
bill_summary: The bill requires that contracts for the sale or resale of condominium units include specific notices about the presence of asbestos, including details about asbestos location, abatement, and knowledge of the seller or council of unit owners. It also establishes that contracts lacking this information are unenforceable.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development (or relevant state housing agency)
stakeholders: Condominium owners, prospective buyers, and the council of unit owners in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts real estate transactions and does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Public Employee Relations Act – Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of the Public Employee Relations Act, including adding the definition of interested employee organization, altering the timing of exclusive representative access to new employees, clarifying the responsibilities of certain deputy directors, and clarifying the process for certain investigations of unfair labor practices.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the Public Employee Relations Act, including defining interested employee organizations, adjusting notification timelines for new employees, clarifying responsibilities of deputy directors, and updating procedures for unfair labor practice investigations.
responsible_party: The Public Employee Relations Board and its deputy directors.
stakeholders: Public employees, employee organizations, and public employers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on labor relations and does not directly address small business failure rates, so its impact on small business failure is minimal or indirect.

Title: Health Occupations Boards – Reciprocal Licensure and Certification
Synopsis: Authorizing certain health occupations boards to adopt regulations establishing reciprocity for individuals licensed or certified in another state.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain health occupations boards in Maryland to establish reciprocity regulations, allowing individuals licensed or certified in other states with similar requirements to obtain licensure or certification in Maryland.
responsible_party: Health Occupations Boards in Maryland
stakeholders: Health professionals seeking licensure or certification in Maryland from other states
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could reduce barriers for health professionals to practice in Maryland, potentially decreasing small business failure among health clinics and practices that employ such professionals.

Title: Tobacco Tax Stamp Refunds - Loss Due to Theft
Synopsis: Authorizing a claimant who buys tobacco tax stamps to receive a refund for tobacco tax stamps affixed to stolen property; requiring the claimant to provide the Comptroller with certain documentation when making a claim for a refund; and providing for a fine for making a false claim of double the amount of any tax refund in addition to any other authorized penalties.
bill_summary: The bill allows claimants who purchase tobacco tax stamps to receive refunds if the stamps are stolen, provided they submit police reports and notarized affidavits. It also establishes penalties for false claims and requires notification if stolen property is recovered.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Tobacco retailers and businesses that purchase tobacco tax stamps in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small businesses recover losses from stolen tax stamps, potentially reducing financial failures related to theft.

Title: Medical Records - Destruction - Notice and Retrieval
