Synopsis: Extending the time period from 5 to 7 years during which a health care provider is prohibited from destroying medical records and laboratory and X-ray reports; requiring that the notice required to be provided regarding the destruction of medical records be made to the last known e-mail address of the patient or the parent or guardian of a minor; requiring a health care provider to make a medical record available for retrieval by a patient or a parent or guardian of a minor within a certain time period and at a certain location; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the period during which medical records and reports cannot be destroyed without patient or guardian authorization, requiring notifications via email and providing access for retrieval before destruction. It also updates procedures for record destruction and related regulations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland State Medical Society, along with healthcare providers and facilities.
stakeholders: Patients, including minors and their guardians, and healthcare providers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By establishing clear procedures and regulations for medical record destruction, the bill aims to reduce legal and compliance risks for healthcare providers, potentially decreasing small business failure related to record-keeping issues.

Title: Charles County Board of Education - Vacancy Procedures - Timing and Video Streaming and Archiving
Synopsis: Requiring the Charles County Board of Education to fill a vacancy on the county board within 90 days after the vacancy occurs; authorizing the Board to choose not to fill a vacancy that occurs in an election year for a seat that is vacant; and requiring the county board to make publicly available through its website live video streaming and complete video recordings of public meetings during which the county board conducts interviews of applicants for a vacancy on the county board.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Charles County Board of Education to fill vacancies within 90 days (or 60 days under certain circumstances), make applicant information and meeting recordings publicly available online, and improve transparency in the vacancy process.
responsible_party: Charles County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, and residents of Charles County interested in local education governance
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Medical Records - Fees - Attorneys Representing Patients
Synopsis: Adding an attorney representing a patient to the list of individuals to whom a health care provider is prohibited from charging a fee for providing copies of a medical record that will be used for the purpose of filing a claim regarding or appealing a denial of Social Security disability income or Social Security benefits.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits health care providers from charging fees for copies of medical records requested by certain individuals, including attorneys representing patients, when the records are used for Social Security disability or benefits claims or appeals.
responsible_party: Health care providers in Maryland
stakeholders: Patients, attorneys representing patients, and individuals applying for Social Security disability or benefits
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily addresses medical record fee policies.

Title: Homeowners' and Homestead Property Tax Credits - Application Filing Deadline - Extension
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to accept an application for the homeowners' property tax credit submitted by a homeowner within 3 years after April 15 of the taxable year for which the credit is sought if the homeowner is enrolled in the Homeowner Protection Program; and providing for the calculation of the homestead property tax credit for certain homeowners under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill extends the deadline for certain homeowners, especially seniors and those enrolled in the Homeowner Protection Program, to apply for the Maryland homeowners' property tax credit, and modifies how the credit is calculated for those who missed previous application deadlines.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners in Maryland, particularly seniors aged 70 and older, and homeowners enrolled in the Homeowner Protection Program
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts homeowners and does not directly address small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Common Ownership Communities - Electric Vehicle Recharging Equipment (Electric Vehicle Recharging Equipment Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements for procedures relating to electric vehicle recharging equipment; establishing requirements and procedures relating to an application to the governing body of a cooperative housing corporation to install or use electric vehicle recharging equipment; and requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to publish information on its common ownership community website regarding requirements, contractor information, certain points of contact, and resources on dispute resolutions.
bill_summary: The bill updates laws regarding electric vehicle recharging equipment in common ownership communities such as condominiums, cooperatives, and homeowners associations. It establishes procedures for approval, installation, and insurance requirements, and mandates the Department of Housing and Community Development to provide information and resources on its website.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents and members of common ownership communities, including condominium, cooperative, and homeowners association members.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides clear procedures and resources for installing electric vehicle recharging equipment, which can help small businesses and contractors involved in installation and maintenance to operate more effectively and reduce failure risks.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Driver's Licenses, Learner's Instructional Permits, and Identification Cards
Synopsis: Exempting certain applicants for identification cards who present certain documentation from the issuance fee for the identification card; extending the term of certain learner's instructional permits from 180 days to 1 year after the date of issuance; and establishing that certain driver's licenses issued to certain holders by the Motor Vehicle Administration remain in full force and effect during an absence from the State.
bill_summary: The bill makes several changes to Maryland's vehicle and identification laws, including waiving certain fees for specific applicants, extending the validity of learner's permits, and allowing certain driver's licenses to remain valid during military or federal service absences.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (MVA)
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland applying for identification cards, drivers, military personnel, and federal employees
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but streamlines processes that could indirectly benefit small businesses by simplifying identification and licensing procedures.

Title: Local Government – Annual Audit Reporting Requirements – Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring 20% of certain State aid for highway user revenues and disparity grants to be discontinued if a county, municipality, or special taxing district does not submit a certain audit report within 2 calendar years after the deadline for the report, subject to a certain condition; and applying the Act beginning with the fiscal year 2024 audits that are required to be submitted under certain provisions of law.
bill_summary: The bill requires local governments in Maryland to submit annual financial and audit reports on time. If they fail to do so within specified deadlines, their state aid can be reduced or discontinued, especially if the delays extend beyond 132 days after the deadline.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services and the Comptroller of Maryland
stakeholders: Local governments such as counties, municipalities, and special taxing districts in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts local government financial reporting and does not directly target small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Department of State Police - Professional Occupations - Application Process
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of State Police to determine the manner and format for applications for certification as a private detective, security guard, security systems technician, and railroad police officer and for a license to provide security guard services; altering the application requirements related to security guard agency, private detective agency, and security systems agency licenses and commercial general liability insurance; requiring an applicant for a special police commission to submit two sets of fingerprints; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of State Police to determine application formats and requirements for various security and law enforcement professional licenses, including private detectives, security guards, security systems technicians, and railroad police officers. It also updates application procedures, fees, fingerprinting, and renewal processes for these roles.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police
stakeholders: Individuals and firms seeking licenses or certifications as private detectives, security guards, security systems technicians, and railroad police officers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill streamlines licensing and renewal processes, which could reduce administrative burdens and delays for small security and law enforcement-related businesses, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Vehicle Towing or Removal - Insurer of Record - Electronic Notification
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who undertakes the towing or removal of a vehicle from a parking lot to notify the insurer of record electronically if that form of notice is agreed to by the tower and the insurer of record in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes towing or removal companies in Maryland to notify the insurer of record electronically after towing a vehicle, if both parties agree to this method.
responsible_party: Towing or removal companies and insurers in Maryland
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, insurers, towing companies, and secured parties in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could reduce administrative burdens and improve efficiency for towing companies, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Hospitals - Care of Infants After Discharge (Safe Sleep Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring a hospital, as soon as practicable before discharging an infant after the birth of the infant, to provide oral and written resources to the parent or legal guardian; requiring a hospital, before discharging an infant, to ask the parent or legal guardian to describe the sleep environment that will be provided at home; requiring, by January 1, 2025, each hospital to establish a process for providing resources and information about safe sleep environments to parents and legal guardians of infants;  etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland hospitals to provide educational resources and confirm receipt of safe sleep environment instructions to parents or guardians before discharging an infant. It also mandates the development of resource lists for parents and guardians to ensure safe sleep practices for infants.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and hospitals in Maryland
stakeholders: Parents or legal guardians of newborns, infants, hospitals, and healthcare providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts hospitals and healthcare providers by establishing new educational and record-keeping requirements, which are unlikely to significantly affect small business failure rates.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Disabled Veteran Registration Plates - Issuance
Synopsis: Authorizing the Motor Vehicle Administration to issue certain special disabled veteran registration plates to disabled veterans who are between 50% and 99%, inclusive, service-connected disabled as designated or classified by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs; prohibiting the Administration from charging certain persons the fee required for replacement registration plates under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to issue special disabled veteran registration plates to certain disabled veterans, allowing them to display a 'Disabled Veteran' designation on their vehicle plates without additional fees for replacement plates under specific circumstances.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Disabled veterans in Maryland who qualify for the special registration plates
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Human Services - Food Supplement Program and Human Services Careers Scholarships - Alterations
Synopsis: Making technical and clarifying changes to the administration of certain food supplement benefits for children; authorizing the Department of Human Services to use certain funding to provide certain matching funds to a county to supplement certain benefits and to offset certain administrative costs; altering certain eligibility and certain requirements for the Pilot Program for Human Services Careers Scholarships; and authorizing the Maryland Higher Education Commission to prorate scholarship repayment under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill makes technical changes to the administration of food supplement benefits for children, increases funding for the food supplement program, and alters eligibility and requirements for the Human Services Careers Scholarship Pilot Program, including scholarship repayment provisions.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Children receiving food supplement benefits, families in need, and students pursuing careers in human services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are primarily focused on social services and education programs, with no direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Eastern Shore Code Counties - Maximum Hotel Rental Tax Rate - Alteration
Synopsis: Increasing, from 5% to 6%, the maximum hotel rental tax rate that counties in the Eastern Shore class of code counties may impose.
bill_summary: The bill amends the maximum hotel rental tax rates for counties in Maryland, specifically increasing the cap for Eastern Shore counties to 6%, with other counties having different limits.
responsible_party: County governments in Maryland, particularly the county commissioners of each county.
stakeholders: Tourists, hotel operators, and residents in Maryland counties, especially on the Eastern Shore.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by potentially increasing tourism revenue through higher tax rates, it may indirectly support local businesses.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Personal Care Aides - Wage Reports
Synopsis: Requiring residential service agencies to submit certain reports to the Maryland Department of Labor regarding wage rates for personal care aides on or before September 1 each year, beginning in 2025; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by the 180th day after the release of the final federal Ensuring Access to Medicaid Services rule on an overview of the final rule and plans or steps that the Department will take to operationalize the rule.
bill_summary: The bill requires residential service agencies to submit annual wage reports for personal care aides to the Maryland Department of Labor, and mandates the Department of Health to compare reimbursement rates with actual costs, review related requirements, and develop plans to address any disparities, including increasing wages for personal care aides.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Personal care aides, residential service agencies, Medicaid recipients, and other home- and community-based service providers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve wage transparency and reimbursement rate analysis, which could help small service providers better manage costs and sustainability, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Speed Limits - Establishment
Synopsis: Authorizing Anne Arundel County and municipalities in Anne Arundel County to decrease the maximum speed limit to not less than 15 miles per hour on highways after performing an engineering and traffic investigation; and prohibiting Anne Arundel County and municipalities in Anne Arundel County from implementing a new speed monitoring system to enforce speed limits on highways on which the speed limit has been reduced under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Anne Arundel County and its municipalities to lower speed limits on highways after conducting an engineering and traffic investigation. It also prohibits the use of new speed monitoring systems to enforce these lowered speed limits.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Department of Transportation or local government authorities
stakeholders: Motorists and residents in Anne Arundel County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Public Safety - Missing Persons - Purple Alert Program
Synopsis: Establishing a Purple Alert Program to disseminate information to assist in locating a certain missing person who has a cognitive impairment, mental disorder, intellectual or developmental disability, or brain injury; requiring the Department of State Police to adopt guidelines and develop procedures for issuing a Purple Alert; and authorizing the Department to consult with relevant stakeholders representing citizens with disabilities to develop procedures for the program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Purple Alert Program in Maryland to quickly disseminate information to help locate missing persons with certain cognitive impairments, mental disorders, or disabilities who pose a credible threat to their safety.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police
stakeholders: Individuals with cognitive impairments, mental disorders, or disabilities who are at risk of going missing and their caregivers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Unemployment Insurance - Work Search Requirement - Exemption for Federal Civilian Employees During a Federal Government Shutdown
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Labor to exempt a federal civilian employee who has been furloughed from the requirement to be actively seeking work for unemployment insurance benefits eligibility if, during the furlough, the employee remains able to work, available for work, and work-attached.
bill_summary: The bill allows the Maryland Secretary of Labor to exempt federal civilian employees who are furloughed during a federal government shutdown from the requirement to actively seek work to qualify for unemployment benefits, provided they remain able and available to work and are work-attached.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of Labor
stakeholders: Federal civilian employees in Maryland who are furloughed during a federal government shutdown
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates; it focuses on unemployment benefits for federal employees during shutdowns.

Title: Transportation - WMATA Operating Assistance - Alteration (Maryland Metro Funding Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Repealing, for certain fiscal years, the requirement that the Secretary of Transportation withhold 35% of the State's share of annual operating grants for the Washington Suburban Transit District if the State's operating assistance provided in the approved Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority budget increases by more than 3% over the total operating assistance provided in the prior fiscal year.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the funding rules for the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA) by removing certain withholding requirements and establishing new conditions for withholding Maryland's operating assistance, including a cap on increases and specific circumstances related to WMATA's governance and projects.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Commuters and residents in Maryland who rely on WMATA transit services
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by potentially stabilizing transit funding, it may indirectly support local businesses that depend on reliable transit services.

Title: Community Schools - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements for community schools and community school coordinators; requiring the Director of Community Schools to create a common needs assessment tool and an evaluation form; requiring a community school coordinator to complete a needs assessment and an evaluation in a certain manner; requiring the State Department of Education to provide feedback on the needs assessment before granting approval; and requiring the coordinator to review and modify the plan implementation periodically.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes and establishes guidelines for community schools in Maryland, including funding, needs assessments, and program implementation to support student success through wraparound services and community engagement.
responsible_party: The Department of Education, specifically the Director of Community Schools and local school systems.
stakeholders: Students, families, educators, community organizations, and local school communities in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions for community schools to develop strategies for maximizing external funding, which could include partnerships with small businesses, potentially reducing small business failure.

Title: Education – Coaches – Mental Health Training
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to develop guidelines for public schools and the Maryland Higher Education Commission to develop guidelines for public institutions of higher education to train coaches to recognize indicators of mental illness and behavioral distress in students who participate in athletic programs in public schools and public institutions of higher education; requiring public schools and public institutions that offer athletic programs to provide a certain training to coaches; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education and the Maryland Higher Education Commission, in collaboration with health and athletic organizations, to develop guidelines for training coaches in recognizing mental health issues and behavioral distress in students and athletes. Public schools and higher education institutions offering athletic programs must provide this mental health training to their coaches.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Higher Education Commission, in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health, county boards of education, and the Maryland Public Secondary Schools Athletic Association.
stakeholders: Students participating in school and college athletic programs, coaches, and educational institutions in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets educational institutions and does not directly impact small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission
Synopsis: Establishing the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission to develop recommendations relating to education and its impact on the criminal justice system; and requiring the Commission to submit an interim report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by June 1, 2025, and a final report by January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission to develop recommendations on how education impacts the criminal justice system, including strategies to increase public safety and reduce recidivism through education policies.
responsible_party: The Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Individuals involved in the criminal justice system, including incarcerated persons, correctional staff, and communities affected by criminal justice policies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; its focus is on prison education reform and criminal justice policies.

Title: Business Regulation - Contractors, Subcontractors, and Brokers - Prohibited Conduct
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from serving or acting as a contractor, a subcontractor, or a broker between a contractor and subcontractor during the 5-year period immediately following the date the person was convicted of an offense constituting criminal malfeasance, misfeasance, or nonfeasance under any federal or State law.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits individuals convicted of certain criminal offenses from serving as contractors, subcontractors, or brokers in Maryland for a period of 5 years following their conviction.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or relevant licensing authority for contractors and brokers
stakeholders: Contractors, subcontractors, brokers, and the construction industry in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it may impact the industry by restricting certain individuals from participating, potentially affecting business operations.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Noise Abatement Monitoring Systems - Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing a pilot program to authorize the use of noise abatement monitoring systems in Montgomery County and Prince George's County to enforce certain motor vehicle noise requirements; requiring a county, before activating a noise abatement monitoring system, to publish notice of the locations of the systems on its website; requiring a county that authorizes a noise abatement monitoring program to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025, on the implementation and costs of the program and revenues collected; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a pilot program in Montgomery County, Prince George's County, and Anne Arundel County to use noise abatement monitoring systems for enforcing motor vehicle noise violations, including the use of recorded images and sound measurements to issue citations.
responsible_party: County law enforcement agencies and municipal noise abatement monitoring system operators in the specified counties.
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners and drivers in Montgomery County, Prince George's County, and Anne Arundel County.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily involves traffic enforcement and noise regulation.

Title: Human Services - Attendant Care Program - Ongoing Additional Supports
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the Attendant Care Program to include the provision of financial assistance for ongoing additional supports that increase an individual's independent performance of essential daily activities and is requested by an eligible individual.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Attendant Care Program to include providing financial assistance for ongoing additional supports that help individuals with severe physical disabilities increase their independence in daily activities, self-care, or mobility.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with severe physical disabilities aged 18 to 64 who require attendant care services and ongoing supports, including those at risk of institutionalization or currently residing in care facilities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on providing financial assistance for individual care needs and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Condominiums - Common Elements - Clean Energy Equipment
Synopsis: Authorizing the board of directors of a condominium to grant certain interests affecting the common elements of the condominium for the installation and use of leased clean energy equipment.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes condominium boards to lease common elements for clean energy equipment, such as electric vehicle chargers, solar energy systems, and energy storage, through a streamlined approval process.
responsible_party: The board of directors of a condominium, with oversight and implementation likely managed by the condominium's management or homeowners' association.
stakeholders: Condominium unit owners and residents, as well as the broader community interested in clean energy and sustainable development.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill facilitates the installation of clean energy equipment in condominiums, which could support small businesses involved in renewable energy and related services, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Correctional Services - Division of Pretrial Detention and Services - Facilities
Synopsis: Altering the composition and authority of the Division of Pretrial Detention and Services within the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services; altering the authority of the Commissioner of the Division; establishing the Youth Detention Center in the Division; establishing the facility administrator and authorizing assistant facility administrators for the Youth Detention Center; and repealing authorization for the Baltimore City Detention Center.
bill_summary: The bill reorganizes the Division of Pretrial Detention and Services within the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, establishes a Youth Detention Center for juveniles charged as adults in Baltimore City, and makes related administrative changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, specifically the Division of Pretrial Detention and Services.
stakeholders: Juvenile offenders under 18 charged as adults in Baltimore City, and the staff and administrators of the Youth Detention Center.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or include programs aimed at reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Sustainable Growth Subcabinet and Repeal of the Office of Smart Growth
Synopsis: Repealing the Office of Smart Growth; repealing the position of Special Secretary for Smart Growth; renaming the Smart Growth Subcabinet to be the Sustainable Growth Subcabinet; altering the membership of the Subcabinet; requiring the Subcabinet to review State assistance programs, promote interagency consensus and cooperation, provide advisory and technical assistance to local jurisdictions, and gather and disseminate information to the public related to the State's sustainable growth policy; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Office of Smart Growth and the position of Special Secretary of Smart Growth, renames the Smart Growth Subcabinet to the Sustainable Growth Subcabinet, and updates its membership, duties, and responsibilities to focus on sustainable growth policies in Maryland.
responsible_party: The Sustainable Growth Subcabinet, which includes various state agency secretaries and officials, is responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: State agencies, local governments, developers, nonprofit organizations, and residents of Maryland who are affected by growth and development policies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve coordination and support for sustainable growth projects, which could help small businesses by streamlining processes and providing guidance, but it does not explicitly specify a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Natural Resources - Maryland State Parks - Funds and Plan Alterations
Synopsis: Extending the date by which the Park System Critical Maintenance Fund must be expended to before July 1, 2029; authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to expend up to $400,000 from the Park System Critical Maintenance Fund under certain circumstances; authorizing the Park System Capital Improvements and Acquisition Fund to be used for State projects on lands managed by the Department for public purposes; authorizing the Great Maryland Outdoors Fund to be used for promoting outdoor environmental education in the State; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the deadlines and authorizes increased funding and specific uses for the Maryland State Parks' maintenance, improvement, and land acquisition funds. It also establishes a new fund to promote outdoor recreation and environmental education, and requires the Department of Natural Resources to develop a long-range strategic plan for the park system.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: State park visitors, local communities, environmental and historical preservation groups, and residents benefiting from outdoor recreation and environmental education programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on infrastructure, transportation, and land acquisition may indirectly support small businesses involved in construction, tourism, and outdoor recreation, but it does not explicitly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Motor Vehicle Insurance Companies - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring motor vehicle insurance companies to participate in the Motor Vehicle Administration's online verification program for vehicle insurance policies for law enforcement and administrative purposes; and requiring motor vehicle insurance companies to provide certain customer information details.
bill_summary: The bill requires motor vehicle insurance companies in Maryland to participate in an online verification program for vehicle insurance policies, including providing detailed information about active policies and fleet modifications, to improve enforcement and compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (MVA) and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners, insurance companies, law enforcement, and administrative agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on insurance verification and compliance, which may indirectly support small insurance businesses by clarifying reporting requirements, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Motor Vehicle Administration and Local Health Departments - Death Certificates - Issuance of Copies
Synopsis: Authorizing the Motor Vehicle Administration and local health departments to access electronically from the Maryland Department of Health a copy of a death certificate and, on request, provide any person authorized by regulations with a certified or abridged copy of a death certificate; and authorizing the Administration and local health departments to set and collect a fee for processing and issuing death certificates, subject to certain limitations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration and local health departments to access and provide copies of death certificates electronically from the Maryland Department of Health, sets fees for processing and issuing death certificates, and specifies conditions for waivers and exemptions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health, Motor Vehicle Administration, and local health departments
stakeholders: Individuals requesting death certificates, including family members, government agencies, and organizations involved in legal or health-related matters
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but streamlining death certificate access and processing could indirectly reduce administrative burdens for related businesses and organizations.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Special Registration Plates - Gold Star and Next of Kin Families
Synopsis: Authorizing the recipient of a U.S. Department of Defense Next of Kin lapel button to apply for special registration plates; and waiving the initial vehicle registration fee associated with special registration plates issued to the recipient of a Gold Star or a Next of Kin lapel button.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes recipients of the U.S. Department of Defense Next of Kin lapel button to apply for special vehicle registration plates in Maryland, which include an emblem indicating their status and the name and rank of the deceased service member. It also waives the initial registration fee for these plates.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (MVA)
stakeholders: Recipients of the Gold Star and Next of Kin lapel buttons, including surviving spouses, parents, and next of kin of fallen service members.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns vehicle registration and veteran recognition programs.

Title: Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Protection Program – Climate, Equity, and Administrative Provisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Critical Area Commission to adopt regulations governing the transfer of development rights, fee in lieu payments, the assessment of and adaption of the critical area for climate resiliency, enhancing resilience in the critical area, and environmental justice and equity initiatives; establishing certain considerations of climate change, climate resiliency, and equity as general principles and minimum elements of local programs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Protection Program to include climate resiliency, environmental justice, and equity initiatives. It enhances standards for land use, development, and resource management to address climate change impacts such as sea level rise and storm surge, and promotes equitable distribution of environmental benefits and burdens, especially for underserved communities.
responsible_party: The Critical Area Commission for the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays and local jurisdictions implementing their critical area programs.
stakeholders: Residents and communities within the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Areas, including underserved and overburdened communities, environmental groups, local governments, and land developers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides grants and technical assistance to local jurisdictions for developing and updating critical area programs, which may help small businesses by promoting sustainable development practices and reducing environmental compliance risks.

Title: Department of Natural Resources - Pay-For-Success Contracts - Procurement Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting pay-for-success contracts negotiated or entered into by the Department of Natural Resources from certain provisions of the General Procurement Law.
bill_summary: The bill exempts the Department of Natural Resources from certain procurement laws when negotiating pay-for-success contracts, which are agreements where payments are made based on achieving specific environmental or conservation outcomes.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Environmental conservation projects, nonprofit organizations involved in conservation, and the general public benefiting from environmental improvements.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on environmental and conservation contracts and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Commercial Northern Snakehead License – Gear
Synopsis: Repealing certain buffer zones within which a commercial northern snakehead licensee may not fish using bowfishing gear; and requiring a licensee who fishes for northern snakehead to comply with Department of Natural Resources regulations governing the use of gear.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain buffer zones for commercial northern snakehead fishing with gear and requires licensees to comply with Department of Natural Resources regulations on gear use.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Commercial fishers targeting northern snakehead in Maryland waters
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a significant impact on small business failure rates, as it mainly modifies regulations and buffer zones.

Title: Public Health - Clean Indoor Air Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Prohibiting vaping in certain indoor areas and places of employment and certain mass transportation; requiring that certain signs be posted in each public indoor area and each public entrance to an indoor area where smoking or vaping is prohibited; requiring the convening of a workgroup to study the issuance of alcoholic beverages licenses to tobacconists; and prohibiting the issuance of a local alcoholic beverages license to a tobacconist from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2026, both inclusive.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland's Clean Indoor Air Act by expanding restrictions on vaping and smoking in indoor public areas and places of employment, requiring signage, and establishing a workgroup to study alcohol licensing for tobacconists. It also prohibits local alcohol licenses to tobacconists from 2024 to 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Public health, indoor workers, and consumers in Maryland, especially those in public and employment settings
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on smoking and vaping, along with the prohibition on alcohol licenses for tobacconists, could impact small tobacco-related businesses, but the study and regulations aim to mitigate negative effects.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Just Community Designation
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor, on the recommendation of the Secretary of Housing and Community Development, to designate certain areas as Just Communities based on certain criteria; and providing for the prioritization of State funding for Just Communities to increase racial, economic and health equity in the State.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Governor of Maryland to designate certain areas as 'Just Communities' based on specific criteria related to historical disinvestment and negative impacts. These designations will prioritize state funding to promote equity, racial justice, and community improvement.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Communities that have been historically underserved or negatively impacted by segregation, disinvestment, or environmental hazards in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to prioritize funding for designated Just Communities, which could include support for small businesses in these areas, potentially reducing business failures by improving community investment and resources.

Title: State Amusement Ride Safety Advisory Board - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Amusement Ride Safety Advisory Board in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board to July 1, 2027; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee by July 1, 2025, with certain information regarding the State Amusement Ride Safety Advisory Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination date of the State Amusement Ride Safety Advisory Board from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2027, and requires the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report about the board by July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Amusement ride operators, safety regulators, and the general public who use amusement rides in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by maintaining the safety advisory board, it may support safer operations for amusement ride businesses.

Title: Maryland Occupational Safety and Health Act - Civil Penalties - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain civil penalties for violations of the Maryland Occupational Safety and Health Act; and requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to annually increase the maximum and minimum civil penalties, beginning in 2025, by the percentage increase, if any, in the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers or a successor index published by the federal Bureau of Labor Statistics.
bill_summary: The bill updates civil penalties for violations of the Maryland Occupational Safety and Health Act, including increasing maximum and minimum penalties annually based on the Consumer Price Index, and adjusts penalties for violations, including willful or repeated violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation (Labor and Industry Division)
stakeholders: Employers and employees in Maryland, especially those subject to occupational safety and health regulations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's adjustments to penalties are designed to be predictable and scaled with inflation, which may help businesses plan and avoid unexpected financial burdens, potentially reducing small business failures related to regulatory penalties.

Title: Financial Institutions - Third-Party Service Providers - Examinations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to examine a third-party service provider as to services and activities performed on behalf of an entity licensed or chartered by the Office of Financial Regulation; requiring the Commissioner to notify a certain licensed person of any examination of any third-party service provider who performs activities relating to financial services on behalf of the licensed person; authorizing the Commissioner to accept the results of an examination by certain entities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Commissioner of Financial Regulation to examine third-party service providers that perform financial services on behalf of licensed or chartered financial entities, expanding oversight and examination powers.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Financial Regulation (Commissioner of Financial Regulation)
stakeholders: Financial institutions licensed or chartered by the Maryland Office of Financial Regulation and their third-party service providers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By allowing examinations of third-party providers, the bill aims to improve oversight, reduce risks, and potentially lower the failure rate of small financial businesses that rely on these services.

Title: Unemployment Insurance - Covered Employment - Employees of Governmental Entities or Charitable, Educational, or Religious Organizations
Synopsis: Specifying that certain limitations on the payment of benefits to employees of governmental entities or charitable, educational, or religious organizations do not apply with respect to service in other covered employment, including covered employment for a for-profit employing unit, even if the service is provided exclusively for a governmental entity or a charitable, educational, religious, or other organization.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that certain limitations on unemployment benefits for employees of government, charitable, educational, or religious organizations do not apply if the individual performs other covered employment, even if the service is exclusively for such an organization.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees of governmental, charitable, educational, or religious organizations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it primarily clarifies unemployment benefit eligibility.

Title: Insurance - Holding Companies - Group Capital Calculation and Liquidity Stress Test
Synopsis: Requiring certain controlling persons of certain insurers in an insurance holding company system to file an annual group calculation as directed by the lead state commissioner of the insurance group; requiring certain controlling persons of certain insurers in an insurance holding company system to file the results of a liquidity stress test for specific data years; providing that certain information is confidential; and authorizing and requiring the Commissioner to take certain actions related to certain information.
bill_summary: The bill requires controlling persons of certain insurers within an insurance holding company system to file annual group capital calculations and liquidity stress test results, with confidentiality protections and specific procedures for sharing and using this information.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Insurance companies within Maryland, their policyholders, and the broader insurance market in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on financial stability and risk management for insurers may help reduce the failure rate of small insurance businesses by promoting stronger oversight and risk assessment.

Title: Cannabis Reform - Alterations
Synopsis: Making alterations and clarifications related to the duties of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission, the Office of Social Equity, the Advisory Board on Medical and Adult-Use Cannabis, and the Maryland Cannabis Administration; altering the membership of the Commission; requiring the Advisory Board to elect a chair and removing the Director of the Administration as chair; authorizing processors to provide cannabis to cannabis licensees; providing that certain violations may be charged by a citation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes comprehensive reforms to Maryland's cannabis laws, including establishing a new regulatory framework, expanding licensing and registration processes, creating funds and programs to support social equity and small businesses, and clarifying legal possession limits and advertising restrictions.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis industry participants, social equity applicants, small, minority, and women-owned businesses, medical cannabis patients, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides targeted support, funding, and regulatory clarity aimed at reducing the failure rate of small and minority-owned cannabis businesses.

Title: Waterway Incident Notification System (WINS) - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to study issues and factors regarding the feasibility of establishing a Waterway Incident Notification System to notify members of the public of certain waterway emergencies; and requiring the Department to submit an interim report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024, and a final report on or before December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a study by the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to assess the feasibility of creating a Waterway Incident Notification System (WINS) to alert the public about waterway emergencies and potential partnerships with federal and state agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Recreational boaters, commercial watermen, and the general public who use Maryland waterways
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but improving waterway safety and communication could indirectly benefit water-related businesses.

Title: State Personnel - Collective Bargaining - Supervisory Employees
Synopsis: Providing collective bargaining rights to certain supervisory State employees; and requiring that certain supervisory State employees have separate bargaining units.
bill_summary: The bill grants collective bargaining rights to certain supervisory state employees in Maryland, establishing separate bargaining units for them and clarifying which employees are included or excluded from these rights.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Labor or the designated agency responsible for labor relations and collective bargaining.
stakeholders: Supervisory employees of Maryland state government, including those in higher education institutions, and other eligible state employees.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects state employees and does not have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Unemployment Insurance - Benefits - Election Judges
Synopsis: Prohibiting a payment to an individual as compensation received for serving as an election judge for a local board of elections in the State from being included when computing the wages required to be subtracted from an eligible claimant's weekly benefit amount; and prohibiting an individual from being denied unemployment benefits for failure to meet certain requirements due to service as an election judge in the State.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's unemployment insurance law to exclude payments received for serving as an election judge from being counted as wages when calculating unemployment benefits. It also prevents individuals from being denied benefits due to service as an election judge.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or the relevant unemployment insurance agency
stakeholders: Individuals serving as election judges in Maryland and unemployment benefit claimants
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to reduce small business failure by clarifying that election judge payments are not counted as wages, which could affect unemployment benefit calculations for some claimants.

Title: Consumer Protection - Consumer Reporting Agencies - Information in Consumer Credit Reports
Synopsis: Altering the items of information that a consumer reporting agency is prohibited from including in a consumer credit report.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to extend the time period for which certain adverse items, such as bankruptcies, judgments, tax liens, and criminal records, can be included in consumer credit reports from 7 or 10 years to 7 or 10 years, with some exceptions for high-value credit, insurance, or employment transactions.
responsible_party: Consumer Reporting Agencies and the Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation
stakeholders: Consumers in Maryland, credit reporting agencies, lenders, insurance companies, and employers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects consumer credit reports and does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Insurance - Producer Licensing Requirements - Education and Experience
Synopsis: Repealing the requirements for education and experience for licensing of certain insurance producers, including producers for property and casualty insurance, life insurance, health insurance, annuities, and related products.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the education and experience requirements for licensing certain insurance producers in Maryland, including those for property and casualty, life, health, and related insurance products.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Insurance producers seeking licensure and consumers of insurance products in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By removing the education and experience requirements, the bill aims to simplify the licensing process, potentially reducing barriers for small insurance businesses and new entrants, which may help decrease business failures.

Title: Cannabis Licensing and Registration - Use of Straw Ownership - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from applying for or holding a cannabis license or registration under certain circumstances if an ownership interest in the license or registration is for the limited purpose of satisfying certain requirements of registration or licensure; and requiring the Maryland Cannabis Administration to deny a certain application or revoke a cannabis license or registration if the applicant, licensee, or registrant is determined by the Administration to be in violation of the Act or convicted of a violation of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits individuals from holding or applying for a cannabis license or registration if their ownership interest is solely for the purpose of satisfying licensing or registration requirements without genuine ownership, often referred to as straw ownership. It also mandates the Maryland Cannabis Administration to deny or revoke licenses if violations occur.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis license applicants, licensees, and registrants in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to prevent fraudulent ownership practices that could undermine legitimate cannabis businesses, thereby supporting the stability and integrity of small cannabis businesses.

Title: Frederick County - Local Gaming and Authorization for Electronic Tip Jar Dispensers
Synopsis: Authorizing, subject to certain provisions of law, a person that operates a tip jar in Frederick County to operate an electronic tip jar dispenser that does not connect to the Internet or to a server; altering certain obsolete language in provisions of law governing gaming in Frederick County; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the operation of electronic tip jar dispensers in Frederick County, Maryland, and updates laws related to gaming events, including tip jars, punchboards, raffles, and bingo, with specific regulations for licensing, reporting, and permitted beneficiaries.
responsible_party: Frederick County Department of Permits and Inspections
stakeholders: Organizations in Frederick County such as religious, fraternal, civic, veterans, hospitals, athletic, patriotic, charitable, educational groups, and volunteer fire, rescue, and ambulance companies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a regulated framework for organizations to operate gaming activities and tip jars, which can support their fundraising efforts and financial stability, potentially reducing small business failure.

Title: Local Government - Condominium and Homeowners Associations - Repair and Rehabilitation Funds
Synopsis: Authorizing a county or a municipality to establish a certain fund for the purpose of providing support for the repair of infrastructure in a community subject to a condominium association or a homeowners association; and requiring that certain property tax revenues be assigned to a fund created under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to establish funds supported by property tax revenues to assist condominium and homeowners associations in repairing or rehabilitating infrastructure within their communities, especially where local governments do not maintain such infrastructure.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and municipalities
stakeholders: Condominium associations, homeowners associations, and residents in communities with aging infrastructure
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to provide financial support for infrastructure repairs, which can help prevent community deterioration and property value decline, indirectly supporting local economies and small businesses.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Affordable Housing - Identifying Suitable Property
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the Department of Housing and Community Development identify certain property as suitable for use or redevelopment; prohibiting the Department from identifying certain property for use or redevelopment as affordable housing; and requiring the Department to consider certain factors when identifying whether a  property is suitable for use or redevelopment as affordable housing.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a requirement that the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development identify certain properties as suitable for affordable housing and instead requires the department to consider specific factors when making such determinations. It also prohibits the department from identifying properties outside designated areas or not meeting certain criteria for use or redevelopment as affordable housing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Potential residents and communities in Maryland seeking affordable housing options
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on housing development and property suitability assessment, not directly on small businesses, so its impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Education - Provision of Maryland Youth Crisis Hotline Telephone Number - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that each county board of education provide certain students with the telephone number of the Maryland Youth Crisis Hotline by instead requiring that each county board of education provide certain students with the telephone number of the 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland county school boards to provide students in grades 6-12 with the telephone number of the 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline, replacing the previous requirement to provide the Maryland Youth Crisis Hotline number.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students in grades 6 through 12 in Maryland public schools
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Task Force on Property Appraisal and Valuation Equity - Alterations
Synopsis: Moving from October 31, 2023, to October 31, 2024, the deadline for the reporting requirement for the Task Force on Property Appraisal and Valuation Equity; and extending from June 30, 2024, to December 31, 2024, the termination date for the Task Force.
bill_summary: This bill extends the deadline for the Task Force on Property Appraisal and Valuation Equity to report its findings and recommendations from October 31, 2023, to October 31, 2024, and extends the task force's termination date to December 31, 2024.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Minority property owners, appraisers, government agencies, and communities affected by property valuation practices in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to address valuation biases and improve fairness in property assessments, which can support minority-owned small businesses by ensuring equitable property valuation and access to resources.

Title: Property Tax - Renters' Property Tax Relief Program - Assets Calculation
Synopsis: Excluding the cash value of any qualified retirement savings plans or individual retirement accounts from the definition of "assets" for purposes of certain property tax relief provided to certain renters; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill amends the property tax relief program for renters by excluding certain assets, such as qualified retirement savings plans and tangible personal property, from the calculation of net worth.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Renters in Maryland seeking property tax relief
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill primarily impacts individual renters and does not directly influence small business failure rates.

Title: County Boards of Education - Bid Advertisement Threshold and Electronic Posting of Hearing Notices and Bid Advertisements
Synopsis: Requiring county boards of education to post on the websites of certain local school systems hearing notices related to preliminary approval of a school site and advertisements for bids for school buildings, improvements, supplies, or equipment that exceed $100,000; increasing, from $25,000 to $100,000, the threshold amount of costs of school buildings, improvements, supplies, or equipment that trigger the requirement for county boards to advertise for bids; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires county boards of education in Maryland to post hearing notices and bid advertisements electronically on local school system websites, increases the bid advertisement threshold from $25,000 to $100,000, and updates the procurement platform reference.
responsible_party: County Boards of Education and local school system websites
stakeholders: County boards of education, local school systems, and the general public interested in school construction and procurement processes
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By increasing the bid threshold and requiring electronic posting, the bill aims to streamline procurement processes, potentially reducing barriers for small businesses to participate in school bids.

Title: State Procurement - Maryland State Board of Contract Appeals - Attorney's Fees
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Contract Appeals to award an interested party reasonable costs of filing and pursuing a protest, including attorney's fees, if an appeal is sustained and there is a violation of law or regulation; and authorizing the Board of Contract Appeals to award a contractor under any State contract the reasonable costs of filing and pursuing a claim, including attorney's fees, if the unit processing the claim acts in bad faith, without justification, or in violation of law.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Contract Appeals to award reasonable costs, including attorney's fees, to interested parties who file protests or claims related to state procurement contracts if their appeal is successful and there is a violation of law or regulation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Contract Appeals
stakeholders: Bidders, offerors, and contractors involved in Maryland state procurement contracts
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help reduce small business failures by providing financial support for legal costs in procurement disputes, potentially encouraging more small businesses to participate in state contracts.

Title: Family Law - Marriage Ceremony - Designation of Deputy Clerk
Synopsis: Transferring, from the county administrative judge of the circuit court for the county to the clerk of the circuit court for the county, the authority to designate a deputy clerk to perform a marriage ceremony.
bill_summary: The bill transfers the authority to designate a deputy clerk to perform marriage ceremonies from the county administrative judge to the clerk of the circuit court in Maryland.
responsible_party: Clerk of the circuit court for the county
stakeholders: Individuals getting married in Maryland, marriage officiants, and the circuit courts
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Prince George's County - Economic Development - Workgroup on Independent Innovation in Prince George's County - Establishment PG 402-24
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Independent Innovation in Prince George's County to promote innovation and technology in the county; and requiring the Workgroup by January 15, 2026, to report on recommendations regarding strategies to support investments in industry opportunities and potential areas of innovation to the Prince George's County Delegation and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Workgroup on Independent Innovation in Prince George's County to promote innovation and technology, creates the Prince George's County Venture Capital Fund to invest in startups and small businesses, and sets up related programs and organizational structures to support entrepreneurial growth.
responsible_party: The Urban Business Innovation Initiative within the Maryland Technology Development Corporation and the Prince George's County government.
stakeholders: Entrepreneurs, startups, small businesses, educational institutions, and innovation-focused organizations in Prince George's County.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support startups and small businesses through investments, innovation programs, and partnerships, which could reduce the failure rate of small businesses in the county.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Nonprofit Organizations PG 304-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue a Class C (fraternal/sororal/service organization) alcoholic beverages license for use by an independent and nonprofit fraternal or sororal organization that meets certain requirements; authorizing the Board to revoke or suspend a license if a license holder is found guilty of certain violations; and providing for an annual license fee of $910.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners to issue a new Class C alcoholic beverages license specifically for independent, nonprofit fraternal or sororal organizations that meet certain membership and operational criteria.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Independent, nonprofit fraternal or sororal organizations in Prince George's County and their members and guests.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a new licensing option for nonprofit fraternal organizations, which could help these organizations generate revenue and sustain their operations, potentially reducing their risk of failure.

Title: Cooperative Housing Corporations - Dispute Settlement
Synopsis: Altering procedures for the dispute settlement mechanism under the Maryland Cooperative Housing Corporation Act; applying the dispute settlement mechanism established by the Act to apply to any complaint or demand formally arising on or after October 1, 2023, with a certain exception; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the dispute settlement procedures for cooperative housing corporations in Maryland, including notification, hearings, and appeals processes, effective October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Cooperative Housing Corporation regulatory authority or governing body
stakeholders: Members of cooperative housing corporations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying and streamlining dispute resolution procedures, the bill aims to reduce conflicts and potential failures within cooperative housing businesses, supporting their stability.

Title: Regulated Firearms - Maryland Judiciary - Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing and altering a reporting requirement to require the Maryland Judiciary, instead of the State Commission on Criminal Sentencing Policy, to report on the number of charges, convictions, and sentences for certain regulated firearm violations; and requiring by October 1, 2024 and each October 1 thereafter, that the Maryland Judiciary submit its report to the Governor and the General Assembly and include information disaggregated by jurisdiction, race, and gender.
bill_summary: The bill changes the reporting requirements for firearm violations in Maryland, requiring the Maryland Judiciary to report on charges, convictions, and sentences related to specific firearm violations annually, starting October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Individuals involved in firearm violations, law enforcement agencies, policymakers, and the general public interested in firearm law enforcement data.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it focuses on firearm violation reporting.

Title: Environment - Commission on Climate Change Membership - Addition
Synopsis: Adding the Secretary of Emergency Management, or the Secretary's designee, and the Chair of the Public Service Commission, or the Chair's designee, as members of the Commission on Climate Change.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership of the Maryland Commission on Climate Change by adding the Secretary of Emergency Management and the Chair of the Public Service Commission as members of the commission.
responsible_party: The Department of Environment, specifically the Commission on Climate Change.
stakeholders: Government agencies involved in emergency management, public service, and climate policy, as well as the general public affected by climate change policies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or include programs aimed at reducing small business failures.

Title: Maryland Uniform Transfers to Minors Act - Transfers as Custodian for the Benefit of a Minor - Authorization of Court
Synopsis: Increasing, from in excess of $10,000 to in excess of $25,000, the threshold amount for certain transfers by a personal representative, trustee, or conservator as a custodian for the benefit of a minor to require authorization by a court.
bill_summary: The bill increases the monetary threshold for transfers made by personal representatives, trustees, or conservators as custodians for minors that require court approval from $10,000 to $50,000.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and the Office of the Register of Wills or relevant estate and trust authorities
stakeholders: Minors, estate administrators, trustees, conservators, and legal professionals involved in estate management
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily affects estate transfers for minors and does not directly influence small business operations.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Interested Person - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "interested person" for purposes of provisions of law governing the estates of decedents, guardians of persons and property, trusts, and powers of attorney.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of "interested person" in Maryland law concerning estates, trusts, and powers of attorney, clarifying who qualifies as an interested person and when they cease to be one.
responsible_party: Maryland State Courts and the Office of the Register of Wills
stakeholders: Individuals involved in estate, trust, and probate matters, including heirs, legatees, executors, guardians, and beneficiaries.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects estate and trust law and does not have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Appointment of Personal Representative - Objections
Synopsis: Authorizing only an interested person or unpaid claimant, rather than any person, to file an objection to the appointment of a personal representative of an estate of a decedent.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to specify that only interested persons or unpaid claimants, rather than any person, can file objections to the appointment of a personal representative of an estate.
responsible_party: Register of Wills and the courts overseeing estate proceedings
stakeholders: Individuals involved in estate administration, including interested persons, unpaid claimants, and creditors of decedents
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Board of Community College Trustees - Membership Alterations and Appointment Requirements
Synopsis: Increasing by two members the membership of the Board of Community College Trustees for Anne Arundel County; and requiring the Governor to consider the geographic and ethnic representation of Anne Arundel County when making appointments to the Board.
bill_summary: This bill increases the number of members on the Anne Arundel County Board of Community College Trustees from 8 to 10, requires the Governor to consider geographic and ethnic representation when appointing members, and specifies the appointment process for student members.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland and the Anne Arundel County Board of Community College Trustees
stakeholders: Residents of Anne Arundel County, students at Anne Arundel Community College, and the local community college system
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it focuses on the composition of the community college trustees.

Title: Hospitals - Financial Assistance Policies - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the required contents of a hospital's financial assistance policy by removing the requirement that the provision of reduced-cost medically necessary care and payment plans be in accordance with the mission and service area of the hospital; authorizing hospitals to consider only household monetary assets in excess of $100,000 when determining eligibility for free and reduced-cost care under the hospital's financial assistance policy; and requiring that certain retirement assets be excluded from consideration.
bill_summary: The bill revises hospital financial assistance policies in Maryland by removing the requirement that reduced-cost care be aligned with the hospital's mission and service area, and allows hospitals to consider only household monetary assets exceeding $100,000 (with certain exclusions) when determining eligibility for free or reduced-cost care.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Patients seeking financial assistance from hospitals, particularly those with household assets over $100,000
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts hospital policies and does not directly target small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Out-of-State Motor Vehicles - Improper Registration - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration, in consultation with Baltimore City and other interested jurisdictions, to prepare a report on motor vehicles owned by Maryland residents that are improperly titled or registered in another state; requiring the Administration to submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City to tow, remove, or impound vehicles owned by new residents who fail to register their vehicles with the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration within 60 days.
