It also requires the Motor Vehicle Administration to prepare a report on the issue of Maryland residents improperly registering their vehicles in other states, including analysis, enforcement, and policy recommendations.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration in consultation with Baltimore City and other jurisdictions
stakeholders: New residents of Maryland and their vehicle registration practices, Baltimore City residents, and the Maryland Department of Transportation
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it aims to improve vehicle registration compliance and enforcement, which could indirectly benefit related businesses and government agencies.

Title: Election Law - Election Disinformation and Improper Influence Related to Voting
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections to maintain a portal on the State Board's website that the public may use to report election misinformation and election disinformation; requiring the State Board to conduct a periodic review of material submitted by the public through the portal and, to the extent necessary, issue corrective information or refer submissions to the State Prosecutor; and defining "influence" for purposes of certain provisions of law prohibiting improper influence related to voting.
bill_summary: The bill requires large social media platforms to make efforts to prevent, detect, and remove election disinformation and disinformation accounts or posts in Maryland. They must report such disinformation to the State Board of Elections within 48 hours of awareness, and the Board will review and publish this information on its website. The bill also establishes penalties for non-compliance and creates a public portal for reporting election misinformation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters and the general public in Maryland, social media users, and political entities involved in elections.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets social media platforms and election misinformation, and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - B-D-7 Licenses - Hours of Sale
Synopsis: Altering a geographic boundary in the 45th alcoholic beverages district of Baltimore City within which a holder of a B-D-7 alcoholic beverages license must operate in accordance with certain hours.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the geographic boundaries and hours of sale for certain alcohol licenses in Baltimore City, specifically the B–D–7 license, allowing sales from 9 a.m. to 10 p.m. in specified areas and from 6 a.m. to 2 a.m. elsewhere, effective June 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Department or local licensing authority
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents, and businesses in Baltimore City, especially in the affected districts
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying and potentially extending hours of sale in certain districts, the bill aims to support small alcohol retail businesses by providing more operational flexibility.

Title: Maryland Achieving a Better Life Experience (ABLE) Program - Materials for Individualized Education Program, Individualized Family Service Plan, and 504 Plan Meetings
Synopsis: Requiring a local school system to provide to parents at certain individualized education program, individualized family service plan, and 504 plan meetings for children with disabilities certain written informational materials regarding the Maryland ABLE Program; requiring the State Treasurer to develop informational materials about the Maryland ABLE Program that may be distributed electronically or by hand; and requiring the State Treasurer to provide informational materials to the State Board of Education and county boards.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland local school systems to provide parents with informational materials about the Maryland ABLE Program during meetings related to individualized education programs, family service plans, and 504 plans for children with disabilities. It also mandates the State Treasurer to develop and distribute these materials to support awareness and understanding of the ABLE Program.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Treasurer's Office and local school systems.
stakeholders: Parents of children with disabilities, children with disabilities, and their families in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it supports families and individuals with disabilities by increasing awareness of the ABLE Program, which could indirectly benefit small businesses serving this population.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Bike Lanes and Shoulders - Yielding Right-of-Way (Sarah Debbink Langenkamp Memorial Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing a violation of a certain provision of law governing the right-of-way of a bicycle, a motor scooter, or an electronic personal assistive mobility device lawfully in a designated bike lane or shoulder that contributes to the serious physical injury or death of a person riding a bicycle, EPAMD, or motor scooter; and providing that a person convicted of a violation of the Act is subject to imprisonment of up to 2 months or a fine not to exceed $2,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill enhances laws regarding yielding the right-of-way to bicycles, EPAMDs, and motor scooters, especially in bike lanes or shoulders, and establishes penalties for violations that contribute to serious injury or death.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local law enforcement agencies responsible for traffic enforcement and safety programs.
stakeholders: Bicycle riders, EPAMD and motor scooter riders, drivers of motor vehicles, and pedestrians in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on traffic safety laws and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Criminal Procedure – Facial Recognition Technology – Requirements, Procedures, and Prohibitions
Synopsis: Establishing requirements, procedures, and prohibitions relating to the use of facial recognition technology by a law enforcement agency;  requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to  administer a training program regarding the use of facial recognition technology by June 30, 2026; requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to report to the General Assembly by October 1 each year the information reported by law enforcement agencies using facial recognition technology; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations, procedures, and prohibitions for the use of facial recognition technology by law enforcement agencies in Maryland, including restrictions on its use, requirements for oversight, transparency, and annual reporting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, Maryland State Police, and law enforcement agencies.
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, individuals subject to facial recognition analysis, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill primarily regulates law enforcement use of facial recognition technology and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: State Procurement - Prompt Payment of Suppliers
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions requiring prompt payments for State procurement contracts apply to payments owed by a contractor to a supplier.
bill_summary: The bill mandates prompt payment requirements for contractors and suppliers involved in Maryland state procurement contracts, including procedures for dispute resolution and penalties for delayed payments.
responsible_party: Maryland State procurement officers and designated units within state agencies.
stakeholders: Suppliers, subcontractors, and contractors involved in Maryland state procurement projects.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By ensuring timely payments and establishing dispute resolution procedures, the bill aims to reduce cash flow issues that can lead to small business failures.

Title: Environment - Dredged Material - Containment, Redeposit, and Oversight
Synopsis: Requiring the Cox Creek Oversight Committee to provide input to the Maryland Port Administration regarding management of dredged material at the Cox Creek Dredge Material Containment Facility; authorizing the Department of the Environment to approve contained areas at a large redevelopment site for the redeposit of certain dredged material; establishing the Hart-Miller-Pleasure Island Citizens Oversight Committee to monitor the area water quality, and the future development and use of the Hart-Miller-Pleasure Island chain; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the membership and responsibilities of the Cox Creek and Hart–Miller–Pleasure Island Citizens Oversight Committees, clarifies regulations on the redeposit of dredged material, and establishes conditions under which dredged material can be deposited at certain containment facilities, including requirements for community benefits agreements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and the Maryland Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Local communities near Cox Creek and Hart–Miller Island, environmental groups, dredging companies, and residents affected by dredging activities and dredged material management.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for community benefits agreements and regulated dredged material management aim to support sustainable dredging practices, which could reduce small business failures related to environmental compliance and community relations.

Title: Fish and Wildlife - Endangered and Threatened Species - Definitions, Petitions, and Regulations
Synopsis: Requiring certain petitions to review the listing or unlisting of endangered or threatened species to contain certain information regarding the distribution, life needs, habitat requirements, and status of the species; requiring the Secretary of Natural Resources to review and, if warranted, update certain regulations listing endangered or threatened species on or before July 1, 2026, and every 5 years thereafter; and altering the definitions of "fish" and "wildlife" for certain purposes.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations related to endangered and threatened species of fish, wildlife, and plants in Maryland. It requires petitions for review of species listings to include specific information, mandates periodic review and updating of species regulations, and clarifies definitions and procedures for listing and delisting species.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources, Secretary of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Wildlife, fish, and plant species in Maryland, conservation organizations, and the general public interested in environmental protection
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it includes provisions for scientific and conservation activities that could involve permits and regulations affecting certain businesses.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - 2-1-1 Maryland - Oversight
Synopsis: Defining the term "Health and Human Services Referral System" for the purposes of certain provisions of law governing the System to mean a certain coordinated system for health and human service resources that is accessible to State residents, rather than a certain telephone service; repealing the requirement that the Maryland Department of Health evaluate the performance of certain call centers and make certain recommendations regarding the quality of service provided by call centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill redefines the 'Health and Human Services Referral System' as a coordinated system accessible to all Maryland residents through 2-1-1 and other technology, clarifies the role of 2-1-1 Maryland, and establishes oversight and reporting requirements for the system, including the creation of an opt-in mental health services call program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health in collaboration with 2-1-1 Maryland and its call centers.
stakeholders: Maryland residents seeking health and human services, mental health service users, and community organizations involved in health and human services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve access and coordination of health and human services, which can help small health and social service providers by streamlining referrals and support, potentially reducing their failure rate.

Title: Prince George's County - Workgroup on Health and Wellness PG 409-24
Synopsis: Establishing a Workgroup on Health and Wellness in Prince George's County to review and evaluate health and wellness practices, programs, services, and resources in Prince George's County and make recommendations regarding best practices in health and wellness community programming in the county; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Prince George's County Executive, the Chair of the Prince George's County Council, the Governor, and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup on Health and Wellness in Prince George's County to review health practices, promote healthy eating, improve access to physical activity environments, and evaluate integrative health programs, with a report due by December 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Health Department
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County, including local health and wellness businesses, nonprofit organizations, and community members interested in health and wellness programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill may encourage local health and wellness businesses and promote health-related programs, which could support small business sustainability and reduce failure rates.

Title: Caroline County - Alcoholic Beverages - Barbershop and Beauty Salon License
Synopsis: Establishing a barbershop and beauty salon beer and wine license in Caroline County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Caroline County to issue the license to a holder of a certain barbershop or beauty salon permit; establishing a licensing fee of $100; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new beer and wine license for barbershops and beauty salons in Caroline County, allowing license holders to serve alcohol to customers during services.
responsible_party: The Board of License Commissioners for Caroline County
stakeholders: Barbershop and beauty salon customers in Caroline County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small businesses like barbershops and beauty salons increase revenue by offering alcohol, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Caroline County – Alcoholic Beverages – Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting License
Synopsis: Altering the 1-day beer and wine tasting (BWT) license in Caroline County to be a 1-day beer, wine, and liquor tasting (BWLT) license; altering certain qualifications for the license; and altering the amounts of alcoholic beverages an individual may consume at a tasting.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the existing 1-day beer and wine tasting license in Caroline County to include liquor, renaming it as a 1-day beer, wine, and liquor tasting license. It updates the qualifications, permissible quantities for tasting, and other regulations related to the license.
responsible_party: Caroline County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol tasting event organizers, consumers at tasting events, and alcohol producers in Caroline County.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies licensing and expands opportunities for small alcohol producers and organizers to conduct tastings, potentially reducing failure rates by providing clearer regulations and increased market exposure.

Title: Prince George's County - Stop Sign Monitoring Systems - Authorization PG 301-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the use of stop sign monitoring systems in school zones in Prince George's County, if authorized by local law; providing that the owner or driver of a motor vehicle recorded failing to obey a stop sign is subject to a citation and a certain civil penalty under certain circumstances; establishing certain defenses to a charge of an alleged violation recorded by a stop sign monitoring system; requiring the Prince George's County Department of Public Works and Transportation to make a certain report by December 1, 2025; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of stop sign monitoring systems in school zones in Prince George's County, Maryland, allowing for civil penalties and citations to be issued for violations, and establishes procedures for enforcement, reporting, and public notification.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Department of Public Works and Transportation, Maryland District Court, Maryland State Highway Administration, local law enforcement agencies, and contractors administering monitoring systems.
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners, drivers, local government agencies, law enforcement, and residents in Prince George's County, especially in school zones.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily involves traffic enforcement and civil penalties rather than business operations.

Title: Community Colleges - Contraception - Access Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring on or before certain dates each community college to develop and implement a plan to provide students with access to over-the-counter contraception; requiring each community college to submit a certain report to the Maryland Higher Education Commission by September 1 each year; requiring the Commission to submit a certain report to the General Assembly on or before October 1 each year; and authorizing the Maryland Department of Health, on request, to provide certain assistance to a community college.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland community colleges to develop and implement plans to provide students with access to over-the-counter contraception by August 1, 2025. It also mandates annual reporting on the implementation and collaboration with health organizations.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Community college students in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it may influence health access and education programs.

Title: Election Law - Recounts - Procedures
Synopsis: Requiring a petitioner for a recount to select the method for conducting the recount; limiting the methods from which the selection must be made; and requiring a local board of elections to preserve and store certain voter-verifiable paper records and conduct a recount in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland election law to specify recount procedures, including the method of recount, preservation of voter-verifiable paper records, and handling of duplicate ballots, with an emphasis on manual recounts and record integrity.
responsible_party: Local boards of elections and the State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, candidates, and election officials in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is focused on election procedures and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Montgomery County and Prince George's County - Rent Court Workforce Solutions Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Rent Court Workforce Solutions Pilot Program in Montgomery County and Prince George's County to provide residential tenants who are facing eviction for a failure to pay rent with information on workforce development and employment opportunities; and requiring by January 1, 2026 and each January 1 thereafter, a designated organization to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the number of individuals that were connected to workforce development programs or employment opportunities through the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Rent Court Workforce Solutions Pilot Program in Montgomery County and Prince George's County to connect tenants involved in failure to pay rent cases with workforce development resources and employment opportunities, including registered apprenticeships.
responsible_party: Designated organizations, which are the fiscal and administrative agents of the local workforce development boards in Montgomery and Prince George's counties.
stakeholders: Tenants involved in failure to pay rent cases in Montgomery and Prince George's counties, and the local workforce development programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to improve employment opportunities for tenants, which could help reduce the likelihood of eviction and associated small business failures related to rental income loss.

Title: Port of Baltimore - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the Port of Baltimore to be the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore.
bill_summary: The bill officially renames the Port of Baltimore to the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore, in honor of Helen Delich Bentley's contributions to the port and maritime industry.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation, specifically the Maryland Port Administration.
stakeholders: Maritime industry workers, port authorities, shipping companies, and residents near the port.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions that support port operations and infrastructure, which can help small businesses involved in shipping and logistics, but it does not directly specify programs aimed at reducing small business failure.

Title: Study on the Feasibility of Relocating the Prince George's County Public School System Headquarters PG 501-24
Synopsis: Requiring the Prince George's County Board of Education to hire an independent consultant to study and make recommendations on the feasibility of relocating the Prince George's County public school system headquarters and to report its recommendations by June 1, 2026; and requiring the County board to cover the cost of the study.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Prince George's County Board of Education to hire an independent consultant to study the feasibility of relocating the county's public school system headquarters, including site analysis, financial and environmental assessments, stakeholder engagement, and community input, with the study to be completed by June 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, parents, teachers, local residents, community organizations, and local businesses in Prince George's County.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on a feasibility study for relocating a school headquarters and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: State Board of Dietetic Practice - Dietitian-Nutritionists - Application Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring that an individual shall have received at a minimum a degree from a college or university accredited by an educational accrediting association as required by the Commission on Dietetic Registration to be licensed as a dietician-nutritionist.
bill_summary: The bill updates the application requirements for licensing dietitian–nutritionists in Maryland, including educational qualifications and certification standards, and allows for waivers of examination requirements for qualified applicants from other states or with certain certifications.
responsible_party: State Board of Dietetic Practice
stakeholders: Aspiring and current dietitian–nutritionists, educational institutions, and healthcare providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies licensing requirements and provides examination waivers, which may facilitate the entry of qualified professionals into the market, potentially reducing barriers for small businesses employing dietitian–nutritionists.

Title: Wildlife - Traveling Animal Acts - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from allowing for the participation of a bear, a cougar, an elephant, a jaguar, a leopard, a lion, a nonhuman primate, a tiger, or a hybrid of any of these animals in a traveling animal act; and providing a civil penalty of $2,000 per violation.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the participation of certain covered animals, such as bears, big cats, nonhuman primates, and hybrids, in traveling animal acts, and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: State or local law enforcement officers, officers or agents of the Department of Natural Resources, or local animal control authorities.
stakeholders: Animals involved in traveling animal acts, animal rights advocates, traveling entertainment industry, and the general public.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates; its focus is on animal welfare and regulation of traveling animal acts.

Title: State Emergency Medical Services Board - Licenses and Certificates - Application Requirements
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Emergency Medical Services (EMS) Board from requiring an applicant to provide proof that the applicant is lawfully present in the United States or have a Social Security number or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number as a condition for licensure or certification; and requiring the EMS Board to require applicants for a license or certificate to disclose certain information or provide alternative documentation and record the information in the applicant's file for a certain purpose.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland Emergency Medical Services (EMS) Board from requiring proof of lawful presence in the U.S. or a Social Security number for licensure or certification, but requires applicants to disclose their Social Security or Taxpayer Identification Number for record-keeping and child support enforcement purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland Emergency Medical Services (EMS) Board
stakeholders: Applicants seeking emergency medical services licenses or certificates in Maryland, including emergency medical personnel and related agencies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it primarily modifies licensing requirements for emergency medical services personnel.

Title: State Board of Examiners in Optometry - Criminal History Records Checks
Synopsis: Requiring an applicant for a license to practice optometry and certain applicants for the renewal of a license to submit to a criminal history records check obtained from the Criminal Justice Information Central Repository of the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services; and providing that information obtained from the Central Repository is confidential, may not be redisseminated, and is to be used only for licensing purposes.
bill_summary: The bill requires applicants for initial licensure and renewal of optometry licenses in Maryland to submit to criminal history records checks.
responsible_party: The State Board of Examiners in Optometry
stakeholders: Optometrists applying for or renewing their licenses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily involves licensing procedures for individual practitioners.

Title: Criminal and Civil Trespass - Professional Land Surveyors - Exception
Synopsis: Establishing exceptions to certain criminal prohibitions against trespass on property and the civil tort of trespass for professional land surveyors, and agents and employees of professional land surveyors, who enter the property of another to practice land surveying.
bill_summary: The bill establishes legal exceptions for professional land surveyors and their agents or employees from criminal and civil trespass liabilities when they enter private property to practice land surveying.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board for Professional Land Surveyors and the Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation
stakeholders: Licensed professional land surveyors, property owners, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides legal protections for professional land surveyors, which may reduce legal risks and liabilities, potentially supporting their business stability and success.

Title: Cosmetology Licensure Compact
Synopsis: Entering into the Cosmetology Licensure Compact; establishing criteria for participating states; authorizing an individual practicing cosmetology to practice in a party state under certain circumstances; establishing the Cosmetology Licensure Compact Commission and its duties and powers; and providing for the amendment of and withdrawal from the Compact.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland participation in the Cosmetology Licensure Compact, creating a multistate licensing framework for cosmetologists to practice across member states, enhancing mobility, public safety, and workforce flexibility.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation, specifically the Cosmetology Licensure Compact Commission, is responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Licensed cosmetologists, prospective cosmetology students, and the general public seeking cosmetology services in Maryland and other member states.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to reduce barriers to interstate practice, potentially decreasing small business failures by increasing workforce mobility and access to a broader market.

Title: Wage Payment and Collection - Pay Stubs and Pay Statements - Required Information
Synopsis: Requiring that a notice containing certain information provided to an employee at the time of hiring be written; requiring that the statement regarding earnings required to be provided to employees by employers be written on the physical pay stub or online pay statement and include certain information; requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to create and make available to an employer at no charge a pay stub template that may be used by an employer to comply with the Act; and establishing a certain administrative penalty.
bill_summary: The bill requires employers in Maryland to provide written pay stubs or online pay statements that include specific information about wages, deductions, and work hours. It also mandates the creation of a free pay stub template by the Commissioner of Labor and Industry and establishes penalties for non-compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Industry
stakeholders: Employees working for Maryland employers, small and large businesses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By providing clear guidelines and a free template for pay stubs, the bill aims to reduce payroll-related disputes and compliance issues, potentially decreasing small business failures related to wage disputes.

Title: Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program - Alterations (Maryland Meals for Achievement Flexibility Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Clarifying that secondary schools participating in the Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program may serve breakfast in any broadly accessible part of the school; and authorizing elementary schools participating in the Program, subject to certain approval and allowances, to serve breakfast in any broadly accessible part of the school, including from "Grab and Go" carts.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies and expands the Maryland Meals for Achievement In–Classroom Breakfast Program by allowing secondary schools to serve breakfast in any broadly accessible part of the school, and with approval, elementary schools may do the same, including from 'Grab and Go' carts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students in Maryland schools, especially those participating in the breakfast program
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it supports school meal programs which could indirectly impact local vendors and suppliers.

Title: Public Information Act – Surveillance Images – Illegal Dumping in Baltimore City
Synopsis: Altering a requirement that a custodian deny inspection of certain surveillance images of illegal dumping in Baltimore City to allow inspection by an employee or agent of the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development; and authorizing the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development to publicly disseminate a surveillance image as part of an investigation.
bill_summary: The bill modifies laws regarding the inspection and dissemination of surveillance images related to illegal dumping in Baltimore City. It allows certain city employees to inspect these images and permits the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development to publicly disseminate surveillance images during investigations.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Baltimore City, especially those affected by illegal dumping and surveillance practices
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on illegal dumping surveillance and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Commission on African American History and Culture - Museum Name Change
Synopsis: Altering the name of the museum operated by the Commission on African American History and Culture in certain provisions of law from the "Banneker-Douglass Museum" to the "Banneker-Douglass-Tubman Museum".
bill_summary: The bill changes the name of the Banneker–Douglass Museum operated by the Maryland Commission on African American History and Culture to the Banneker–Douglass–Tubman Museum.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission on African American History and Culture
stakeholders: African American community, museum visitors, cultural and historical organizations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or provide programs aimed at small business support.

Title: Human Relations - Commission on Civil Rights - Appeal of Final Orders
Synopsis: Providing that a certain final order of the Commission on Civil Rights on a complaint alleging a discriminatory act is appealable in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act.
bill_summary: The bill allows final orders of the Maryland Commission on Civil Rights regarding complaints of discrimination to be appealed in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act, providing a clearer process for appeals.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission on Civil Rights
stakeholders: Individuals who file discrimination complaints and are affected by the Commission's decisions
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Prince George's County - Sales and Use Tax on Energy and Fuel - Use of Revenue PG 407-24
Synopsis: Altering a certain provision of law relating to the use of certain revenue from the sales and use tax on energy and fuel in Prince George's County by allowing the revenue to be used to meet certain education funding requirements for the county; and repealing a requirement that the county appropriate a certain amount of local money to the school operating budget each fiscal year.
bill_summary: The bill allows revenue from the sales and use tax on energy and fuel in Prince George's County to be used to meet education funding requirements, and repeals a previous requirement that the county allocate a specific amount of local money to the school operating budget each year.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Government and the Prince George's County Council
stakeholders: Public school students and residents of Prince George's County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by reallocating tax revenue for education, it may indirectly impact local economic stability.

Title: Public Utilities – Thermal Energy Network Systems – Authorization and Establishment (Working for Accessible Renewable Maryland Thermal Heat (WARMTH) Act)
Synopsis: Requiring gas companies serving at least 75,000 customers in their distribution territories and authorizing gas companies serving fewer than 75,000 customers to develop a plan for a pilot thermal energy network system or systems on or before October 1, 2024; requiring certain gas companies to submit a certain proposal or proposals to the Public Service Commission for approval on or before July 1, 2025; authorizing certain entities or a community organization to submit neighborhoods for consideration as part of a pilot system; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes and establishes pilot thermal energy network systems developed by gas companies to replace gas infrastructure with renewable thermal energy, focusing on low and moderate income communities, with provisions for funding, community engagement, and evaluation.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in low and moderate income housing, community organizations, and local governments involved in pilot projects.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill promotes local employment, workforce development, and community engagement, which can help small businesses participate in and benefit from the projects, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Prince George's County - Taxes on Telecommunications Services - Use of Revenue PG 406-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the Prince George's County Council to impose an excise tax on certain telecommunications service in Prince George's County in addition to, or instead of, a sales and use tax; altering a certain provision of law relating to the use of certain revenue from a certain tax on telecommunications services by allowing the revenue to be used to meet certain education funding requirements for the county; requiring the county to submit an annual report detailing the expenditure of revenues generated by a tax imposed by the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to impose a local excise tax on telecommunications services, in addition to or instead of a sales and use tax. The revenue from this tax will be used primarily to fund public education in the county, including specific programs such as support for low-performing students and bilingual education, as well as capital improvements.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Council and the Prince George's County government
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County, especially students and families benefiting from local education programs and school infrastructure improvements
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill directs a significant portion of telecommunications tax revenue to support education and school infrastructure, which can improve community stability and economic conditions, potentially reducing small business failures indirectly.

Title: Public Safety - Wellness Checks - Requirements (Gabriel's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring a law enforcement agency that receives a certain request for a wellness check of an individual to conduct a wellness check or submit a request for the relevant law enforcement agency to conduct a wellness check without unreasonable delay; and requiring a fire, rescue, or emergency medical services entity to conduct the wellness check simultaneously with the law enforcement agency if the request concerns a life-threatening condition.
bill_summary: The bill requires law enforcement, fire, rescue, and emergency medical services to conduct wellness checks promptly upon receiving qualified requests, especially when there is a concern for a life-threatening condition. It establishes procedures for immediate action and cross-jurisdictional cooperation.
responsible_party: Maryland law enforcement agencies, fire departments, rescue squads, and emergency medical services.
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland who may be the subject of wellness checks, including vulnerable populations and those with health or safety concerns.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts emergency response agencies and does not directly address small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Mental Health Law - County Mental Health Advisory Committees - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of a county's mental health advisory committee by including an individual with experience with mental health care for veterans or individuals serving in the military on the list of groups from which individuals may be appointed to the committee by the governing body of the county.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to include individuals with experience in mental health care for veterans or military personnel as members of county mental health advisory committees.
responsible_party: County governments and their designated mental health advisory committees
stakeholders: Veterans, military personnel, their families, and the general public served by mental health programs in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or economic development; its focus is on mental health advisory committee membership.

Title: Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Equitech Growth Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Specifying that the Equitech Growth Fund in the Maryland Technology Development Corporation may be used only to make certain awards and to pay the costs of administering the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Equitech Growth Fund, managed by the Maryland Technology Development Corporation, to support economic growth through workforce development and infrastructure projects that attract and retain businesses. It allocates $5 million annually from 2025 to 2033 for grants, investments, or loans to public, private, and nonprofit entities, with a focus on inclusive growth and leveraging additional funding.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Emerging and advanced industries, workforce, businesses, higher education institutions, and communities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support business growth and infrastructure, which can help reduce small business failures by providing targeted funding and resources.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Reports on Standing Orders and Opioid Overdose Reversal Drugs
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on current opioid overdose reversal drugs and, for any current opioid overdose reversal drug approved by the federal Food and Drug Administration, whether the Department has added the drug to a standing order and, if not, the reasons why the drug has not been added; and requiring the report to be submitted by December 1, 2024, December 1, 2025, and December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires licensed healthcare providers issuing standing orders for opioid overdose reversal drugs to allow individuals to choose any formulation approved by the FDA. It also mandates the Maryland Department of Health to report on current FDA-approved opioid overdose reversal drugs and whether they have been added to standing orders, on or before December 1 of 2024, 2025, and 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals at risk of opioid overdose and healthcare providers involved in prescribing or dispensing overdose reversal drugs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill facilitates easier access to opioid overdose reversal drugs, which can help reduce overdose deaths and related business failures in healthcare and pharmacy sectors.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Administration - Clarification and Technical Correction
Synopsis: Clarifying that the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System may pay certain incentive compensation to the Chief Investment Officer for the State Retirement and Pension System if the Chief Investment Officer retires from the Investment Division of the State Retirement Agency in a certain manner; and correcting a certain incorrect reference of an age restriction applying to certain members of the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System who participate in the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP).
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the conditions under which the Chief Investment Officer of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System can receive incentive payments upon retirement, and it extends the participation period in the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP) for certain members of the State Police and Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, with specific age and extension rules.
responsible_party: The Board of Trustees for the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System and the Department of State Police.
stakeholders: Members of the State Police Retirement System and the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, including officers participating in the DROP program.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Public Schools - Active Shooter Safety Drills or Trainings - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Center for School Safety to collaborate with an institution of higher education or a designated federal or national research entity to study the effectiveness and impact of active shooter safety drills or trainings by researching and analyzing data collected by local school systems; requiring the Center to identify best practices for active shooter safety drills or trainings on or before October 1, 2024; requiring local school systems to provide parents with the annual schedule of active shooter safety drills; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Center for School Safety to study the effectiveness and psychological impact of active shooter drills, identify best practices, and update these practices periodically. It also mandates the Department of Education to incorporate developmentally appropriate active shooter drills into the school safety schedule, with specific guidelines to ensure trauma sensitivity. Schools must notify parents, provide mental health support, and collect data on the drills' effectiveness.
responsible_party: Maryland Center for School Safety and Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, parents, school personnel, and local school systems in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on school safety and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Grant Applications and Reporting - Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council by removing the Director of the Governor's Grants Office or the Director's designee and adding the Comptroller or the Comptroller's designee; requiring the Council to study and make recommendations to the Department of Budget and Management regarding the creation of a State Grants Ombudsperson by July 1, 2025; altering certain reporting requirements; and extending the termination date of the Council to June 30, 2029.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the composition and responsibilities of the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council, extends its duration, and requires it to study and recommend the creation of a State Grants Ombudsperson to improve grant processes and oversight in Maryland.
responsible_party: Department of Budget and Management and the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council
stakeholders: State grant-making agencies, grant applicants, nonprofit organizations, local governments, and other grant recipients in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to streamline grant processes and improve oversight, which could help small businesses and nonprofits access and manage grants more effectively, potentially reducing their failure rate.

Title: State and Local Parks - Play Area Accessibility - Recreation Communication Boards Pilot Program
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources and local governing bodies to construct communication boards in certain newly constructed public play areas; defining "communication board" as a device that displays photos, symbols, or illustrations to enable individuals with limited language skills to communicate; establishing the Maryland Recreation Communication Boards Pilot Program, subject to funding, to improve play area accessibility by covering the cost of purchasing and installing communication boards at State and local parks; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a pilot program to install communication boards in public play areas within Maryland parks to improve accessibility for individuals with limited language skills. It authorizes funding from the Park System Capital Improvements and Acquisition Fund and sets guidelines for construction and funding applications.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources and local governing bodies responsible for park construction and maintenance.
stakeholders: Children and individuals with limited language skills or disabilities who use public play areas in Maryland parks.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily involves public park improvements and accessibility enhancements.

Title: Montgomery County - Housing Opportunities Commission - Alterations MC 3-24
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement that the Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County hold public hearings on assisted family housing proposals; and repealing the requirement that the Montgomery Commission publish a summary of the Montgomery Commission's annual financial report in certain newspapers.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain requirements for the Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County, including holding public hearings on assisted family housing proposals and publishing a summary of its annual financial report in newspapers. It also updates reporting requirements to be posted on the Commission's website.
responsible_party: Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County
stakeholders: Residents of Montgomery County, especially those interested in housing development and transparency in housing agencies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects housing agency reporting and public hearing requirements, with no direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Places of Public Accommodation - Motion Picture Houses - Captioning
Synopsis: Requiring all motion picture houses to offer closed movie captioning for each screening of a motion picture, with a certain exception; and requiring, if a motion picture is produced and available to motion picture houses with open movie captioning, a place of public accommodation that controls, operates, owns, or leases a motion picture house with eight or more screens in the State to provide open movie captioning for at least two screenings for each motion picture it screens each week.
bill_summary: The bill requires motion picture houses in Maryland to offer closed captioning for each screening of a movie and to provide open captioning for at least two screenings each week if the movie is produced and available with captioning. It also specifies the timeline for implementing open captioning after a movie's premiere.
responsible_party: Motion picture houses in Maryland
stakeholders: People with hearing disabilities and the general public attending movie screenings in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a significant impact on small business failure rates, as they mainly involve accessibility requirements for movie theaters.

Title: Community Schools - Rental Assistance for Community School Families Program and Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Rental Assistance for Community School Families Program to provide rental assistance to eligible student households; requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development, in consultation with the State Department of Education, to administer the Program; establishing the Rental Assistance for Community School Families Fund; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $10,000,000 in the annual budget bill for the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Rental Assistance for Community School Families Program to provide rental and utility assistance to eligible student households in community schools, administered by the Department of Education in coordination with the Department of Housing and Community Development. It also creates a dedicated fund for this purpose.
responsible_party: Department of Education, in coordination with the Department of Housing and Community Development, and the Director of Community Schools in the Department.
stakeholders: Students and their families attending community schools who are at risk of homelessness or housing instability.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is focused on providing rental assistance to families, which may indirectly support small businesses such as landlords and utility providers, but the primary impact is on families, not small businesses.

Title: Department of Veterans Affairs - Renaming and Deputy Secretary of Military Family Policy and Programs
Synopsis: Renaming the Department of Veterans Affairs to be the Department of Veterans and Military Families; renaming the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to be the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families; requiring the Secretary to appoint a Deputy Secretary of Military Family Policy and Programs; and providing that the Department of Veterans and Military Families is the successor of the Department of Veterans Affairs.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs to the Department of Veterans and Military Families, establishes a Deputy Secretary of Military Family Policy and Programs, and makes related administrative updates.
responsible_party: The Department of Veterans and Military Families, specifically the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families, is responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Veterans and military families in Maryland will be impacted by the bill.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or include specific programs aimed at reducing small business failures.

Title: Courts and Judicial Proceedings and Criminal Procedure - Technical Corrections - References to Intellectual Disability
Synopsis: Replacing references to mental retardation with references to an intellectual disability in certain provisions of law.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law by replacing references to 'mental retardation' with 'intellectual disability' in various legal provisions related to courts, juvenile treatment, and criminal procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the courts (judicial system)
stakeholders: Individuals with intellectual disabilities, juvenile and criminal justice populations, and legal professionals in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Persons Providing Lobbyist Compensation – Statement of Political Contributions – Exemption for Nonprofits
Synopsis: Exempting nonprofit organizations qualified under § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code from the requirement for a person providing lobbyist compensation to file a statement of political contributions with the State Board of Elections.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain nonprofit organizations from the requirement to file statements of political contributions when providing lobbyist compensation, specifically those qualified under § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations, lobbyists, and political contributors in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it primarily pertains to nonprofit organizations and political contribution reporting.

Title: Child Support - Incarcerated Obligors
Synopsis: Authorizing a court, if an obligor becomes incarcerated, to determine that a material change of circumstances warranting a modification of child support has occurred, provided that the party's ability to pay child support is sufficiently reduced due to the incarceration.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's child support laws to account for incarceration, allowing courts to consider incarceration as a material change of circumstance warranting support modification, and suspends arrearages during incarceration and for 60 days after release. It also clarifies that incarcerated parents cannot be considered voluntarily impoverished when calculating potential income for support purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and the Family Court system
stakeholders: Incarcerated parents, their children, and child support enforcement agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it primarily addresses child support laws related to incarceration.

Title: Maryland Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council - Membership
Synopsis: Codifying provisions relating to the Maryland Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council; altering and clarifying the composition of the Council to include certain public and private sector members; requiring the Council to submit interim reports of its work to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024, and December 1, 2025; and requiring the Council to submit a final report of its work and recommendations by June 30, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council to develop plans and policies for integrating zero emission electric vehicles into Maryland's transportation network, including infrastructure, incentives, and public awareness campaigns.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation, Maryland Energy Administration, Maryland Public Service Commission, and other state agencies involved in transportation, energy, and environment.
stakeholders: Electric vehicle manufacturers, electric utility companies, government agencies, environmental organizations, vehicle dealers, and consumers interested in zero emission electric vehicles.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill encourages the development of electric vehicle infrastructure and policies that could support small businesses involved in manufacturing, installation, and maintenance of EV infrastructure, but it does not specify a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Income Tax Credit - Venison Donation
Synopsis: Allowing an individual, subject to certain requirements and limitations, to claim a credit against the State income tax for certain qualified expenses if the individual harvests an antlerless deer and donates the deer meat to certain organizations; limiting the amount of credits an individual may claim to a maximum of $300; and requiring by January 31 each year each venison donation program that received certain donations to report certain information about each donor who intended to claim the credit to the Comptroller.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals who harvest and donate antlerless deer meat to organizations to claim a state income tax credit of up to $75 per qualified expense, with a maximum total credit of $300 per year (or $600 if each deer is harvested under a deer management permit). It also provides legal immunity for those donating food to nonprofit organizations and requires annual reporting from donation programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office and the Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Deer hunters, nonprofit organizations accepting venison donations, and the general public benefiting from increased food donations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily involves individual hunters and nonprofit organizations.

Title: Comprehensive Flood Management Grant Program - Funding for Underserved and Overburdened Communities
Synopsis: Requiring at least 40% of funding provided under the comprehensive flood management grant program to be used for projects located in or directly benefiting underserved or overburdened communities; and authorizing the Governor to include in the annual State budget an appropriation of up to $20,000,000 for the comprehensive flood management grant program in fiscal year 2026 and each fiscal year thereafter.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funding for the Maryland comprehensive flood management grant program, requiring that at least 40% of the funds be used for projects in or benefiting underserved or overburdened communities starting in fiscal year 2026. It also authorizes the Governor to include up to $20 million annually in the state budget for this program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment, in coordination with the Department of Planning and the Board of Public Works.
stakeholders: Communities affected by flooding, including underserved and overburdened communities, local governments, and residents in flood-prone areas.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by funding flood management projects, it may help reduce flood-related damages that can impact local businesses.

Title: Tax Assistance for Low-Income Marylanders - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, beginning in fiscal year 2025, to distribute a certain amount of abandoned property funds to the Tax Clinics for Low-Income Marylanders Fund; requiring the Governor to include $800,000 in the annual budget for the CASH Campaign of Maryland to award grants for providing certain tax assistance through on-demand and mobile tax clinics; and requiring certain tax clinics to interact with the CASH campaign to ensure sufficient access to tax preparation services for low-income Maryland residents.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funds from abandoned property and other sources to support tax assistance programs for low-income Marylanders, including grants for mobile and on-demand tax clinics, and funding for the CASH Campaign to promote financial literacy and tax assistance.
responsible_party: The Comptroller's Office, Maryland Legal Services Corporation, University of Maryland School of Law, University of Baltimore School of Law, Maryland Volunteer Lawyers Service, and the CASH Campaign of Maryland.
stakeholders: Low-income Maryland residents, including seniors, rural communities, under-resourced communities, and new American populations who will benefit from tax assistance and financial education programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's programs are focused on individual low-income residents and do not directly target small business failure rates, so the impact on small business failure is likely minimal.

Title: Individual Tax Preparers - Code of Ethics, Notification of Actions, Enforcement, and Penalties (Stop Scam Tax Preparers Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Individual Tax Preparers to publish on the Board's website a certain code of ethics and rules of professional conduct by January 1, 2026; requiring the Board to notify the Comptroller and the Field Enforcement Bureau of a violation within 5 business days after the Board determines that the violation has occurred; granting certain employees of the Bureau certain powers, duties, and responsibilities for enforcing laws pertaining to income tax preparation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a code of ethics and rules of professional conduct for individual tax preparers, requires the Board of Individual Tax Preparers to publish these rules, enhances enforcement powers, and sets penalties for violations, including fines directed to a low-income tax clinics fund.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Board of Individual Tax Preparers and the Comptroller's Office, including the Field Enforcement Bureau.
stakeholders: Individual tax preparers, low-income Maryland residents, and the general public who rely on accurate tax preparation services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve the professionalism and enforcement in the tax preparation industry, which could reduce errors and fraudulent practices that lead to small business failures.

Title: Income Tax – Technical Corrections
Synopsis: Repealing certain obsolete provisions of law concerning the distribution of income tax revenue; and correcting a certain erroneous cross-reference.
bill_summary: This bill makes technical corrections to Maryland's income tax laws, including repealing obsolete provisions, correcting cross-references, and clarifying distribution of income tax revenue to municipalities and the General Fund. It also clarifies the eligibility for a tax credit related to revitalization projects.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office and Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Municipalities, individual taxpayers, nonprofit organizations, and businesses involved in revitalization projects in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates but may indirectly support revitalization efforts that benefit small businesses.

Title: Disclosure of Tax Information - Tax Compliance Activity and Binding Data Use Agreements
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "tax information" for purposes of law governing the confidentiality and disclosure of tax information; authorizing, subject to certain limitations, the disclosure of certain tax information to certain tax compliance organizations and governmental entities to assist the Comptroller in tax compliance activity; requiring the Comptroller to require the party to whom the information is to be disclosed to enter into a written, binding agreement regarding the use and security of the tax information; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules for disclosing tax information in Maryland, allowing certain tax information to be shared with tax compliance organizations and government entities to assist in tax compliance activities, under strict supervision and data use agreements.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Taxpayers, tax compliance organizations, government agencies involved in tax enforcement and compliance
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for secure sharing of tax information with authorized organizations could improve tax compliance and enforcement, potentially reducing small business failures due to better compliance and support.

Title: Comptroller - Electronic Tax and Fee Return Filing Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring, for periods beginning after December 31, 2026, that returns for certain taxes and fees collected by the Comptroller be filed electronically, subject to certain exceptions; altering certain requirements for electronic filing of returns for certain taxes; prohibiting a certain tax return preparer or software company from charging a separate fee for the electronic filing of certain tax documents; and prohibiting a software company from selling different versions of the same tax software under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that certain tax and fee returns collected by the Maryland Comptroller must be filed electronically starting after December 31, 2026, with some exceptions. It also prohibits charging separate fees for electronic filing and restricts selling different versions of tax software based on electronic filing fees.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller of the Treasury
stakeholders: Taxpayers, tax preparers, software companies, and local government agencies involved in tax collection and remittance.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By streamlining tax filing processes and reducing fees associated with electronic filing, the bill aims to make compliance easier for small businesses, potentially reducing their failure rate.

Title: Environment - Synthetic Turf - Disclosure and Study
Synopsis: Requiring a producer or seller of synthetic turf to disclose to a customer typical maintenance practices and costs for removing, replacing, and disposing of synthetic turf; and requiring the Department of the Environment, in consultation with representatives of the industry, local environmental and community stakeholders, and synthetic turf producers, retailers, and users, to conduct a study on the synthetic turf industry in the State and report its findings to certain committees of the General Assembly by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a system for tracking the chain of custody of synthetic turf installed on sports and playing fields in Maryland, including reporting requirements for custodians, a study on synthetic turf industry practices, and disclosures for consumers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Synthetic turf industry, sports field owners, local governments, schools, and community members using synthetic turf fields.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions for industry study and improved disposal and recycling practices, which could help small businesses involved in manufacturing, installation, and disposal of synthetic turf by providing clearer guidelines and data.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Protection of Identity of Minor Victim
Synopsis: Providing that a court or a party in a criminal or juvenile delinquency case may not disclose or allow inspection of an electronic or paper court filing to a nonparty to the case unless the court or the party disclosing or allowing inspection of the filing redacts all identifying information relating to a minor victim that appears in the filing, unless the court finds by clear and convincing evidence that there is good cause to order otherwise.
bill_summary: The bill requires that in criminal or juvenile cases, any court filing that includes identifying information of a minor victim must be redacted to protect the victim's privacy. It also authorizes the Supreme Court of Maryland to establish rules for filing unredacted copies under seal.
responsible_party: The Supreme Court of Maryland and the courts handling criminal and juvenile cases.
stakeholders: Minor victims of crimes or juvenile acts, their families, and the legal system involved in criminal and juvenile cases.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on protecting minor victims' privacy in court filings and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Health - State Advisory Council on Quality Care at the End of Life - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the State Advisory Council on Quality Care at the End of Life to be the State Advisory Council on Serious Illness Care.
bill_summary: The bill renames the State Advisory Council on Quality Care at the End of Life to the State Advisory Council on Serious Illness Care, and updates related references and responsibilities to reflect this change.
responsible_party: The Department of Aging and the Office of the Attorney General, jointly, are responsible for providing staff support and technical assistance to the Advisory Council.
stakeholders: Healthcare providers, patients with serious or end-of-life illnesses, advocacy groups, and the general public involved in or affected by end-of-life and serious illness care policies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or include programs aimed at reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Health Occupations – Practice Audiology – Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "practice audiology" for the purposes of certain provisions of law governing the licensure and regulation of audiologists to include certain procedures that do not require anesthesia.
bill_summary: The bill updates the legal definition of 'practice audiology' in Maryland, clarifying the scope of audiologists' activities, including evaluation, diagnosis, management, and treatment of auditory and vestibular conditions, as well as certain non-surgical procedures and the use of sound processors.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Health or the Maryland Board of Audiologists and Hearing Aid Dispensers
stakeholders: Audiologists, individuals with hearing or vestibular conditions, and patients receiving audiology services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's clarification of practice scope may streamline licensing and operational procedures for audiologists, potentially reducing barriers to entry and failure for small audiology practices.

Title: Workplace Fraud and Prevailing Wage - Violations - Civil Penalty and Referrals
Synopsis: Increasing, from $5,000 to $10,000, the maximum civil penalty for the knowing failure of an employer to properly classify an individual as an employee; and requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry, on a showing by clear and convincing evidence that a violation has occurred,  to refer to the Comptroller, certain State's Attorneys, the U.S. Department of Justice, the U.S. Department of Labor, and the U.S. Department of the Treasury complaints that allege a violation of certain tax laws.
bill_summary: The bill increases penalties for employers who knowingly misclassify workers and violate prevailing wage laws, including civil penalties, fines, and potential imprisonment. It also mandates referrals of certain violations to federal and state agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Industry, Maryland Department of Budget and Management, the Secretary of State, the Comptroller, the Maryland Insurance Administration, and other State agencies.
stakeholders: Employers, employees, and contractors in Maryland, especially those involved in wage and classification violations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is indirect, primarily through increased enforcement and penalties for violations, which may encourage compliance but does not directly address business failure.

Title: Commission to Advance Lithium-Ion Battery Safety in Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Advance Lithium-Ion Battery Safety in Maryland to study and make legislative, regulatory, programmatic, or other recommendations regarding certain best practices, standards, and guidelines; requiring the Commission to submit an interim progress report to the Legislative Policy Committee by December 1, 2024; and requiring the Commission to submit a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Commission to Advance Lithium–Ion Battery Safety in Maryland, tasked with studying and recommending best practices, standards, and policies to improve the safety, reuse, and recycling of lithium-ion batteries, including fire prevention and response.
responsible_party: The Office of the State Fire Marshal and the Maryland Energy Administration.
stakeholders: Battery manufacturers, vehicle manufacturers, first responders, recycling facilities, utility companies, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve safety standards and practices for lithium-ion batteries, which could reduce failures and accidents involving batteries, thereby supporting small businesses involved in manufacturing, recycling, and related sectors.

Title: Election Law - Postelection Procedures
Synopsis: Altering the records and documents that a board of canvassers is required to investigate under certain circumstances; altering the responsibilities of the State Administrator, the State Board of Elections, and the Board of State Canvassers regarding the certification of election results; authorizing the members of the Board of State Canvassers to appoint certain designees to serve on the Board of State Canvassers; and altering the responsibilities of the Governor regarding election results.
bill_summary: The bill modifies postelection procedures in Maryland, including investigation of records, verification of vote counts, and certification of election results, and allows certain designees to serve on the Board of State Canvassers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and the Governor's Office
stakeholders: Candidates, voters, and election officials in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on election procedures and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Education - School Mapping Data Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the School Mapping Data Program in the Maryland Center for School Safety; providing that the purpose of the Program is to provide funds to local school systems to produce school mapping data for each public school and public charter school in the county to assist first responders in responding to emergencies at a school; authorizing the use of the Safe Schools Fund to provide funding to local school systems for the program; and requiring a certain custodian of records to deny inspection of school mapping data.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the School Mapping Data Program to create standardized digital maps of public schools for emergency response, and allocates funds for school safety initiatives, including training and safety evaluations.
responsible_party: The Maryland Center for School Safety and the Interagency Commission on School Construction.
stakeholders: Public school students, staff, local law enforcement, and emergency responders.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on school safety and mapping data, with no direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Education - Open-Source Phonics Matching Grant Program - Establishment (Open-Source Phonics Matching Grant Program Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Open-Source Phonics Matching Grant Program within the State Department of Education to provide free, open-source phonics learning materials to be used by adults to tutor students; requiring the Department to periodically review the open-source phonics learning materials to ensure the materials are consistent with best practices in literacy education, including the science of reading; and requiring the Governor each fiscal year to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $150,000 to the Program.
