decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts consumer reporting practices and does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Next Generation Scholars of Maryland Program - Program Administrator - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the administrator of the Next Generation Scholars of Maryland Program to be the Maryland Higher Education Commission rather than the State Department of Education; and requiring the Department to assist the Commission with the review of applications and the selection of nonprofit organizations to administer the Program in local school systems.
bill_summary: The bill changes the administrator of the Next Generation Scholars of Maryland Program from the State Department of Education to the Maryland Higher Education Commission, clarifies the Department's role in assisting, and updates program reporting and funding provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students in Maryland who are eligible for the program, including those receiving free or reduced-price lunch, and nonprofit organizations involved in program delivery.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill encourages partnerships with business and higher education institutions, which could support small business engagement, but does not directly target small business failure.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Board of Trustees - Responsibilities and Duties
Synopsis: Clarifying the topics that may be included in certain training required for each trustee on the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System; providing that the Board of Trustees may satisfy a requirement to provide each member and retiree in the several systems with a personal statement that includes certain information about the several systems and the member's or retiree's benefits by providing each member and retiree the information through an online portal.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the topics that trustees of the State Retirement and Pension System must be trained on, and requires the Board of Trustees to provide members and retirees with a personal statement of benefits through an online portal, including information about their vested benefits, vesting date, and present value of annuities.
responsible_party: The Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members and retirees of the State Retirement and Pension System in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Health Occupations - Clinical Marriage and Family Therapists - Reciprocal Licensure Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the licensure requirements that the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists may waive, and the circumstances under which the requirements may be waived, for applicants for a license to practice clinical marriage and family therapy in the State who are licensed or certified to practice clinical marriage and family therapy in another state, territory, or jurisdiction.
bill_summary: The bill modifies licensure requirements for clinical marriage and family therapists in Maryland, allowing the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to waive certain requirements for applicants licensed in other jurisdictions, provided they meet specific criteria.
responsible_party: State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Licensed clinical marriage and family therapists, prospective applicants from other states, and the general public seeking mental health services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could reduce barriers for licensed therapists from other states to practice in Maryland, potentially increasing the number of practitioners and reducing the risk of small business failure among therapy practices.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Consumer Price Index - Definition
Synopsis: Updating the definition of "Consumer Price Index" to replace the 1967 index with the 1982-1984 index as the reference used by the State Retirement and Pension System for certain calculations.
bill_summary: The bill updates the definition of the 'Consumer Price Index' used by the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System to reference the 1982–1984 index instead of the 1967 index for certain calculations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Retirees and future retirees of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Service Credit
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement for certain transfers of service to be calculated under a certain formula; correcting a reference to a contribution rate for transfers of service into the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System; and providing for eligibility and service credit in the Employees' Pension System for certain contractual employment by certain members.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain contractual employees of the Maryland Department of Legislative Services to earn service credit in the Employees' Pension System for employment exceeding 5 years, with a maximum of 10 years, provided they file a claim by December 31, 2024, and pay the appropriate contributions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency and the Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Contractual employees of the Maryland Department of Legislative Services who have worked over 5 years and are eligible for pension benefits
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to pension service credits for government employees.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Golf Simulator Facility
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue a Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license to a golf simulator facility under certain circumstances; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption under certain circumstances; requiring the license holder to submit an annual gross sales report to the Board before a license may be renewed; and establishing an annual license fee of $1,500.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Harford County to issue a new Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license, allowing golf simulator venues to sell alcohol for on-premises consumption under specific conditions, including food service and sales restrictions.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Harford County
stakeholders: Golf simulator facility operators and patrons in Harford County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a clear licensing pathway and operational guidelines for golf simulator businesses, which may help reduce business failure by clarifying legal requirements and revenue opportunities.

Title: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center – Student Information – United States Census Bureau
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governing Board of the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to authorize the Center to send student information to the United States Census Bureau.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to send certain student information to the United States Census Bureau for research purposes, with protocols for data security and privacy.
responsible_party: Governing Board of the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center
stakeholders: Students and educational institutions in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Performing Arts Nonprofit Organization License
Synopsis: Establishing in Harford County a performing arts nonprofit organization beer, wine, and liquor license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption at up to three locations designated at the time of application; requiring the holder of the license to comply with certain record-keeping and reporting requirements; establishing an annual license fee of $750; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new performing arts nonprofit organization license in Harford County, Maryland, allowing eligible nonprofit organizations to sell or serve alcohol at certain venues during performances and related events, with specific record-keeping and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Harford County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Performing arts nonprofit organizations, event attendees, and local residents in Harford County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a specialized license for nonprofit performing arts organizations to sell alcohol, which could support their financial stability and event success, potentially reducing small business failure.

Title: Allegany County - Property Tax Credit - Evergreen Heritage Center
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Allegany County or a municipal corporation in Allegany County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on property that is owned by the Evergreen Heritage Center.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Allegany County or its municipal corporations to grant property tax credits to certain entities, including the Evergreen Heritage Center Foundation, Inc., and Evergreen Heritage Center Holdings, LLC, for properties they own.
responsible_party: Allegany County government or municipal corporations within Allegany County
stakeholders: Property owners such as the Evergreen Heritage Center Foundation, Inc., Evergreen Heritage Center Holdings, LLC, and other designated entities in Allegany County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides property tax relief to specific organizations, which may help reduce financial burdens and support stability, potentially decreasing small business failure rates.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - Police Auxiliary and Reserve Volunteers
Synopsis: Increasing, from $5,000 to $7,000, a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for an individual who is a qualifying police auxiliary or reserve volunteer.
bill_summary: The bill increases the income tax subtraction modification for individuals who are qualifying police auxiliary or reserve volunteers, providing additional tax relief for these volunteers.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Comptroller and the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Police auxiliary and reserve volunteers, fire, rescue, and emergency medical services volunteers, and related public safety organizations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates; it focuses on tax modifications for volunteers in public safety organizations.

Title: Property and Casualty Insurance – Pet Insurance – Regulation
Synopsis: Establishing requirements and prohibitions for pet insurance policies that are issued to a resident of the State or are sold, solicited, negotiated, or offered in the State, including disclosure requirements and requirements and prohibitions related to wellness programs; and requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration, on or before June 1, 2025, to develop informational material about pet insurance policies that may be disseminated to and posted by veterinary practitioners.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for pet insurance policies in Maryland, including disclosure requirements, prohibitions on certain wellness programs, and development of informational materials for veterinary practitioners. It aims to create a comprehensive legal framework for pet insurance in the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Pet owners in Maryland and veterinary practitioners
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's regulations and disclosure requirements may help small pet insurance providers operate more transparently, potentially reducing business failures due to legal or compliance issues.

Title: Labor and Employment - Equal Pay for Equal Work - Wage Range Transparency
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that an employer disclose certain wage information to an applicant for employment; requiring an employer to disclose certain wage information in certain postings and to certain employees at certain times; requiring an employer to set the wage range disclosed in good faith; requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to develop and make available to employers a form that an employer may use to comply with certain wage disclosure requirements; prohibiting certain retaliatory action by an employer; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires employers in Maryland to disclose wage ranges in job postings and to employees, set wage ranges in good faith, and keep records of compliance. It also establishes penalties for violations and protections against retaliation for employees and applicants who exercise these rights.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Industry
stakeholders: Job applicants, current employees, and employers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By promoting wage transparency and fair pay practices, the bill aims to create a more equitable work environment, which can contribute to the stability and success of small businesses.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor - Report on Apprenticeship Mentoring Ratios
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report to the General Assembly that analyzes the apprenticeship mentoring ratio for all nontraditional apprenticeable occupations in the State; and requiring the Department to submit the report to the General Assembly by October 1, 2024, with recommendations for strategies to streamline the expansion of apprenticeship ratios for all newly registered nontraditional apprenticeship occupations for purposes of meeting the goals of the Apprenticeship 2030 Commission.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to adopt regulations establishing a 3:1 apprentice-to-journeyperson ratio for nontraditional and newly registered apprenticeship occupations, and to submit a report analyzing apprenticeship mentoring ratios and strategies for expansion.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Apprentices, employers, and workers in nontraditional and newly registered apprenticeship occupations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support the expansion of apprenticeship programs, which can help small businesses by providing a skilled workforce and reducing training costs, potentially decreasing small business failure rates.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting Permit
Synopsis: Establishing a beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit in St. Mary's County; authorizing the Board to issue the permit only to a holder of a Class A license; authorizing the holder to allow the on-premises consumption of beer, wine, and liquor for tasting purposes only; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit in St. Mary’s County, allowing holders of Class A licenses to offer tastings on their premises for specified periods and under certain conditions.
responsible_party: St. Mary’s County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol retailers and consumers in St. Mary’s County who participate in tastings.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small alcohol retailers by providing a legal framework for tastings, potentially increasing sales and customer engagement, which may reduce business failure.

Title: St. Mary’s County – Alcoholic Beverages – Nonprofit Performing Arts Theater License
Synopsis: Establishing in St. Mary's County a performing arts theater beer and wine license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer and wine in certain performing arts theaters at retail for on-premises consumption; and establishing an annual license fee of $300.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a nonprofit performing arts theater beer and wine license in St. Mary’s County, allowing eligible nonprofit theaters to sell or serve beer and wine for on-premises consumption during performances and fundraisers.
responsible_party: St. Mary’s County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Nonprofit performing arts theaters and their audiences in St. Mary’s County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a new license option for nonprofit theaters, which could help them generate additional revenue and reduce financial difficulties, potentially lowering the failure rate of such small organizations.

Title: Large Family Child Care Homes and Child Care Centers - Child Care Teachers - Minimum Age
Synopsis: Requiring that certain regulations governing the registration and operation of large family child care homes and the licensing and operation of child care centers require that child care teachers be at least 18 years old.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that child care teachers in large family child care homes and child care centers in Maryland must be at least 18 years old, and sets requirements for training, water safety notices, emergency plans, and probationary employment qualifications.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Child care providers, children in child care, parents, and families utilizing child care services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By establishing clear regulations and minimum age requirements, the bill aims to support the stability and quality of child care businesses, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Court Personnel - Protection of Personal Information (Judge Andrew F. Wilkinson Judicial Security Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain protected individual or the Office of Information Privacy in the Administrative Office of the Courts to request that a governmental entity or person not publish personal information of the individual on the Internet, social media, or social networks or remove the information from any existing publication; specifying certain procedures for the protection of personal information of a protected individual; authorizing certain relief for a violation of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances the protection of personal information of judicial officers and their families by establishing procedures for requesting the removal or non-publication of personal data, creating a judicial address confidentiality program, and forming a task force to improve courthouse security.
responsible_party: The Office of Information Privacy in the Administrative Office of the Courts and the Maryland judiciary.
stakeholders: Judicial officers, their families, court personnel, and the general public who access court records.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it aims to improve safety and privacy for judicial personnel, which could indirectly benefit the stability of related small businesses.

Title: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program - State Supplement
Synopsis: Lowering the minimum age from 62 to 60 years old that a member of a household must be for eligibility for a State-provided supplemental benefit under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program; and increasing the amount of the supplemental benefit that the State must provide from $40 to $50.
bill_summary: The bill lowers the minimum age for household members to be eligible for a State-provided supplemental benefit under the SNAP program, increases the amount of the supplemental benefit, and clarifies program administration details.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Households participating in the SNAP program, especially those with elderly members and low-income individuals
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts social welfare programs and does not directly influence small business failure rates.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Sheriff - Salary
Synopsis: Making the salary of the Sheriff of Anne Arundel County equal to the salary of a captain in the Anne Arundel County Police Department at step 20 in the pay scale, beginning in calendar year 2025.
bill_summary: The bill increases the salary of the Sheriff of Anne Arundel County, setting it at a fixed amount through 2024 and then tying it to the salary of a police captain starting in 2025.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Government or Sheriff’s Office
stakeholders: Residents of Anne Arundel County, law enforcement personnel, and local government officials
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Benefits - Hearing Loss
Synopsis: Altering the frequencies in which industrial noise must be for an employer to be required to provide workers' compensation to a covered employee for hearing loss; altering the method used to determine the percentage of hearing loss deafness for purposes of workers' compensation; and altering the method used to determine the deduction required to be made to allow for the average amount of hearing loss from nonoccupational causes in the population for purposes of calculating workers' compensation benefits for occupational deafness.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's workers' compensation laws regarding hearing loss by changing the frequencies considered for industrial noise exposure, the method for calculating hearing loss percentages, and including tinnitus as part of hearing loss for compensation purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland Workers' Compensation Commission and employers in Maryland
stakeholders: Employees in Maryland who are exposed to industrial noise and may suffer hearing loss, including those with tinnitus
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily updates technical standards and calculation methods for workers' compensation claims related to hearing loss.

Title: Right to Try Act - Individualized Investigational Treatments
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law authorizing certain activity by manufacturers of investigational drugs, biological products, or devices under the Right to Try Act to apply to manufacturers of certain individualized investigational treatments; altering the definition of "eligible patient" under the Right to Try Act to include individuals who have life-threatening or severely debilitating illnesses, rather than only individuals who have terminal illnesses; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Right to Try Act to include individualized investigational treatments based on a patient's genetic profile, broadens eligibility to include individuals with life-threatening or severely debilitating illnesses, and allows health insurance coverage for such treatments. It also removes restrictions on payments and profits for manufacturers of investigational treatments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Patients with life-threatening or severely debilitating illnesses seeking experimental treatments, healthcare providers, and investigational treatment manufacturers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for coverage and reduced restrictions aim to facilitate the development and use of individualized treatments, potentially reducing small business failures in the biotech and pharmaceutical sectors involved in such treatments.

Title: Public Higher Education - Communities of Interest - Targeted Recruitment and Outreach Efforts
Synopsis: Altering certain principles of public higher education in the State to include a principle that public higher education in Maryland should be committed to promoting diversity and inclusion at certain institutions by attracting and graduating a diverse student body committed to service; requiring certain public senior higher education institutions to adopt a certain written policy related to targeted recruitment and outreach efforts in certain communities of interest; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires public higher education institutions in Maryland to adopt policies for targeted recruitment and outreach efforts to underrepresented communities, and to report annually on these efforts and their outcomes.
responsible_party: Public senior higher education institutions in Maryland
stakeholders: Students from historically underrepresented groups and communities of interest in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill focuses on education and outreach efforts, which are not directly related to small business support or failure reduction.

Title: Environment - Nuclear Power Plants - Emergency Preparedness (Radiation and Emergency Preparedness and Protection Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Radiation Emergency Response Program in the Department of the Environment; requiring the Department to serve as an offsite response organization and the lead State agency for all nuclear incidents within the State; requiring the Department to prepare a technical emergency radiation response plan, respond to emergencies involving a nuclear power plant, participate in a certain federal program, and procure certain specialized equipment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Radiation Emergency Response Program in Maryland, designates the Department of the Environment as the lead agency for nuclear incident response, and sets up a funding mechanism through fees paid by nuclear power plant owners to support emergency preparedness and response activities.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Residents living near nuclear power plants and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's primary focus is on emergency preparedness for nuclear incidents, with funding mechanisms that may indirectly support small businesses by enhancing safety and response capabilities, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Aerospace and Technology Commission
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Aerospace and Technology Commission in the Department of Commerce to promote innovation in the fields of space exploration and commercial aerospace opportunities, including the integration of space, aeronautics, and aviation industries into the economy of the State; requiring the Commission to develop a strategic plan; requiring the Commission to designate aerospace and technology zones in the State; requiring the Commission to submit a certain report by October 1 each year; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Aerospace and Technology Commission to promote innovation in space exploration and aerospace industries, creates a dedicated fund for aerospace development, and sets up programs, zones, and collaborations to support aerospace industry growth in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce and the Maryland Aerospace and Technology Commission
stakeholders: Aerospace industry businesses, higher education institutions, government agencies, and local communities involved in space exploration and aerospace development in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides grants, support, and strategic planning to foster aerospace industry growth, which could help reduce small business failures in this sector.

Title: Maryland Historical Trust - Historical and Cultural Museum Assistance Program - Funding
Synopsis: Altering prohibitions on grants from the Maryland Historical Trust; authorizing the Governor beginning in fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter, to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Trust to be used to provide grants to museums under the Historical and Cultural Museum Assistance Program.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes funding for the Maryland Historical Trust's Museum Assistance Program, allowing grants to museums for research, conservation, exhibits, education, planning, structural modifications, and operational support. It also establishes procedures for grant application review and distribution, and authorizes a $5 million annual appropriation starting in fiscal year 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Historical Trust
stakeholders: Museums and cultural institutions in Maryland, and the communities they serve.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily supports museums and cultural organizations, which are not typically classified as small businesses, so its direct impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Charles County - Adult Protective Services Review Board - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Adult Protective Services Review Board in Charles County to authorize the appointment of a physician's assistant or nurse practitioner in the field of psychiatry to serve on the board instead of a psychiatrist.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership composition of the Adult Protective Services Review Board in Charles County to allow a physician’s assistant or nurse practitioner in psychiatry to serve on the board instead of a psychiatrist.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Family Law or the local government authorities responsible for appointing review board members.
stakeholders: Adult protective services in Charles County, including vulnerable adults and professionals involved in adult protective services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Renters' Rights and Stabilization Act of 2024
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of Tenant and Landlord Affairs in the Department of Housing and Community Development to provide certain educational resources and information to tenants; requiring the Office to develop and publish a Maryland Tenants' Bill of Rights; requiring the most recently published version of the Maryland Tenants' Bill of Rights to be included as part of a residential lease; limiting the maximum security deposit required by a residential lease to 1 month's rent, except under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The Renters’ Rights and Stabilization Act of 2024 introduces measures to protect tenants, including establishing the Office of Tenants’ Rights, limiting security deposits, creating a Maryland Tenants’ Bill of Rights, and regulating landlord-tenant procedures. It also increases court surcharges to fund rental assistance and legal services, and enhances protections around property transfers and eviction data collection.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development and the Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Residential tenants, landlords, tenant advocacy groups, and public housing agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions primarily target tenant protections and court surcharge adjustments, which are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Real Estate Brokers – Commercial Transactions – Buyer’s Rights
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements and prohibitions for commercial real estate transactions related to a buyer's right to make certain title, settlement, and escrow selections.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements and prohibitions for commercial real estate transactions in Maryland, including a buyer's right to choose their own title insurance company, settlement company, escrow company, or title lawyer, and prohibits requiring a buyer to use a specific service provider as a condition of settlement. It also clarifies that sellers cannot be prohibited from offering owner financing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation (or relevant real estate regulatory agency)
stakeholders: Commercial real estate buyers and sellers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it primarily focuses on buyer rights and transaction transparency.

Title: Election Law - Election Judges - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board to develop and implement a marketing campaign to recruit individuals to serve as election judges; authorizing a local board to supplement the marketing campaign implemented by the State Board; requiring that a county employee who serves as an election judge during hours that the employee is scheduled to work receive certain administrative leave and certain election judge compensation; requiring the State Board to adopt certain regulations related to service as an election judge; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Elections to develop a marketing campaign to recruit election judges, standardizes procedures and documentation for election judge service, and adjusts compensation and administrative leave for election judges, including allowing public school students to earn service hours and receive pay for serving as election judges.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Election judges, voters, public school students, local election boards, county governments
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, focusing instead on election judge recruitment, compensation, and administrative procedures.

Title: Wage and Hour Law - Minor League Baseball Players - Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting minor league baseball players who are compensated under the terms of a collective bargaining agreement that expressly provides for the wages and working conditions of employees from the Maryland Wage and Hour Law.
bill_summary: The bill exempts minor league baseball players who are paid under a collective bargaining agreement that specifies wages and working conditions from Maryland's Wage and Hour Law.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or relevant state labor agency
stakeholders: Minor league baseball players in Maryland and their employers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily affects labor law exemptions for a specific group of employees.

Title: Licensed Real Estate Brokers - Branch Offices - Designation of Managers
Synopsis: Authorizing a licensed real estate broker to designate himself or herself as the manager of a branch office maintained by the licensed real estate broker.
bill_summary: The bill allows licensed real estate brokers in Maryland to designate themselves as managers of their branch offices, simplifying the process for managing branch offices and clarifying management requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Licensed real estate brokers, real estate salespersons, and associate brokers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill streamlines management designation processes, which may reduce administrative burdens and improve operational efficiency for real estate businesses, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Business Regulation – Household Goods Movers – Special Fund and Fees
Synopsis: Establishing the Household Goods Movers Registration Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund in the Maryland Department of Labor; requiring the Secretary of Labor to annually calculate certain costs; authorizing the Department to set by regulation certain fees based on certain calculations; prohibiting certain fees from increasing annually by more than 12.5% of certain existing and corresponding fees; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a dedicated fund for household goods movers in Maryland, sets up a system for calculating and setting registration and service fees, and ensures fees are used to cover the department's costs related to household goods moving regulation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Household goods movers and consumers in Maryland who use household moving services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to streamline fee setting and ensure proper funding for regulation, which could help small moving businesses by providing clear and stable regulatory costs.

Title: Fishing and Hunting Licenses and Trout Stamps - Complimentary Licenses and Stamp Exemption - Veterans Determined to be Unemployable
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to issue certain complimentary fishing and hunting licenses to certain veterans who the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs determines are unemployable; and exempting certain veterans who the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs determines are unemployable from the requirement to obtain a trout stamp.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to issue complimentary fishing, hunting, and trout stamps licenses to certain veterans who are determined to be unemployable by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, and exempts these veterans from purchasing trout stamps.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Veterans who are determined to be unemployable by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, including former prisoners of war and 100% service-connected disabled veterans, as well as the general fishing and hunting community in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it primarily provides benefits to veterans and does not involve small business operations.

Title: Carroll County – Deputy Clerk or Deputy Sheriff – Oath of Office
Synopsis: Requiring that every deputy clerk or deputy sheriff in Carroll County take and sign the oath or affirmation prescribed by the Maryland Constitution.
bill_summary: The bill requires deputy clerks and deputy sheriffs in Carroll County to take and sign the oath or affirmation prescribed by the Maryland Constitution, aligning their oath requirements with those of other counties and officials.
responsible_party: Carroll County Sheriff's Office and Clerk's Office, Maryland Courts and Judicial Proceedings
stakeholders: Deputy clerks and deputy sheriffs in Carroll County, Maryland residents served by these officials, and the county government
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to oath requirements for county officials.

Title: Office of the Attorney General - Rights of Residents of Health Care Facilities - Injunctive Relief
Synopsis: Authorizing the Attorney General to seek injunctive relief on behalf of the State on the basis of an imminent or ongoing violation of certain rights of residents of certain health care facilities; requiring that the resident bill of rights for assisted living program residents include certain rights; and prohibiting the Attorney General from duplicating certain corrective action by the Maryland Department of Health.
bill_summary: The bill enhances protections for residents of health care facilities and assisted living programs by granting the Attorney General authority to seek injunctive relief and impose civil penalties for violations of residents' rights, and by establishing a resident bill of rights for assisted living residents.
responsible_party: The Office of the Attorney General and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residents of health care facilities and assisted living programs in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions primarily focus on residents' rights and enforcement actions, with limited direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Health Insurance - Qualified Resident Enrollment Program (Access to Care Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to establish and implement the Qualified Resident Enrollment Program to facilitate the enrollment of qualified residents in qualified plans; providing that the operation and administration of the Program may include functions delegated by the Exchange to a third party; and providing that the implementation of the Program is contingent on approval of a certain waiver application amendment.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Qualified Resident Enrollment Program within the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to facilitate health insurance enrollment for qualified residents, including minors regardless of immigration status, who are seeking to enroll in qualified plans and are not eligible for certain federal or state programs. The program's implementation depends on federal waiver approval and aims to expand access to health coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Qualified residents of Maryland seeking health insurance, including minors and individuals regardless of immigration status
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates, focusing instead on health insurance enrollment for residents.

Title: Baltimore City – Control Over Powers of Police Commissioner
Synopsis: Repealing a prohibition on certain Baltimore City ordinances or acts of certain municipal officials from conflicting, impeding, obstructing, hindering, or interfering with the powers of the Baltimore City Police Commissioner; and making a portion of the Act contingent on the passage and ratification, by a certain date, of a certain Baltimore City Charter amendment.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a restriction that prevents Baltimore City ordinances or acts of municipal officials from interfering with the powers of the Baltimore City Police Commissioner. Its implementation is contingent on the ratification of a Baltimore City Charter amendment that clarifies the appointment, powers, and duties of the Police Commissioner and the Police Department.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Government, specifically the Baltimore City Council and the Mayor's Office, in coordination with the Baltimore City Police Department.
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, Baltimore City Police Department, municipal officials, and local government entities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects police powers and municipal governance, with no direct impact on small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Licensing Fees
Synopsis: Increasing certain licensing fees for alcoholic beverages in Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill updates and increases the licensing fees for various alcoholic beverage licenses in Baltimore City, including beer, wine, and liquor licenses, and establishes specific fees for special licenses such as festival, tasting, and event licenses.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, businesses serving alcohol, and consumers in Baltimore City
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's fee increases could impact small businesses by raising costs, but it also clarifies licensing procedures which may benefit compliance and operations.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Slow Moving Vehicles - Right-Hand Lane
Synopsis: Repealing a certain provision of law that applies the requirement that slow moving vehicles drive in the right-hand lane or lanes only to certain highways in certain geographic areas; and altering the standards under which the State Highway Administration is required to inform drivers of the requirement.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a law that required slow-moving vehicles to stay in the right-hand lane only on certain highways and geographic areas, and instead establishes a general policy that drivers of slower vehicles should drive in the right-hand lane when practicable, especially on rural interstate highways. It also requires the Maryland State Highway Administration to inform drivers of this policy through signage and driver education.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Drivers of slow-moving vehicles, general motorists, and residents in rural areas of Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily addresses traffic laws and does not directly impact small business operations or failure rates.

Title: Business Regulation - Licensed Home Improvement Contractors - Liability Insurance
Synopsis: Increasing from $50,000 to $500,000 the amount of general liability insurance that an applicant for a home improvement contractor license or a licensed home improvement contractor must maintain.
bill_summary: The bill increases the required minimum general liability insurance for applicants and licensed home improvement contractors in Maryland from $50,000 to $500,000.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or relevant licensing authority for home improvement contractors
stakeholders: Home improvement contractors and consumers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By increasing the liability insurance requirement, the bill may increase costs for small contractors, potentially impacting their financial stability and success.

Title: Northwest Baltimore County Sports Tourism Facility - Feasibility Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Stadium Authority to conduct a certain feasibility study for developing, establishing, and operating a  sports tourism facility at Reisterstown Regional Park in northwest Baltimore County; requiring the Authority to consult with certain governments, stakeholders, and entities; and requiring the Authority to submit a final report of its findings, conclusions, and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Stadium Authority to conduct a feasibility study for developing a sports tourism facility at Reisterstown Regional Park in northwest Baltimore County, including economic, infrastructure, and funding analyses, with a final report due by December 31, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority
stakeholders: Local residents, sports enthusiasts, regional businesses, and government agencies in northwest Baltimore County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure reduction, but the development of a sports tourism facility could potentially stimulate local economic activity and support small businesses indirectly.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Stadium License
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a stadium license in Frederick County to sell liquor for on-premises consumption in addition to beer and wine; and increasing the annual license fee for a stadium license in the county from $2,000 to $2,500.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the holder of a stadium license in Frederick County to sell liquor for on-premises consumption, in addition to beer and wine, and increases the annual license fee from $2,000 to $2,500.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Professional baseball teams, stadium visitors, and local residents in Frederick County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily modifies licensing and sales regulations for stadiums.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Promoter's Permit
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue a promoter's permit to a certain for-profit organization under certain circumstances; authorizing a permit holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor at an event; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules for alcohol permits in Frederick County, allowing certain organizations to obtain a promoter's permit to sell beer, wine, and liquor at events, with specific regulations and fee structures based on expected attendance.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Event organizers, for-profit organizations, and attendees at events in Frederick County where alcohol is sold or served.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small event organizers and organizations by simplifying alcohol permit processes and providing clear fee structures, potentially reducing barriers to hosting events.

Title: Corporations and Associations – Definitions, Emergencies, and Outstanding Stock – Revisions
Synopsis: Altering certain definitions as they relate to certain Maryland business entities; authorizing a corporation to adopt certain emergency bylaws; authorizing a corporation to take certain actions during an emergency; limiting the liability of certain persons for certain corporate acts taken during an emergency; and clarifying when certain stock is outstanding.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws concerning corporations and associations by allowing corporations to adopt emergency bylaws, take certain actions during emergencies, and limit liability for those actions. It clarifies definitions related to corporate stock and the principal office, and modifies procedures for corporate meetings and stock repurchases during emergencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Maryland corporations, limited liability companies, limited partnerships, and their directors, officers, employees, and stockholders during emergencies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for emergency management and flexible procedures during crises are likely to help small businesses by providing clearer guidelines and protections during emergencies.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Application and Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring an application for investment by the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to include an option for an applicant to provide certain demographic information of the applicant and the geographic area of the applicant's primary place of business; requiring the Corporation to submit a certain report to the Governor, the Maryland Economic Development Commission, and the General Assembly by October 1 each year concerning certain applicant and investment activities and certain demographic and geographic information; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to include an option for applicants to provide demographic information in their investment applications, prohibits adverse actions against those who decline, and mandates annual reporting on investment activities and demographic data.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Technology-based businesses applying for investment and the broader community benefiting from diverse economic development
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve understanding of applicant demographics and promote inclusive investment practices, which can help small businesses succeed by addressing barriers and encouraging diversity.

Title: State Board of Social Work Examiners - Board Membership and Certified Social Worker Licenses
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the State Board of Social Work Examiners; and repealing obsolete references to certified social worker licenses.
bill_summary: The bill updates the membership requirements for the Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners, including the types of licensed social workers who can serve on the board, and repeals obsolete references to certified social worker licenses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners
stakeholders: Licensed social workers, social work educators, and consumers of social work services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it primarily concerns licensing and board membership requirements for social workers.

Title: General Provisions - State Flag - Casket of an Eligible Decedent
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of State to furnish a State flag to drape the casket of an eligible decedent; establishing the process for a State flag to be claimed after burial; providing that only one flag may be provided for the death of an eligible decedent; and prohibiting the Secretary of State from procuring a flag that is not wholly produced in the United States.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Secretary of State to provide a U.S.-made state flag to drape the casket of certain eligible deceased individuals, such as state employees, officials, and legislators, and establishes procedures for requesting and claiming the flag.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of State
stakeholders: Eligible decedents including state employees, officials, and legislators, and their families or next of kin.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns state protocol for honoring certain deceased individuals.

Title: State Board of Physicians - Supervised Medical Graduates and Cardiovascular Invasive Specialists (Bridge to Medical Residency Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a supervised medical graduate to provide delegated duties under direct supervision in accordance with regulations adopted by the State Board of Physicians; prohibiting an individual from practicing as a supervised medical graduate for more than 2 years; and repealing the termination of certain provisions of law relating to delegation of duties by licensed physicians to cardiovascular invasive specialists.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes supervised medical graduates to perform delegated duties under direct supervision for a limited period, and revises regulations related to delegation of duties by licensed physicians, including specific provisions for X-ray procedures and cardiovascular invasive specialists.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Medical graduates, physicians, hospitals, and patients in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for delegation and supervision aim to streamline medical procedures and expand workforce capacity, which could help reduce small business failures in healthcare settings.

Title: Advanced Practice Registered Nurses - Professional Liability Insurance Coverage - Notification Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring advanced practice registered nurses practicing as an advanced practice registered nurse in the State to notify patients in writing if the nurse does not maintain professional liability insurance coverage or if the coverage has lapsed and not been renewed; requiring that the notification be provided at certain visits and as part of certain informed consents, signed by a patient at certain times, and retained as part of the advanced practice registered nurse's patient records; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires advanced practice registered nurses in Maryland to notify patients in writing about their professional liability insurance coverage status, especially if they do not have insurance or if it has lapsed. The notification must be provided at specific visits and as part of informed consent, signed by the patient, and retained in records. Nurses without insurance must also post this information visibly at their practice location.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Advanced practice registered nurses and their patients in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily involves notification and record-keeping requirements for individual nurses.

Title: Office of Legislative Audits - Local School Systems - Report
Synopsis: Requiring each local school system, on or before November 1 of the third year of a 6-year audit cycle, to submit a report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on the status of implementation of corrective actions to address repeat findings and recommendations identified by the Office of Legislative Audits in the most recent audit; and requiring each local school system to publish the report on its website.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland's local school systems to address repeat findings and recommendations from annual financial audits, including audits by the Office of Legislative Audits. It mandates that each local school system submit a report on the status of corrective actions to a joint committee and publish it on their website. The bill also specifies the audit process and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Office of Legislative Audits and local school systems
stakeholders: Local school systems, students, parents, and taxpayers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets school system audits and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Montgomery County - School Bus Stops MC 6-24
Synopsis: Prohibiting, beginning December 31, 2026, the location of a school bus stop on any highway with five or more undivided traffic lanes in Montgomery County unless a school crossing guard is posted or a certain traffic control device is placed at the school bus stop.
bill_summary: The bill allocates fines collected from violations enforced by school bus monitoring cameras in Montgomery County for roadway and pedestrian safety improvements, restricts the placement of school bus stops on highways with five or more lanes unless safety measures are in place, and regulates the use of school bus monitoring cameras.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration and Montgomery County Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Students, parents, school transportation staff, residents of Montgomery County, and local government agencies involved in transportation and safety
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on traffic safety and school bus stop regulations, with no direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Montgomery County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B Beer, Wine, and Liquor License - Off-Premises Consumption MC 9-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a certain Class B beer, wine, and liquor license in Montgomery County to sell beer and wine in sealed containers with the manufacturer's original seal for off-premises consumption under certain circumstances; and authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Montgomery County to adopt certain regulations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Montgomery County to allow holders of Class B beer, wine, and liquor licenses to sell sealed containers of beer and wine for off-premises consumption, provided they meet certain food sales ratio requirements.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Montgomery County
stakeholders: Restaurant and hotel owners in Montgomery County, and consumers of alcoholic beverages in the county
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small businesses by expanding their sales options and revenue streams through off-premises alcohol sales, potentially reducing business failure.

Title: Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the membership of the Maryland Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention by removing the representative of the Council on American–Islamic Relations Maryland Office, adding two Muslim community members appointed by the Attorney General, and terminating the commission after June 30, 2027.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Members of the Muslim community, hate crime prevention organizations, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: State Lottery Fund - Bus Rapid Transit Fund Distribution and Prince George's County Blue Line Corridor Facility Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing a certain limitation on the State Lottery Fund distribution  and allocating an amount equal to $27,000,000 each fiscal year to the Bus Rapid Transit Fund for bus rapid transit system grants; adding an authorized use for the Prince George's County Blue Line Corridor Facility Fund; requiring the Maryland Stadium Authority, by December 15, 2024, to submit to certain committees of the General Assembly a report on all public and private development activities currently under construction in the Blue Line Corridor; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reallocates funds from the Maryland State Lottery to support bus rapid transit projects, specifically increasing the distribution to the Bus Rapid Transit Fund and establishing a dedicated fund for the Prince George’s County Blue Line Corridor. It also requires a report on development activities in the corridor.
responsible_party: The Maryland Stadium Authority and the Maryland Department of Transportation are responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Prince George’s County, transit users, and local government entities involved in the Blue Line Corridor.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides funding for transit infrastructure, which can improve transportation access and economic development, potentially reducing small business failures in the area.

Title: Property Tax - Credit for Hotel or Residential Development Projects
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is used for certain hotel or residential development projects; and altering eligibility for a certain property tax credit in Wicomico County against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is used for certain hotel or residential development projects.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local governments in Maryland to grant property tax credits for new or rehabilitated hotel and residential development projects, with specific eligibility criteria and provisions for implementation.
responsible_party: Local governments in Maryland, including the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City and governing bodies of counties and municipal corporations.
stakeholders: Developers of hotel and residential projects, residents in the development areas, and local governments.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides tax incentives that could support the financial viability of new hotel and residential developments, potentially reducing the risk of project failure.

Title: Calvert County - Roadside Solicitation of Money or Donations - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from standing in a roadway, median divider, or intersection to solicit money or donations from the occupant of a vehicle in Calvert County.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits individuals in Calvert County from standing in roadways, median dividers, or intersections to solicit money or donations from vehicle occupants, effective October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Calvert County law enforcement agencies and local government authorities
stakeholders: Vehicle occupants and individuals soliciting donations in Calvert County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily addresses solicitation practices.

Title: Judges' Retirement System - Special Death Benefit
Synopsis: Establishing a line-of-duty special death benefit for members of the Judges' Retirement System; providing for health benefits for a surviving spouse, child, or dependent parent who is receiving a special death benefit for the death of a member of the Judges' Retirement System; and providing for the retroactive application of the Act to any member of the Judges' Retirement System who is killed prior to the effective date of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a special line-of-duty death benefit for members of the Judges' Retirement System, including provisions for health benefits for surviving spouses, children, or dependent parents, and allows for retroactive application to members killed before the act's effective date.
responsible_party: Board of Trustees of the State Retirement and Pension System of Maryland
stakeholders: Members of the Judges' Retirement System, their surviving spouses, children, and dependent parents
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates; it focuses on retirement and death benefits for judges.

Title: Human Services - Individuals With Disabilities and Service-Disabled Veterans Boating Fund
Synopsis: Establishing the Individuals With Disabilities and Service-Disabled Veterans Boating Fund to provide sailing, boating, kayaking, canoeing, and paddleboarding and surfing opportunities for individuals with disabilities and service-disabled veterans; requiring the Department of Disabilities to administer the Fund; prohibiting the Department from providing a grant of more than $40,000 in a fiscal year; and establishing the qualifications for certain nonprofit organizations to receive a grant from the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Individuals With Disabilities and Service-Disabled Veterans Boating Fund, administered by the Department of Disabilities, to provide grants for sailing, boating, kayaking, canoeing, paddleboarding, and surfing opportunities for individuals with disabilities and service-disabled veterans. It allocates $500,000 annually starting in fiscal year 2026 for these grants.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities and service-disabled veterans who want to participate in boating and water sports activities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, as it focuses on grants for nonprofit organizations providing water activities for disabled individuals and veterans.

Title: Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Authority
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Technology Development Corporation, subject to a written agreement, to provide certain outside entities administrative services or support and to receive compensation for providing the services or support.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to provide administrative services and support to certain entities, and to receive compensation for these services, under a written agreement.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Technology companies and entities involved in innovation and development within Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions could help small technology businesses by providing them with administrative support, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Competitive Sealed Proposals - Security Contracts
Synopsis: Providing that competitive sealed proposals is the preferred procurement method for a contract for security services with an expected value that is greater than $1,000,000.
bill_summary: The bill establishes that for procurement of security services valued over $100,000, the state must use competitive sealed proposals as the preferred method, including specific procedures for issuing requests for proposals, conducting discussions, and awarding contracts.
responsible_party: Maryland State procurement office or relevant state agency responsible for procurement processes.
stakeholders: State agencies, security service providers, and the general public who benefit from security services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on competitive sealed proposals and inclusion of minority business enterprise participation aims to create fairer opportunities for small and minority-owned businesses, potentially reducing their failure rate.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Lighting - Privately Owned Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing certain members of a volunteer fire company to equip their privately owned vehicles with red and green or red and white lights or signal devices.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain members of volunteer fire companies in Maryland to equip their privately owned vehicles with red and white or red and green lights or signal devices, specifically for use while responding to emergencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation, Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Volunteer fire company members and their vehicles, emergency responders, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily pertains to vehicle lighting regulations for emergency responders.

Title: Freedom to Read Act
Synopsis: Establishing a State policy that local school systems operate their school library media programs consistent with certain standards; requiring each local school system to develop a policy and procedures to review objections to materials in a school library media program; prohibiting a county board of education from dismissing, demoting, suspending, disciplining, reassigning, transferring, or otherwise retaliating against certain school library media program personnel for performing their job duties consistent with certain standards; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes state policies and standards for libraries and school library media programs in Maryland, including requirements for developing policies to review objections to materials, prohibitions against retaliation for performing job duties according to standards, and funding contingencies based on adherence to these standards.
responsible_party: Maryland State Library Agency and the State Library Board
stakeholders: School students, school personnel, library users, library staff, and local government library systems in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on library standards and policies.

Title: Health Occupations – Limited License to Practice Dentistry – Services for Adults
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Dental Examiners to waive certain education requirements for certain applicants for a limited license to practice dentistry who provide dental services for adults.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners to waive certain educational requirements for applicants seeking a limited license to practice dentistry, specifically for those providing dental services to adults in public health settings, federally qualified health centers, or Maryland qualified health centers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Dental professionals seeking licensure, public health dental clinics, federally qualified health centers, Maryland qualified health centers, and adult patients receiving dental care in these settings.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help reduce small business failure by easing licensing barriers for dental professionals working in public health settings, thereby increasing access to dental services and supporting the sustainability of these clinics.

Title: Allegany County - Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority in Allegany County to support the development and construction of regional recreation facilities to benefit residents and the economic development of Allegany County, including athletic fields, indoor athletic facilities, and other facilities for recreational tourism; and requiring the Authority to annually report its activities to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly beginning October 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority in Allegany County to support the development and construction of regional recreation facilities such as athletic fields and indoor athletic facilities to benefit residents and promote economic development.
responsible_party: The Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority, managed by members including local government officials, university presidents, and a resident designated by the General Assembly.
stakeholders: Residents of Allegany County, local government entities, educational institutions, and visitors interested in recreational tourism.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on developing recreational facilities may indirectly support small businesses by attracting tourism and increasing local economic activity, but it does not explicitly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Carroll County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Carroll County to borrow not more than $29,800,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Carroll County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Carroll County to issue up to $29.8 million in bonds to finance public facilities, water and sewer projects, and volunteer fire department facilities, including the ability to borrow, issue refunding bonds, and levy taxes for repayment.
responsible_party: Carroll County Commissioners and the Carroll County government
stakeholders: Residents of Carroll County, volunteer fire departments, and users of public facilities and infrastructure in Carroll County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily funds public infrastructure and fire facilities, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure reduction.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Committed Persons - Release Proceedings
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of the Maryland Rules relating to discovery in civil matters apply in a certain administrative proceeding; requiring a court that receives a certain report to promptly notify counsel of record for the committed person; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to notify the court and certain persons if the Department receives a certain report; requiring a court to hold a hearing on request by any party after a certain application is made; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures for release and conditional release of committed persons in Maryland, including notification requirements, application processes, and court hearings, with an emphasis on discovery rules and timely reporting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the courts involved in release proceedings.
stakeholders: Committed persons undergoing mental health or criminal commitment procedures, their legal counsel, and the courts involved in their release.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or related programs.

Title: Cannabis - Licensee Locations - Restrictions
Synopsis: Altering the distance restrictions from 2000 feet to one-half mile applicable to a licensed cannabis dispensary; prohibiting a political subdivision from establishing certain zoning requirements that are more restrictive than certain zoning requirements that existed on June 30, 2023; authorizing at least 10 individuals who are residents, commercial tenants who are not holders of or applicants for a license, or real estate owners, and are located within 1,000 of the licensed premises to file a protest against a license; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies zoning restrictions for licensed cannabis dispensaries in Maryland, including distance requirements from schools, parks, and other dispensaries. It also clarifies the authority of political subdivisions to alter these requirements, prohibits more restrictive zoning for cannabis businesses compared to other retail businesses, and establishes procedures for protesting license renewals.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis licensees, residents, and communities near dispensaries and grow sites in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to create a clearer and more consistent zoning framework for cannabis businesses, which can help reduce legal and operational uncertainties that contribute to small business failures.

Title: Physician Assistants - Revisions (Physician Assistant Modernization Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring that a physician assistant have a collaboration agreement, rather than a delegation agreement, in order to practice as a physician assistant; altering the scope of practice of a physician assistant; altering the education required for licensure as a physician assistant; authorizing physician assistants who are employees of the federal government to perform acts, tasks, or functions during a certain disaster; and requiring the State Board to review and update the list of duties for physician assistants.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes the practice of physician assistants in Maryland by replacing delegation agreements with collaboration agreements, updating scope of practice, education requirements, and prescriptive authority, and establishing new oversight and reporting procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Physician assistants, healthcare providers, and patients in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for collaboration agreements and streamlined oversight aim to clarify practice standards, potentially reducing legal and operational uncertainties for small healthcare practices, thereby lowering failure risks.

Title: Natural Resources – Submerged Aquatic Vegetation Surveys
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "aerial survey" for purposes of surveying submerged aquatic vegetation to include other surveys that encompass certain geographic areas and use certain methodologies; and requiring the Department of Natural Resources to study and report to the General Assembly on the implications and feasibility of using alternative methods other than an aerial survey to delineate SAV protection zones on or before December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill updates the definition of 'aerial survey' for mapping submerged aquatic vegetation (SAV) to include other approved survey methods, requires the Department of Natural Resources to study and report on alternative methods for delineating SAV protection zones, and makes adjustments to SAV protection zone management and delineation procedures.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Environmental agencies, conservation groups, and residents of Maryland's Chesapeake Bay and Atlantic Coastal Bays regions
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on alternative survey methods and zone management could streamline SAV protection efforts, potentially reducing conflicts with small fishing and dredging businesses, but the direct impact on small business failure rates is limited.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages – Retail Delivery – Local Delivery Service Permit
