Synopsis: Establishing a local delivery service permit that authorizes the holder to deliver alcoholic beverages from a retail license holder that is authorized to deliver alcoholic beverages to purchasers in a certain jurisdiction under certain circumstances; authorizing retail license holders to deliver alcoholic beverages to purchasers in a certain jurisdiction through a third-party contractor, an independent contractor, or an agent that holds a certain delivery service permit under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new local delivery service permit allowing retail license holders to deliver alcoholic beverages through third-party or independent contractors, with specific regulations, fees, and age restrictions, to expand alcohol delivery options in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland local licensing boards and the Maryland Alcoholic Beverages and Cannabis Control Agency
stakeholders: Retail license holders, delivery contractors, and consumers aged 21 and over in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small retail businesses expand their sales channels by allowing delivery services, potentially reducing their failure risk.

Title: Members of Boards, Committees, Commissions, Task Forces, or Workgroups – Removal or Suspension
Synopsis: Providing that a member of a board, committee, commission, task force, or workgroup created by State law may be removed or suspended for misconduct, incompetence, neglect of duties, or other good cause by the individual or entity that appointed the member under certain circumstances; authorizing the removal or suspension of an appointed member only after consultation with the chair of the board, committee, commission, task force, or workgroup and the member has been given an opportunity to be heard regarding the removal or suspension; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes procedures for the removal or suspension of members of boards, committees, commissions, task forces, or workgroups created by Maryland state law, including requirements for notice, hearing, and consultation, with certain exceptions.
responsible_party: The appointing individual or entity that appointed the member, typically a state agency or official.
stakeholders: Members of state-created boards, committees, commissions, task forces, and workgroups, as well as the entities that appoint them.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it focuses on governance procedures for state-appointed boards and committees.

Title: Criminal Law - Rapid-Fire Activator - Switch/Auto-Sear
Synopsis: Altering the term "rapid fire trigger activator" to be "rapid fire activator"; adding "switch/auto-sear" to the definition of "rapid fire activator" for purposes of certain prohibitions on rapid fire activators; and prohibiting a person from transporting a rapid fire activator into the State or manufacturing, possessing, selling, offering for sale, transferring, purchasing, or receiving a rapid fire activator with a certain exception.
bill_summary: The bill bans the manufacturing, possession, sale, transfer, or importation of switch/auto-sears and rapid fire activators in Maryland. It establishes penalties for violations, including severe minimum sentences for using certain prohibited weapons in crimes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police and law enforcement agencies responsible for enforcement and regulation of firearm laws.
stakeholders: Firearm owners, law enforcement agencies, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets illegal firearm modifications and does not directly impact small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Higher Education - Financial Well-Being Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Financial Well-Being Pilot Program at the University of Maryland, College Park Campus and Morgan State University to provide comprehensive financial guidance and coaching to help students who may benefit from financial coaching services; requiring by August 1, 2024, each participating institution to hire one full-time financial well-being coach; requiring each financial well-being coach to create a document with best practices and guidance for other institutions to use to create a financial well-being program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Financial Well-Being Pilot Program at the University of Maryland, College Park, and Morgan State University to provide financial guidance, support, and coaching to students facing financial burdens, debt, or lacking financial literacy.
responsible_party: The program will be administered jointly by the Maryland Higher Education Commission and the governing entities of the participating institutions, specifically the Presidents of the University of Maryland, College Park Campus, and Morgan State University.
stakeholders: Students at the University of Maryland, College Park, and Morgan State University who are dealing with financial burdens, debt, or lack financial literacy skills.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is focused on student financial well-being and does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Tri–County Council for Southern Maryland – Southern Maryland Agricultural Development Commission – Funding
Synopsis: Increasing from $900,000 to $1,000,000 the amount of an appropriation that the Governor is required to include in the annual budget bill each year for the Tri-County Council for Southern Maryland from the Cigarette Restitution Fund; repealing the termination of certain provisions of law that require the Governor to include the appropriation in the annual budget bill each year and the Council to use the appropriation to fund the activities of the Southern Maryland Agricultural Development Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual funding allocated to the Tri–County Council for Southern Maryland from $900,000 to $1,000,000 and allows for additional funding based on a percentage of the Master Settlement Agreement funds. It also repeals the sunset clause, making the funding permanent.
responsible_party: The Maryland State government, specifically the Tri–County Council for Southern Maryland and the Governor's Office of Budget and Management.
stakeholders: Small farmers and agricultural businesses in Southern Maryland, as well as the broader Southern Maryland community involved in agriculture.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides increased and potentially more stable funding for agricultural development activities, which can help reduce the failure rate of small agricultural businesses in the region.

Title: Juvenile Law - Reform
Synopsis: Altering the jurisdiction of the juvenile court over a child of a certain age alleged to have committed a certain offense; altering certain provisions relating to the taking of a child into custody by a law enforcement officer; expanding certain provisions of law relating to the entry onto certain school or other property by, and the education of, certain sex offender registrants; altering certain provisions relating to the Commission on Juvenile Justice Reform and Emerging and Best Practices; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms juvenile law in Maryland by altering jurisdiction, procedures, and establishing new offices and commissions to improve juvenile justice, including expanding juvenile court jurisdiction, updating detention and intake procedures, and creating oversight bodies.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Juvenile Services, the Governor’s Office for Children, the Children’s Cabinet, and the Commission on Juvenile Justice Reform and Emerging and Best Practices.
stakeholders: Juvenile offenders, children involved in the juvenile justice system, families, schools, juvenile detention facilities, and community organizations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions for oversight and review of juvenile facilities and programs, which may indirectly support small business stability in related service sectors, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Issuance of License Near a Place of Worship or School PG 307-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue an alcoholic beverages license for an establishment that is within 500 feet of a place of worship or 1,000 feet of a school building if a license of the same class had been issued and was held by the same person seeking the new license and was in effect for the establishment before the place of worship or school building was built.
bill_summary: The bill allows the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue alcohol licenses to establishments that are within certain distances of places of worship or schools, provided the same license was held before the construction of the place of worship or school.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County
stakeholders: Establishments seeking alcohol licenses near places of worship or schools, and the local community including worshippers and students
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small businesses by allowing them to obtain or retain alcohol licenses even if they are located near places of worship or schools, which previously might have been restricted.

Title: State Finance – Catastrophic Event Account and Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund – Noncivilian Federal Employees
Synopsis: Altering the purposes of the Catastrophic Event Account and the Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund to provide financial assistance to noncivilian federal employees.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Catastrophic Event Account and the Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund to provide financial assistance and no-interest loans to noncivilian federal employees in Maryland affected by federal government shutdowns or natural disasters.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Maryland State Treasurer's Office
stakeholders: Noncivilian federal employees in Maryland affected by government shutdowns or natural disasters
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Prince George's County - Student Support - Specialist Networks and Success Action Plans (Student Supports and Success Act) PG 502-24
Synopsis: Establishing a Student Support Specialist Network consisting of certain school-based personnel at each public high school in Prince George's County; requiring the Prince George's County Board of Education to develop a certain template using certain guidelines by December 31, 2024; and requiring each Student Support Specialist Network in the county to develop, complete, and implement a certain plan, subject to review and approval by the Prince George's County Board of Education.
bill_summary: The bill establishes Student Support Specialist Networks in each public high school in Prince George's County, comprising various school-based personnel, to develop and implement Student Support Success Action Plans aimed at improving behavioral, mental health, and disciplinary outcomes for students.
responsible_party: Prince George’s County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students in public high schools in Prince George’s County, school staff, mental health professionals, and the broader school community.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates; it focuses on school-based student support programs.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Employed Individuals With Disabilities
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to provide Maryland Medical Assistance Program services for qualified applicants who are at least 16 years old and for existing Program recipients under the Employed Individuals with Disabilities Program in accordance with certain requirements; prohibiting the Department from limiting eligibility to receive services under the EID Program based on certain criteria; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates and expands the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to better serve employed individuals with disabilities by removing income and resource limits, eliminating age restrictions, and establishing a more flexible eligibility process for the Employed Individuals with Disabilities (EID) Program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities who are employed or seeking employment in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily focuses on healthcare eligibility and services for individuals with disabilities.

Title: Fire Protection and Prevention - Residential Rental Property - Requirements (Melanie Nicholle Diaz Fire Safety Act)
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements relating to the installation of certain fire safety equipment in residential rental high-rise buildings and certain other property; authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a certain property tax credit; establishing the Workgroup to Develop Fire Safety Best Practices for Pre-1974 High-Rise Apartment Buildings; requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations by December 31, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes fire safety requirements for high-rise residential buildings, including installation of smoke alarms, notification appliances, and emergency lighting, as well as provisions for automatic sprinkler systems and related funding sources. It also creates a workgroup to develop best practices for fire safety in pre-1974 high-rise buildings and offers tax credits for fire safety improvements.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development in coordination with the State Fire Marshal
stakeholders: Residents of high-rise residential buildings, property owners, and fire safety agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides funding information and tax credits to support fire safety improvements, which can help property owners upgrade safety systems and potentially reduce financial burdens associated with fire safety compliance.

Title: Libraries - Regional Resource Centers - Governing Board Membership
Synopsis: Increasing, from one member to two members, the number of public members from each area served by the participating library systems on the governing board for each regional resource center.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of public members on the governing boards of regional resource centers for libraries in Maryland, from one to two members per area served.
responsible_party: Governing boards of regional resource centers for libraries, specifically the board of trustees of the Washington County Free Library for the Western Maryland Regional Resource Center.
stakeholders: Public library users and communities served by regional resource centers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Insurance Administration – Professional Employer Organizations – Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration to study professional employer organizations in the State to review certain regulations, histories, health plans, requirements, and regulatory structures in other states and to address any potential impacts of proposed statutory changes in the State relating to the offering of health coverage by professional employer organizations on the small group market in the State; and requiring the Administration to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Insurance Administration to study professional employer organizations (PEOs) in Maryland, focusing on their regulation, history, health plans, participation requirements, and impacts on the small group health insurance market. The study aims to inform potential statutory changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Professional employer organizations, small employers, employees, and health insurance providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly implement programs to reduce small business failure but aims to inform policy that could impact small business health coverage options.

Title: General Provisions - Damages or Losses - Definition
Synopsis: Defining "damages" or "losses" in statutory causes of action to protect civil rights or consumer rights and providing that "damages" or "losses" includes reasonable nominal damages.
bill_summary: The bill defines 'damages' or 'losses' in certain civil rights and consumer protection cases to include reasonable nominal damages, clarifying the types of monetary compensation available under Maryland law.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly / Maryland courts (for interpretation and enforcement)
stakeholders: Individuals seeking civil rights or consumer protections in Maryland, including protected classes and consumers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts civil rights and consumer protection cases and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Parents in Substance Use Disorder Treatment - Children in Need of Assistance and Treatment Facilities
Synopsis: Establishing a presumption that placement with a child's parent is in the best interest of the child, the child is receiving proper care and attention, and there is not a certain emergency situation if the child's parent is receiving certain substance use disorder treatment and the child is in the presence of the child's parent for the duration of the child's parent's treatment; authorizing the Behavioral Health Administration to require a facility providing certain treatment to provide beds and services to the patient's children; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a presumption that placement with a parent receiving substance use disorder treatment is in the child's best interest, and allows children to be in the presence of their parent during treatment. It also requires treatment facilities to provide beds and services for patients' children and permits children to stay with their parent during treatment.
responsible_party: The Behavioral Health Administration and treatment facilities providing substance use disorder treatment.
stakeholders: Children in need of assistance, their parents receiving substance use disorder treatment, and treatment facilities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill encourages treatment facilities to accommodate children, which may increase operational costs but could also improve treatment success and family reunification, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Calvert County - Ethics - Conflict of Interest and Commissioner Expulsion
Synopsis: Requiring that the conflict of interest provisions enacted by Calvert County include certain provisions relating to judicial relief for certain violations of the county's conflict of interest provisions; requiring the ethics provisions enacted by Calvert County to include a provision requiring the Calvert County Ethics Commission to make public any recommendation it makes to expel a Commissioner; and requiring Calvert County to enact a law or regulation that authorizes the removal of a county elected official for certain violations.
bill_summary: The bill requires Calvert County to update its conflict of interest and ethics laws to include provisions for judicial relief for violations, public disclosure of expulsion recommendations, and the authority to remove elected officials for conflicts of interest. It also mandates that all counties enact similar ethics laws.
responsible_party: Calvert County Ethics Commission and Calvert County governing body
stakeholders: Calvert County elected officials and residents
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on ethics and conflict of interest laws for county officials and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Calvert County - Procurement - Local Preference
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Calvert County to enact an ordinance that establishes a local percentage preference for certain procurement contracts; and requiring the County Commissioners to comply with certain provisions of law under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Calvert County to establish a local preference policy for procurement contracts, allowing resident businesses to receive a percentage advantage in bidding if their bid exceeds the lowest bid by a certain percentage.
responsible_party: Calvert County Commissioners
stakeholders: Local resident businesses and nonresident businesses participating in county procurement contracts
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is focused on procurement preferences and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Prince George's County Family Child Care Home Expansion Grant Program - Establishment PG 505-24
Synopsis: Establishing the Prince George's County Family Child Care Home Expansion Grant Program in the Prince George's County public school system; providing that the purpose of the Program is to increase the number of registered family child care providers, registered family child care homes, and registered large family child care homes in low-income communities in the county; requiring a local school system to develop a certain application process; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Prince George's County Family Child Care Home Expansion Grant Program to increase the number of registered family child care providers and homes in low-income communities within Prince George's County. The program will provide training and financial assistance to individuals aiming to become registered child care providers.
responsible_party: The Division of Early Childhood Development in the Prince George's County public school system.
stakeholders: Low-income communities in Prince George's County, prospective and current family child care providers, and children receiving care.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support new family child care providers through training and financial assistance, which could help reduce the failure rate of small family child care businesses.

Title: Carroll County - Contracts and Purchasing
Synopsis: Increasing from $25,000 to $50,000 the cost of a public work or improvement or the purchase price of supplies or equipment for which the County Commissioners of Carroll County may enter into a contract; and requiring that when the cost of a public work or improvement or the purchase price of supplies or equipment in Carroll County exceeds $50,000 under certain conditions, the Procurement Officer for the County Commissioner shall advertise for bids for at least 1 week in a media accessible to the general public.
bill_summary: The bill increases the contract threshold for public works, improvements, supplies, or equipment in Carroll County from $25,000 to $50,000, and updates procedures for public notice and bidding when costs exceed this new threshold.
responsible_party: Procurement Officer for the Carroll County Commissioners
stakeholders: Carroll County government departments, local vendors, and nonprofit entities participating in county contracts
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By raising the contract threshold and streamlining procurement procedures, the bill aims to reduce barriers for small businesses to participate in county contracts, potentially lowering their failure risk.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Annual Vehicle Shows - Motor and Trailer Homes
Synopsis: Altering the number of annual vehicle shows in which motor and trailer home dealers, and salesmen employed by dealers, may participate.
bill_summary: The bill amends vehicle laws to remove restrictions on the number of annual vehicle shows that motor and trailer home dealers and their salespeople can participate in, allowing for more participation in such shows.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant vehicle regulatory agency
stakeholders: Motor and trailer home dealers, salespeople, and potential vehicle buyers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By removing restrictions on participation in vehicle shows, the bill may help small vehicle dealerships increase sales and visibility, potentially reducing business failure.

Title: Income Tax - Individual Income Tax Credit Eligibility Awareness Campaign
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller to implement and administer a certain individual income tax credit eligibility awareness campaign to identify and encourage individuals to apply for certain individual income tax credits; authorizing the Comptroller to enter into a certain data sharing agreement with other State agencies to carry out the awareness campaign; and requiring, in each of fiscal years 2026 through 2030, the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $300,000 for the awareness campaign.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Comptroller to implement an awareness campaign to identify and encourage individuals to apply for certain income tax credits, with funding allocated annually from 2026 to 2030.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Individuals who may be eligible for income tax credits but are not claiming them, especially underserved populations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill focuses on individual income tax credits and does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: State Investment Portfolio and Local Government Investment Guidelines - Investment Standards
Synopsis: Requiring the Treasurer to consult with governmental entities prior to proposing certain regulations; repealing the limitations on investment in certain assets in which the Treasurer may invest or reinvest certain unexpended or surplus funds; authorizing the Treasurer to retain investments made prior to the effective date of the Act until the investments have reached their respective maturity dates; authorizing the Treasurer and governmental entities to invest or reinvest in certain surplus funds under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's investment standards for the State and local government entities, including repealing previous investment limitations, requiring the adoption of new regulations, and enhancing transparency and consultation processes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Treasurer's Office
stakeholders: Maryland state and local government entities, including county boards of education and library trustees
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates but may indirectly impact financial stability through improved investment practices and transparency.

Title: State Procurement - Small Business Preference Procurement
Synopsis: Requiring each procurement unit to establish a price preference for small businesses; and designating the Board of Public Works as the regulatory authority for the Small Business Preference Program.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state procurement units to establish a small business price preference program, including setting percentage preferences and designating certain procurements for small business participation, with the goal of increasing small business involvement in state contracts.
responsible_party: The Board of Public Works is designated as the regulatory authority for the Small Business Preference Program.
stakeholders: Small businesses seeking to participate in Maryland state procurement contracts.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to increase small business participation in state contracts, which can help reduce small business failure rates by providing more opportunities and support.

Title: Shellfish Aquaculture - Harvest Hours
Synopsis: Repealing a restriction which prohibited the harvesting of shellfish between the hours of sunset and sunrise from certain areas leased for aquaculture; and requiring the Department of Natural Resources to establish by regulation the hours for harvesting shellfish within leased areas.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a restriction on harvesting hours for shellfish in leased aquaculture areas and requires the Department of Natural Resources to establish new harvesting hours through regulation.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Shellfish aquaculture leaseholders and the shellfish industry in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying and potentially expanding harvesting hours, the bill aims to support shellfish aquaculture businesses, reducing operational uncertainties and failure risks.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Community Action Boards
Synopsis: Requiring certain community action boards to meet certain federal requirements for tripartite boards; and repealing certain requirements relating to the composition of community action boards.
bill_summary: The bill updates the requirements for community action boards in Maryland, mandating that they meet federal tripartite board standards, and repeals previous composition requirements.
responsible_party: Community action agencies and their governing bodies in Maryland
stakeholders: Low-income residents and community organizations involved in community action programs
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but may indirectly support community stability and economic development.

Title: Energy Efficiency and Conservation Plans
Synopsis: Requiring each electric company, each gas company, and the Department of Housing and Community Development to develop a plan for achieving certain energy efficiency, conservation, and greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets through certain programs and services and superseding certain existing energy efficiency and conservation goals; requiring the Public Service Commission to establish a working group to study and make recommendations on extending certain program assistance to certain moderate-income households; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the development and implementation of energy efficiency, conservation, and greenhouse gas emissions reduction plans by electric and gas utilities and the Department of Housing and Community Development. It establishes programs targeting energy savings, demand response, and beneficial electrification, with a focus on supporting low- and moderate-income households, and sets greenhouse gas reduction targets for the state.
responsible_party: The Public Service Commission, the Department of Housing and Community Development, and the Department of the Environment.
stakeholders: Electric and gas utility customers, including low- and moderate-income households, and the general public impacted by energy and environmental programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions for study and coordination to support small, minority, and women-owned businesses in the energy efficiency industry, which may help reduce small business failures, but the direct impact is not explicitly quantified.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Coverage for Prostheses (So Every Body Can Move Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide certain coverage related to prostheses; establishing that certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations must comply with certain provider network requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain health insurers to provide coverage for orthoses and prostheses, including related replacements and repairs, starting January 1, 2025. It also establishes provider network and reimbursement requirements for these benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Individuals requiring orthoses and prostheses, including those with limb loss or neuromuscular disorders, and health insurance providers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for coverage and network requirements aim to improve access and reduce barriers for providers, potentially lowering small business failure related to insurance coverage issues.

Title: Business Regulation - Detached Catalytic Converters - Record-Keeping Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring records of junk dealers, scrap metal processors, and automotive dismantlers and recyclers to include certain information about the vehicle from which a detached catalytic converter, or part of a detached catalytic converter, was obtained from a person.
bill_summary: The bill requires junk dealers, scrap metal processors, and automotive dismantlers to keep detailed records of their transactions, including specific information about detached catalytic converters and the vehicles they are obtained from, to prevent theft and illegal resale.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and the Maryland Business Regulation Agency (or equivalent regulatory bodies overseeing scrap metal and vehicle dismantling industries)
stakeholders: Scrap metal dealers, automotive dismantlers, recyclers, law enforcement agencies, and the general public concerned with vehicle and metal theft prevention.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily introduces record-keeping requirements rather than financial or operational burdens.

Title: Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program – Alterations
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for financial assistance under the Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program to include individuals who purchase certain qualified property after a qualified project is completed, at an affordable sales price as determined by certain regulations, and as an owner-occupant.
bill_summary: The bill expands eligibility for the Appraisal Gap From Historic Redlining Financial Assistance Program to include individuals who purchase certain qualified properties as owner-occupants, aiming to help close appraisal gaps in historically redlined neighborhoods.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Individuals purchasing qualified properties in low-income and historically redlined neighborhoods, affordable housing developers, and communities in those areas.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets individual homebuyers and community development projects, with limited direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: State Board of Long-Term Care Administrators - Requirements for Assisted Living Managers
Synopsis: Extending, from October 1, 2024, to July 1, 2026, the date by which an individual must be licensed by the State Board of Long-Term Care Administrators before practicing as an assisted living manager in the State; altering the requirements for the manager training course that certain assisted living managers are required to complete; altering the requirements for serving as an interim assisted living manager; and requiring the Board to submit certain reports on assisted living managers to certain committees of the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill extends the deadline for assisted living managers in Maryland to obtain licensure, modifies training requirements, and updates provisions for interim management and licensure exemptions.
responsible_party: State Board of Long–Term Care Administrators
stakeholders: Assisted living managers, assisted living facilities, and residents in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying training and licensure requirements and extending deadlines, the bill aims to support assisted living facilities in maintaining compliant management, potentially reducing business failures due to staffing issues.

Title: Board of Public Works - Transparency Data Dashboard
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller to develop and maintain on the Board of Public Works' website a procurement transparency data dashboard; establishing a governance committee composed of the liaisons to the Board from the offices of the Governor, the Comptroller, and the State Treasurer to review the contents of the dashboard for accuracy and completeness; and requiring the Governor, beginning in fiscal year 2025, to include in the annual budget bill such sums as are necessary for one full-time position and data dashboard development software.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Comptroller to develop and maintain a public, interactive, and searchable transparency data dashboard on the Board of Public Works' website. This dashboard will include information on state procurement activities, meeting announcements, agendas, contract spending, and participation goals for minority and veteran-owned small businesses. A governance committee will review the dashboard for accuracy and completeness.
responsible_party: The Maryland Comptroller's Office and the Board of Public Works
stakeholders: State procurement agencies, small business owners, minority and veteran-owned businesses, and Maryland taxpayers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By increasing transparency and providing detailed procurement data, the dashboard aims to improve opportunities for small businesses, especially minority and veteran-owned enterprises, potentially reducing their failure rates.

Title: Business Regulation - Sale of Motor Fuel - Pricing Signage (Gas Price Clarity Act)
Synopsis: Establishing that certain provisions governing signage at retail service stations supersede inconsistent local law; altering a signage requirement for retail service stations relating to the price of regular gasoline so that the signage prominently displays clearly and visibly the credit and debit price, if higher than the cash price, or the credit and debit price and the cash price; repealing an exemption from a certain signage requirement for retail service station dealers with not more than 3 dispensing units; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes clear signage requirements for retail motor fuel stations in Maryland, including display of fuel prices and taxes, and supersedes inconsistent local laws.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation (or the Maryland Office of the Comptroller)
stakeholders: Retail fuel station operators, motorists, and consumers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying signage requirements and providing cost-free signage supplies, the bill aims to reduce compliance costs and legal uncertainties for small fuel station businesses.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Health Commissions and Maryland Insurance Administration - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to contract with an independent consultant to conduct a certain study of the Health Services Cost Review Commission, the Maryland Health Care Commission, the Maryland Insurance Administration, and the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission; and requiring the Department to submit a report on the results of the study to the Governor, the Senate Finance Committee, and the House Health and Government Operations Committee on or before January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to hire an independent consultant to study the roles, overlaps, and efficiencies of several health-related commissions and the Maryland Insurance Administration, and to recommend improvements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: State health commissions, Maryland Insurance Administration, and the residents of Maryland who are affected by health policy and regulation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Ratification of Defective Corporate Acts - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the process by which a defective corporate act may be ratified; and altering rules for certain legal actions by persons claiming to be adversely affected by a ratification.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to modify the process by which defective corporate acts can be ratified, including rules for legal actions related to ratification and validation of corporate acts that were previously void or voidable due to lack of proper authorization.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or the Maryland Secretary of State's Office, which oversees corporate filings and compliance.
stakeholders: Corporations, their directors, stockholders, and other stakeholders involved in corporate governance and compliance within Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for ratifying defective corporate acts could help small businesses correct procedural errors, potentially reducing legal and operational failures.

Title: Maryland Tort Claims Act - Sheriffs and Deputy Sheriffs - County Responsibility
Synopsis: Clarifying that a county assumes the responsibilities of a certain tort claim against a sheriff or deputy sheriff under the Maryland Tort Claims Act; clarifying that, for certain tort claims against a sheriff or deputy sheriff, the State is the proper defendant; and specifying that it is the intent of the General Assembly that the Office of the Attorney General and the State Treasurer work with certain entities when disputes arise regarding the allocation of responsibility for tort claims under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that counties are responsible for tort claims against sheriffs and deputy sheriffs related to law enforcement and detention center functions, and that the State is the proper defendant for such claims. It also specifies the roles of the Office of the Attorney General and the State Treasurer in dispute resolution.
responsible_party: County governments and the Maryland Office of the Attorney General and State Treasurer
stakeholders: Sheriffs, deputy sheriffs, county governments, and residents affected by law enforcement and detention center activities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on tort liability and responsibility for law enforcement activities.

Title: Higher Education - Charles W. Riley Firefighter and Ambulance and Rescue Squad Member Scholarship - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the Charles W. Riley Firefighter and Ambulance and Rescue Squad Member Scholarship to make the scholarship applicable to all programs at institutions of higher education in the State; altering the maximum award available, when a scholarship should be credited, and to whom initial awards should be provided under the scholarship; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Charles W. Riley Firefighter and Ambulance and Rescue Squad Member Scholarship program, expanding eligibility and funding for students in higher education who are active fire or emergency medical service members. It also creates the Maryland Loan Repayment Assistance Program for firefighters and emergency medical services providers, offering loan repayment support for those working in the field.
responsible_party: The Maryland Higher Education Commission and the Office of the Governor, with the Department of Budget and Management overseeing evaluation and administration.
stakeholders: Active firefighters, ambulance, and rescue squad members, students pursuing higher education in fire and emergency medical services, and the communities they serve.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is focused on supporting emergency service personnel and students, and does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Higher Education - Part-Time Senatorial and Delegate Scholarships - Alterations
Synopsis: Allowing an applicant of a part-time senatorial or delegate scholarship with a documented disability to request from the Maryland Higher Education Commission a waiver from the requirement to carry at least 6 semester hours of courses each semester.
bill_summary: The bill allows applicants with documented disabilities for the Maryland senatorial and delegate scholarships to request a waiver of the semester hour requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students with disabilities seeking scholarships for higher education in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Prekindergarten - Ulysses Currie Head Start Program - Eligibility for State Funds
Synopsis: Authorizing a provider in the Ulysses Currie Head Start Program to receive certain State funds under certain circumstances; and exempting providers in the Program from certain State requirements for eligible prekindergarten providers.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes providers in the Ulysses Currie Head Start Program to receive full state funding even if they receive federal funds, and updates prekindergarten program standards to include evidence-based, culturally responsive practices, with specific provisions for Montessori programs. It also sets quality rating requirements and nondiscrimination policies for prekindergarten providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Prekindergarten children, families, and providers participating in the Ulysses Currie Head Start Program and other prekindergarten programs in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for funding and quality standards aim to support prekindergarten providers, potentially reducing failure rates among small education providers by providing clearer standards and funding opportunities.

Title: Education - Access to Attorneys, Advocates, and Consultants for Special Education Program and Fund - Established
Synopsis: Requiring certain information to be provided to the parents of a child with a disability under certain circumstances; establishing the Access to Attorneys, Advocates, and Consultants for Special Education Program; establishing the Access to Attorneys, Advocates, and Consultants for Special Education Fund; requiring interest earnings of the Fund to be credited to the Fund; requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $1,000,000 to the Fund beginning in fiscal year 2026; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Access to Attorneys, Advocates, and Consultants for Special Education Program and Fund in Maryland. It requires providing parents of children with disabilities with information about their rights, legal resources, and support services. The program aims to assist eligible students and their families in navigating special education disputes by offering legal and advocacy services funded through a dedicated state fund.
responsible_party: Maryland Volunteer Lawyers Service
stakeholders: Parents and children with disabilities in Maryland, especially those involved in disputes over special education services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is designed to provide legal and advocacy support for families, which can help prevent misunderstandings and legal issues that might lead to school-related disputes or failures, thereby indirectly reducing small business failure related to legal costs or disputes.

Title: Garrett County – Sheriff’s Salary – Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the salary of the Sheriff of Garrett County; and repealing the requirement for the Garrett County Salary Study Commission to study and issue a report that contains recommendations relating to the salary of the Sheriff.
bill_summary: The bill changes the salary structure of the Sheriff of Garrett County to be 80% of the salary of the County's State's Attorney and repeals the requirement for a salary study commission to recommend sheriff's salary adjustments.
responsible_party: Garrett County Government and County Commissioners
stakeholders: Sheriff of Garrett County and residents of Garrett County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Garrett County - Procurement - Bids and Contracts
Synopsis: Increasing the minimum dollar amount of contracts for which the County Commissioners, or any employee of Garrett County, are required to advertise for bids from $25,000 to $50,000; exempting certain contracts for professional services from a requirement to advertise for bids; and authorizing contracts for professional services required to be licensed by the State to be solicited by written bids.
bill_summary: The bill increases the minimum contract amount requiring Garrett County to advertise for bids from $25,000 to $50,000, and clarifies procedures for soliciting bids, including exemptions for professional services and emergency repairs.
responsible_party: Garrett County Government and its County Commissioners
stakeholders: Garrett County residents, local businesses, and contractors involved in county contracts
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill may reduce small business failures by clarifying bidding procedures and increasing the contract threshold, potentially allowing more small businesses to compete for county contracts.

Title: Winery and Vineyard Economic Development Grant Program - Modifications
Synopsis: Altering procedures for the claiming and awarding of grants under the Winery and Vineyard Economic Development Grant Program to allow an individual or corporation who paid or incurred qualified capital expenses during the immediately preceding calendar year to submit a grant application.
bill_summary: The bill modifies procedures for claiming and awarding grants under the Winery and Vineyard Economic Development Grant Program, including application timing and grant distribution methods.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Wineries and vineyards in Maryland seeking economic development grants
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program provides financial support to wineries and vineyards, which can help reduce the risk of business failure among small wine producers.

Title: State Treasurer and Comptroller - Membership Responsibilities
Synopsis: Removing the State Treasurer from the Board of Trustees for the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation and repealing related authority and duties; removing the State Treasurer or the State Treasurer's designee from the Maryland Commission on Climate Change and the Coast Smart Council; and adding the Comptroller or the Comptroller's designee as a member of the Maryland Commission on Climate Change and the Coast Smart Council.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the membership responsibilities of the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation, the Maryland Commission on Climate Change, the Maryland Environmental Service, and the Coast Smart Council by removing the State Treasurer from certain boards and commissions and adding the Comptroller or the Comptroller's designee.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Natural Resources, Maryland Environmental Service, and the Maryland Commission on Climate Change.
stakeholders: State agencies involved in environmental, agricultural, and climate change programs, as well as landowners and local governments involved in land preservation and climate initiatives.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on land preservation and climate change programs may indirectly support small businesses involved in agriculture and environmental services, but it does not explicitly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Washington County - Alcoholic Beverages - Multi-Use Sports and Events Facility Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Altering the stadium beer and wine license in Washington County to be a multi-use sports and events facility beer, wine, and liquor license; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption in the multi-use sports and events facility; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the existing stadium beer and wine license in Washington County to a multi-use sports and events facility license, allowing the sale of beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption at various events within the facility, and sets requirements for employee training and licensing.
responsible_party: Washington County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Owners and operators of multi-use sports and events facilities in Washington County, event attendees, and local residents
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could support small business success by enabling sports and events venues to expand their beverage service offerings, potentially increasing revenue and customer satisfaction.

Title: Maryland Building Performance Standards – Local Requests for Guidance – Religious Considerations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, on request of a local jurisdiction and in consultation with the Office of the Attorney General, to provide guidance for the implementation and enforcement of the Maryland Building Performance Standards in relation to any religious observance, practice, or belief.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to provide guidance to local jurisdictions on how to implement and enforce the Maryland Building Performance Standards in a way that respects religious observances, practices, or beliefs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor in consultation with the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Local jurisdictions, religious communities, and building officials in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but providing guidance on religious considerations in building standards may help small businesses in the construction and related sectors better comply with regulations.

Title: Washington County - Procurement - Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Washington County to enter into a certain contract for the purchase of one or more vehicles without advertising for bids if the amount involved in the contract does not exceed $100,000.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Washington County to purchase vehicles without advertising for bids if the amount does not exceed $100,000.
responsible_party: Washington County Commissioners or their designated employees
stakeholders: Washington County government and residents, especially those relying on county vehicles
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to county vehicle procurement procedures.

Title: Agriculture – Nuisance Insects
Synopsis: Requiring, instead of authorizing, the Secretary of Agriculture to implement, under certain circumstances, a program to use Bacillus thuringiensis israelensis to control or eliminate nuisance insects in the State; and requiring, instead of authorizing, the Secretary to carry out a certain project to control or eliminate nuisance insects if the county or municipality in which the nuisance insects are located agrees to pay 50% of the costs associated with the project.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Secretary of Agriculture to implement a program using Bacillus thuringiensis israelensis to control nuisance insects, specifically black flies, on state, local government, and private property with consent. It also mandates notification procedures and allows cost-sharing with counties and municipalities.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of Agriculture
stakeholders: Residents, local governments, and property owners affected by nuisance insects such as black flies
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by controlling nuisance insects, it may support local tourism and recreation industries, indirectly benefiting small businesses in those sectors.

Title: Health Insurance - Utilization Review - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering and establishing requirements and prohibitions related to health insurance utilization review; altering requirements related to internal grievance procedures and adverse decision procedures; altering certain reporting requirements on health insurance carriers relating to adverse decisions; and establishing requirements on health insurance carriers and health care providers relating to the provision of patient benefit information.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's health insurance laws to improve utilization review processes, including establishing online systems for prior authorization, enhancing grievance procedures, and increasing transparency and accountability for health insurance carriers and providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Health insurance carriers, healthcare providers, and insured individuals in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for streamlined prior authorization and grievance processes aim to reduce administrative burdens on health care providers and insurers, potentially decreasing small business failure related to healthcare administration.

Title: Behavioral Health Crisis Response Services - 9-8-8 Trust Fund Fees
Synopsis: Establishing a 9-8-8 fee to be paid by each subscriber to switched local exchange access service, commercial mobile radio service, or other 9-8-8-accessible service; establishing a prepaid wireless 9-8-8 fee to be paid on certain retail transactions; requiring the Comptroller to deposit the 9-8-8 fees and the prepaid wireless 9-8-8 fees in the 9-8-8 Trust Fund; and requiring the Comptroller to adopt procedures for auditing fee collection and remittance by telephone companies and commercial mobile radio service providers.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a 9-8-8 Trust Fund funded by fees collected from subscribers of certain telecommunications services to support behavioral health crisis response services, including crisis call centers, mobile crisis teams, and stabilization centers in Maryland.
responsible_party: The Department of Health shall administer the 9-8-8 Trust Fund.
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland who use telecommunications services, especially those seeking behavioral health crisis services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it primarily funds behavioral health crisis services.

Title: State Board of Physicians - Performance of X-Ray Duties Without a License
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which individuals without a license to practice medicine may perform X-ray duties; authorizing the State Board of Physicians to impose a civil penalty of up to $5,000 for each violation on the physician's office and $1,000 for each individual violation of the Act; and requiring the Board, by October 1, 2029, to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the number of individuals registered to perform limited X-ray duties and the continuation or replacement of the registration process.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a licensing and regulatory system for limited licensed radiologic technologists in Maryland, allowing certain individuals to perform specific X-ray duties without a full medical license under supervision, and sets standards for licensure, practice, and discipline.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Individuals performing limited X-ray duties, medical offices, hospitals, and patients in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to regulate and standardize the practice of limited licensed radiologic technologists, which could reduce errors and liabilities, potentially decreasing small business failure related to malpractice or licensing issues.

Title: State–Owned Nursing Homes – Deficiencies, Citations, and Fines – Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the department charged with oversight of a State-owned nursing home operated by a contractor, instead of the contractor, to provide notice of certain deficiencies and enforcement actions to the Governor and certain members of the General Assembly; requiring the department charged with oversight, rather than the contractor, to provide certain information to certain persons within 30 days after the contractor's final acceptance of a plan of correction or completion of an informal dispute resolution; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the department overseeing State-owned nursing homes operated by contractors to notify relevant authorities and stakeholders of deficiencies and enforcement actions within specified timeframes. It also mandates annual reporting on survey activities and enforcement actions at these nursing homes.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Health, specifically the department charged with oversight of State-owned nursing homes.
stakeholders: State-owned nursing homes operated by contractors, the Maryland Department of Health, the Governor, the Maryland General Assembly, local government bodies, and residents of the nursing homes.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve oversight and transparency, which can help identify issues early and reduce the likelihood of small business (contractors) facing severe penalties or failure due to unresolved deficiencies.

Title: Education - Initial Teacher Certification - Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing a provision of law that requires a teacher preparation program to require a student to pass a certain assessment as a graduation requirement; altering the requirements for initial teacher certification; authorizing a local school system to establish a comprehensive induction program to aid in meeting a certain requirement for initial teacher certification; altering the qualification requirements for a teacher who holds a professional license or certificate from another state; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's requirements for initial teacher certification, including removing certain assessment requirements, establishing new standards for literacy and subject-specific exams, and allowing local school systems to develop induction programs. It also authorizes the State Superintendent to pursue reciprocity agreements with other states to streamline certification for out-of-state teachers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prospective and current teachers in Maryland, local school systems, and students benefiting from qualified teachers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on teacher certification standards and reciprocity agreements, which are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Civil Actions - Public Nuisances - Firearm Industry Members (Gun Industry Accountability Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Prohibiting firearm industry members from knowingly creating, maintaining, or contributing to a public nuisance through the sale, manufacture, distribution, importation, or marketing of a firearm-related product under certain circumstances; requiring a firearm industry member to establish and implement certain reasonable controls regarding the sale, manufacture, distribution, importation, marketing, possession, and use of certain firearm-related products; authorizing certain civil actions for violations of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes civil actions against firearm industry members for creating, maintaining, or contributing to public harm through the sale, manufacture, importation, or marketing of firearm-related products. It requires industry members to implement reasonable controls to prevent unlawful or harmful activities and defines penalties for violations, including civil damages and injunctive relief.
responsible_party: The Maryland Attorney General, county attorneys, and the Baltimore City Solicitor are responsible for implementing the programs and bringing civil actions.
stakeholders: Firearm industry members, the general public, and individuals affected by firearm-related harm in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on civil actions and public nuisance claims related to firearm industry practices, not directly on small business failure reduction.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration - Locally Operated Transit Systems - Mandatory Funding
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning in fiscal year 2026, the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation from the Transportation Trust Fund of $80,533,314 for the Locally Operated Transit System Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that starting in fiscal year 2026, the Maryland Governor must include at least $80,533,314 annually in the state budget from the Transportation Trust Fund for the Locally Operated Transit System Grant Program, ensuring consistent funding for local transit systems.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Maryland Transit Administration and the Governor's Office
stakeholders: Local transit agencies and residents who rely on local transit services in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on funding for transit systems and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program - Amount of Annual Subsidies
Synopsis: Altering the amount of funds the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange is authorized to designate for annual subsidies under the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program for certain fiscal years to include unspent funds designated for subsidies for young adults in a previous calendar year.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange's Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program by allowing the use of unspent funds from previous years to increase annual subsidies for young adults aged 18 to 40 with income between 133% and 400% of the federal poverty level, and establishes regulations for subsidy coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Young adults aged 18 to 40 with income between 133% and 400% of the federal poverty level in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, focusing instead on health insurance subsidies for young adults.

Title: Health Occupations - Certified Dialysis Technicians - Continuing Education Requirement
Synopsis: Altering the continuing education requirement for certified dialysis technicians to complete 3 hours of continuing education approved by the Board.
bill_summary: The bill amends the continuing education requirements for certified dialysis technicians in Maryland, reducing the required hours of continuing education from 3 hours to 1.5 hours and clarifying renewal procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Nursing or relevant health occupations licensing board
stakeholders: Certified dialysis technicians and healthcare facilities that employ them
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies renewal requirements, which may reduce administrative burdens and costs for small healthcare providers employing dialysis technicians.

Title: City of Frederick - Assignment of Offenders to Road Work - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a provision of law requring a District Court judge to assign, if practicable, an offender to work the public roads of Frederick County or the City of Frederick as a penalty for a violation of a municipal law or ordinance of the City of Frederick.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the existing provisions that assign offenders who violate municipal laws or ordinances in Frederick to work on public roads, effectively ending the practice of court-ordered road work for such offenders in Frederick.
responsible_party: City of Frederick or Frederick County government, specifically the local judicial and law enforcement agencies.
stakeholders: Offenders convicted of violating municipal laws or ordinances in Frederick, and the local government agencies involved in law enforcement and judicial processes.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to the assignment of offenders to work on public roads and does not involve small business support or economic development programs.

Title: State Procurement - Small Business Reserve Program - Goals and Outreach Program
Synopsis: Increasing a participation goal from a minimum of 15% to 20% for certain small businesses for certain procurement contracts; requiring the certification agency, in consultation with Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to develop an outreach program to increase the participation of small businesses that are owned by economically disadvantaged individuals; requiring, by each December 1, the certification agency to submit a report on the outreach program and the dollar amount of certain awards; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Small and Minority Business Reserve Program by setting procurement goals for direct contracts to small businesses and certified minority business enterprises, establishing outreach and reporting requirements, and initiating a study to evaluate the program's compliance with federal and constitutional requirements.
responsible_party: The Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs in consultation with the Certification Agency and the Attorney General.
stakeholders: Small businesses, minority business enterprises, and economically disadvantaged individuals in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to increase opportunities for small and minority businesses through targeted procurement goals, outreach, and support, which could help reduce their failure rates.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System - Reemployment as Sheriff
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to suspend the retirement benefit of a retiree of the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System who is elected as a sheriff within 1 year after retirement; providing for the reinstatement of a benefit; providing that a suspension of a benefit does not affect survivor benefits; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Board of Trustees for the Maryland Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System to suspend the retirement benefits of retirees who are elected as sheriffs within one year of retirement, and to reinstate those benefits once the retiree ceases serving as a sheriff. It also clarifies procedures for reporting and reinstatement, and specifies survivor benefits if the retiree dies while serving as a sheriff.
responsible_party: Board of Trustees for the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Retired law enforcement officers in Maryland who may become sheriffs, their families, and the pension system administrators.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns pension benefits for retired law enforcement officers who become sheriffs.

Title: Town of Keedysville - Parking of Vehicles - Restrictions
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from parking certain vehicles in the Town of Keedysville, Washington County.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits parking certain types of vehicles in the Town of Keedysville, Washington County, Maryland, with specific restrictions on street or highway parking unless the parking is essential for immediate use.
responsible_party: Town of Keedysville, Washington County government or local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Residents and visitors of Keedysville, vehicle owners of the specified vehicle classes, local businesses, and the town's municipal authorities
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it primarily addresses vehicle parking restrictions within a specific town.

Title: Death Certificates - Cause or Manner of Death Determinations - Requirements After Change or Correction (Katherine Morris Death Reclassification Act)
Synopsis: Requiring, if a victim's initial determination of death recorded on the victim's death certificate was amended or corrected to be undetermined or homicide, an assistant State's Attorney with knowledge of the case to meet with a person in interest on the request of the person in interest for a certain purpose; requiring a law enforcement agency to reopen or reinvestigate an investigation involving the death of a victim whose cause or manner of death was amended or corrected to be undetermined or homicide; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes procedures for cases where a death certificate's cause or manner of death is amended to be undetermined or homicide, including requirements for meetings with interested parties, notifications to law enforcement, and reinvestigation of cases.
responsible_party: The Maryland Office of the State's Attorney, medical examiners, and law enforcement agencies are responsible for implementing the programs and procedures.
stakeholders: Victims' families, law enforcement agencies, medical examiners, and the general public concerned with death investigations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; its focus is on death investigation procedures.

Title: Washington County - Interscholastic Athletics - Student Eligibility Waiver and School Classification
Synopsis: Authorizing the Washington County Board of Education to waive a certain eligibility requirement for participation in interscholastic athletics at a certain Maryland Public Secondary Schools Athletic Association member school for students who attend certain public high schools; requiring the Washington County Superintendent of Schools to report to the Maryland Public Secondary Schools Athletic Association the school enrollment of member schools in grades 9, 10, and 11 as of September 30 of each even-numbered year; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Washington County Board of Education to waive certain eligibility requirements for students to participate in interscholastic athletics at public high schools, specifically for students attending non-zoned schools that lack athletic programs, and requires reporting on school enrollment for athletic classification purposes.
responsible_party: Washington County Board of Education and the Washington County Superintendent of Schools
stakeholders: Public high school students in Washington County, especially those attending non-zoned schools without athletic programs
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Public Safety - Law Enforcement Agencies - Positive Community Feedback
Synopsis: Adding positive community feedback that was not solicited by the police officer who is the subject of the feedback to the list of records that are not considered personnel records; requiring the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to develop a process for citizens to submit positive community feedback; requiring each law enforcement agency to adopt the uniform citizen positive community feedback process; and requiring a law enforcement agency to maintain a certain record that is subject to public inspection.
bill_summary: The bill requires law enforcement agencies in Maryland to develop and adopt a uniform process for collecting positive community feedback, which will be publicly accessible and maintained as part of officers' records. It also clarifies that positive community feedback records are not considered personnel records and are subject to public inspection.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission and law enforcement agencies in Maryland
stakeholders: Law enforcement officers, Maryland residents, and community members providing feedback
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Somerset County – Fire, Rescue, and Emergency Medical Services
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Somerset County to enact local laws and adopt other measures to manage, direct, and regulate fire, rescue, and emergency medical services in the County; authorizing the County Commissioners to authorize or create an entity or a body to administer the County's affairs in the County relating to fire, rescue, and emergency medical services; and requiring the County Commissioners to establish an Emergency Services Advisory Council to make certain recommendations under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Somerset County to enact laws and measures to manage fire, rescue, and emergency medical services, including creating an entity to oversee these services and establishing an advisory council for recommendations.
responsible_party: Somerset County Commissioners and the Emergency Services Advisory Council
stakeholders: Residents and emergency service providers in Somerset County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure, but it may improve emergency services which can benefit local businesses indirectly.

Title: Somerset County - Fire Companies - Appropriations
Synopsis: Requiring the County Commissioners of Somerset County to appropriate to certain organized volunteer fire companies in the county certain amounts for fiscal years 2025 through 2030; and requiring that the appropriations required for fiscal year 2030 remain in effect for subsequent fiscal years unless altered by a future enactment.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that Somerset County allocate specific annual funds to organized volunteer fire companies, with the amounts remaining in effect for subsequent years unless changed by future legislation.
responsible_party: Somerset County Government (County Commissioners)
stakeholders: Volunteer fire companies and residents of Somerset County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Somerset County – Sale of Property – Revells Neck Road
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Somerset County to sell the property at Map 32, Parcel 149 on Revells Neck Road under terms considered appropriate by the county commissioners.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Somerset County to sell certain surplus properties, including property on Revells Neck Road, through various methods such as sealed bids, public auction, or direct sale to government units, under terms deemed appropriate by the county commissioners.
