It supports innovative talent financing mechanisms, pilot projects, and regional cybersecurity training expansions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, specifically the Division of Workforce Development and Adult Learning, in conjunction with the Governor’s Workforce Development Board.
stakeholders: Workers seeking high-quality job training, employers in prominent and emerging industries, higher education institutions, and residents of Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support small businesses and other entities through grants, training, and innovative financing, which could help reduce small business failures by improving workforce skills and providing financial support.

Title: Hospitals and Related Institutions – Residential Treatment Centers – Accreditation
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "accredited residential treatment center" for certain provisions of law governing hospitals and related institutions to include residential treatment centers accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities or the Council on Accreditation.
bill_summary: The bill updates the definition of 'accredited residential treatment center' to include those accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities or the Council on Accreditation, in addition to the Joint Commission, for the purposes of hospital and related institution regulations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and relevant licensing and regulatory agencies
stakeholders: Residential treatment centers, hospitals, and patients receiving care at these facilities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying accreditation standards and potentially streamlining compliance, the bill may help residential treatment centers maintain accreditation and avoid violations, thereby reducing the risk of failure.

Title: Growing Family Child Care Opportunities Pilot Program – Permanent Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Growing Family Child Care Opportunities Pilot Program as a permanent program; and extending the appropriation that the Governor is required to make in the annual budget bill to the Program to fiscal year 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Growing Family Child Care Opportunities Program as a permanent initiative to provide grants and support for family child care providers, especially in underserved areas, including start-up assistance, technical support, and partnerships to promote small business sustainability.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Education, in partnership with the Maryland Child Care Resource Network.
stakeholders: Family child care providers, children under 13 (or developmentally disabled persons under 21), small business owners in the child care sector, and communities with high poverty and unemployment rates.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support small family child care businesses through grants, technical assistance, and partnerships, which could significantly reduce failure rates among small child care providers.

Title: Emergency Medical Services - Maryland Emergency Department Wait Time Reduction Commission - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Emergency Department Wait Time Reduction Commission to address factors throughout the health care system that contribute to increased emergency department wait times; authorizing the Commission to request data from certain entities; and requiring the Commission, beginning November 1, 2025, to report annually to the Governor and General Assembly on its activities and findings including updates on the development, impact and, implementation of the recommended programs on emergency department wait times.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Emergency Department Wait Time Reduction Commission to develop strategies, protocols, and technological solutions to reduce emergency department wait times across the state. It also mandates data sharing, monitoring, and reporting to improve emergency care efficiency.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Health, the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems, and the Health Services Cost Review Commission.
stakeholders: Hospital emergency departments, emergency medical services, healthcare providers, and patients in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets healthcare system improvements and does not directly impact small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Environment - Playground Surfacing Materials - Prohibitions
Synopsis: Prohibiting, on or after October 1, 2024, a person from installing, supplying, selling, soliciting, or offering for sale playground surfacing materials that contain a certain concentration of lead or a component product, material, or substance to which PFAS chemicals were previously intentionally added for certain purposes; prohibiting a county, municipality, or unit of local government from adopting any ordinance, rule, or regulation related to playground surfacing materials that is less stringent than of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the installation, sale, or supply of playground surfacing materials containing high levels of lead, PFAS chemicals, or PAHs starting October 1, 2024. It also requires manufacturers to provide compliance certificates and allows local governments to enforce stricter standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Manufacturers of playground surfacing materials, local governments, and children who use playgrounds in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill sets specific chemical limits for playground surfacing materials, which may impact manufacturers and suppliers, but it primarily aims to improve safety rather than directly reduce small business failure.

Title: Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act – Maryland 529 Program – Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting certain accounts under the Maryland 529 Program from the provisions of the Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain accounts and sums payable from the Maryland 529 Program from the provisions of the Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act, specifically clarifying which accounts are not subject to abandonment laws.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education or the Maryland State Treasurer's Office (implied, as they oversee the Maryland 529 Program)
stakeholders: Participants in the Maryland 529 College Savings Program and related account holders
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Environment – Water Pollution Control – Protecting State Waters From PFAS Pollution (Protecting State Waters From PFAS Pollution Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to identify significant industrial users that currently and intentionally use PFAS chemicals by July 1, 2026; requiring the Department to develop certain PFAS monitoring and testing criteria for certain significant industrial users by January 1, 2025; requiring the Department by June 1, 2025, to develop PFAS action levels for addressing PFAS contamination from industrial discharge for pretreatment permits; requiring the Department to develop mitigation plans by September 1, 2025; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations and limits on PFAS chemicals in water discharges from industrial users in Maryland. It requires significant industrial users to eliminate PFAS in their discharges by October 1, 2024, develop testing protocols, and reduce PFAS levels to 4 parts per trillion by 2025. The Department of the Environment is tasked with identifying users, developing testing criteria, setting action levels, and enforcing compliance.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Industrial users of PFAS chemicals, environmental agencies, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on environmental regulation and pollution control, which may indirectly impact small businesses involved in manufacturing or industries using PFAS. It does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Hospitals - Opioid Overdose and Opioid-Related Emergency Medical Conditions - Treatment
Synopsis: Requiring hospitals to establish and maintain certain protocols and capacity related to the treatment of patients who are being treated for an opioid-related overdose or opioid-related emergency medical condition; requiring hospitals to make a referral for patients who are diagnosed with opioid use disorder or administered or prescribed medication for opioid use disorder to an appropriate provider to voluntarily continue treatment in the community and work with peer support professionals for a certain purpose; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland hospitals to establish protocols and capacity for treating patients with opioid-related emergencies, including providing medication-assisted treatment and making referrals for ongoing community treatment. It also allocates funds from the Opioid Restitution Fund to support these efforts and related programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Patients experiencing opioid overdoses and opioid use disorder, hospitals, peer support professionals, and community treatment providers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on healthcare protocols and treatment programs, with funding allocated for training and resources, which may indirectly support small healthcare providers but does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Grow Your Own Educators Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Grow Your Own Educators Grant Program to provide grants to local school systems for employees who pledge to fulfill a certain service obligation as a full-time teacher in the State; requiring the State Department of Education to administer the Program and to take certain actions to develop and implement the Program; establishing the eligibility for certain teacher candidates in the Program and requiring teacher candidates to be paid a certain rate and offered certain benefits under the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Grow Your Own Educators Grant Program to support local school systems in training and hiring individuals interested in becoming teachers, especially in high-need areas, by providing grants for tuition, stipends, and program costs, and requiring service commitments from participants.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Noncertified education support professionals, provisional teachers, and students in high-need schools in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is focused on education workforce development and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: State Government – Attorney General – Reports
Synopsis: Altering certain reporting requirements for the Attorney General; and requiring the Attorney General to publish certain documents on the website of the Attorney General.
bill_summary: The bill updates reporting requirements for the Maryland Attorney General, including publishing certain documents and annual reports on the Attorney General's website, and clarifies procedures for investigations and legal actions related to federal government actions affecting Maryland residents.
responsible_party: The Maryland Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, including those affected by federal actions on health, safety, environment, civil liberties, and economic security.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it enhances transparency and accountability in government actions, which could indirectly benefit small businesses.

Title: 9-1-1 Specialist Recruitment and Retention Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the 9-1-1 Specialist Recruitment and Retention Workgroup to identify and examine recruitment and retention challenges that affect 9-1-1 specialists in the State; and requiring the Workgroup to submit an interim report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024, and a final report on or before December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the 9–1–1 Specialist Recruitment and Retention Workgroup to examine challenges in recruiting and retaining 9–1–1 specialists in Maryland, and to make recommendations for improvements.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Emergency Management and the Department of Legislative Services.
stakeholders: 9–1–1 specialists, emergency response agencies, and the residents of Maryland who rely on emergency services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or include programs aimed at reducing small business failure rates.

Title: State Department of Education - Division of Rehabilitation Services - Funding
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill a certain appropriation to the Division of Rehabilitation Services in the State Department of Education to ensure the State match amount for the Division is met as required by certain federal acts.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Governor to include funding in the annual budget to support the Division of Rehabilitation Services within the Maryland State Department of Education, ensuring the state can meet its required federal funding match for rehabilitation programs.
responsible_party: State Department of Education, Division of Rehabilitation Services
stakeholders: Individuals requiring rehabilitation services and related stakeholders in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure, but it supports rehabilitation services which may indirectly benefit individuals and small businesses involved in or affected by these programs.

Title: Watershed, Stream, and Floodplain Restoration - Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Restoration and Stream and Floodplain Restoration Funding (Whole Watershed Act)
Synopsis: Requiring, in each fiscal year from 2026 through 2030, up to $100,000 from the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays 2010 Trust Fund to be used to fund certain operations grants at a rate of $20,000 per project sponsor each fiscal year; authorizing the use of the Waterway Improvement Fund for projects that involve the beneficial use of dredged material and for certain water quality monitoring; prohibiting the Department of the Environment from reducing certain monitoring requirements for certain projects; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a licensing and regulatory framework for stream restoration contractors, creates the Whole Watershed Restoration Partnership and Fund to accelerate restoration efforts in Maryland's watersheds, and updates related environmental and water management statutes to support watershed and water quality improvements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and the Stream Restoration Contractors Licensing Board
stakeholders: Stream restoration contractors, environmental agencies, local governments, communities, and residents in Maryland, especially those in overburdened or underserved communities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a licensing system and funding opportunities that could help small businesses involved in stream restoration to operate legally and access financial support, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Maryland Center for School Safety - Secure Schools Emergency Response Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Secure Schools Emergency Response Grant Program to be administered by the Maryland Center for School Safety to provide funds to improve emergency notification systems and communications between public elementary and secondary school personnel, a public safety answering point, and a public safety agency during emergency events; requiring the Center to ensure that the Program is operating and available to each county board by September 1, 2026; and authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation in the annual budget bill.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Center for School Safety's Secure Schools Emergency Response Grant Program to fund improvements in emergency notification systems and communication between schools and public safety agencies, including the implementation of a secure emergency communication platform and panic button systems.
responsible_party: The Maryland Center for School Safety is responsible for implementing the program.
stakeholders: Public elementary and secondary schools, school personnel, students, and public safety agencies in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, focusing instead on school safety and emergency response improvements.

Title: Human Remains - Alkaline Hydrolysis and Natural Organic Reduction (Green Death Care Options Act)
Synopsis: Establishing a regulatory system for reduction operators and reduction facilities; establishing requirements and prohibitions related to the performance of alkaline hydrolysis and natural organic reduction and the disposition of hydrolyzed or soil remains by certain facilities; requiring the Director of the Office of Cemetery Oversight and the Director of the State Board of Morticians and Funeral Directors to adopt regulations governing the performance of natural organic reduction; etc.
bill_summary: The Green Death Care Options Act establishes a regulatory framework for natural organic reduction and alkaline hydrolysis as alternative methods for human body disposition, including licensing, safety standards, and prohibitions on improper use of remains and soil.
responsible_party: The Office of Cemetery Oversight and the State Board of Morticians and Funeral Directors.
stakeholders: Individuals choosing natural organic reduction or alkaline hydrolysis, funeral service providers, cemeteries, veterans, and the general public.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill creates a regulated environment for reduction facilities and related businesses, which may help reduce failures by providing clear standards and oversight.

Title: Nonprescription Drugs and Devices – Provision by Registered Nurses and Sale of Contraceptives Through Automatic Devices
Synopsis: Prohibiting the sale of natural membrane condoms, rather than all nonlatex condoms, through a vending machine or other automatic device; excluding the violation of a certain provision of the Act from certain penalties; and authorizing registered nurses to provide, without a prescription, nonprescription drugs and devices in a local health department under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the sale of natural membrane condoms through vending machines, allows registered nurses to provide nonprescription drugs and devices without a prescription in local health departments under certain conditions, and updates related regulations and penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and local health departments
stakeholders: Consumers, especially those using vending machines for contraceptives, and registered nurses providing nonprescription drugs in local health departments
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on vending machine sales of certain condoms and the expanded role of nurses in providing nonprescription drugs could reduce small business failures by clarifying regulations and expanding access.

Title: Video Lottery Facility Operations - Crimes of Moral Turpitude and Value of Table Game Chips - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission is required to disqualify an applicant who committed a certain crime involving moral turpitude from holding a video lottery employee license; and altering the definition of "value" as it relates to crimes involving theft to include the face value of a chip designated for use in table games.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules for disqualifying applicants for video lottery employee licenses in Maryland, especially concerning crimes involving moral turpitude and theft of table game chips. It clarifies how the value of chips is determined and sets conditions under which certain criminal convictions do not disqualify applicants, particularly if they involve nonviolent misdemeanors and are handled through problem-solving courts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Applicants for video lottery employee licenses, casino operators, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns licensing and criminal disqualifications for gaming employees.

Title: Child Care Providers - Anaphylactic Food Allergies - Guidelines and Indemnity (Elijah's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health to develop guidelines to reduce the risk of exposure to anaphylactic major food allergens in child care settings; requiring the State Department of Education to create a certain model policy; requiring certain large family child care homes and child care centers to adopt a policy to reduce the risk of exposure to anaphylactic major food allergens; and providing that certain child care providers and employees are immune from civil liability.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland's Department of Education and Department of Health to develop guidelines and a model policy for child care providers to reduce the risk of exposure to major food allergens that can cause anaphylactic reactions. It mandates certain child care facilities to adopt these policies, provides immunity from civil liability for providers responding in good faith to allergic reactions, and makes resources publicly available.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Child care providers, children with food allergies, parents of children with food allergies, and child care centers and homes in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By providing clear guidelines, policies, and immunity protections, the bill aims to support child care providers in managing food allergies, potentially reducing incidents that could lead to business disruptions or liabilities.

Title: Baltimore City – Alcoholic Beverages – 40th Alcoholic Beverages District – Revisions
Synopsis: Establishing a Class M-F (Municipal Family Fun Center) alcoholic beverages license in the 40th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a certain Class B beer, wine, and liquor license to a restaurant in a certain location; and authorizing a certain Class A license issued for a certain location to remain unexpired until the end of July 1, 2025, for the purpose of renewal.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Municipal Family Fun Center alcohol license in Baltimore City, modifies licensing rules for certain districts, and allows a specific license to remain unexpired until July 1, 2025, for renewal purposes.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Businesses operating in Baltimore City, especially restaurants and entertainment venues, and residents of Baltimore City
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides specific licenses and regulatory flexibility that could help small businesses in Baltimore City, particularly restaurants and entertainment venues, to operate more smoothly and avoid failure.

Title: Transportation - MobilityLink Paratransit Service Improvements - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transportation Institute at the University of Maryland to conduct a study to identify methods to improve the Maryland Transit Administration's ADA MobilityLink paratransit service; requiring the Institute to submit a report on its findings and recommendations to the Governor, the General Assembly, and certain  officials by July 1, 2025; and authorizing the Governor in fiscal year 2026 to include in the annual budget bill at least $150,000 for the study.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transportation Institute at the University of Maryland to conduct a study to identify ways to improve the Maryland Transit Administration's ADA MobilityLink paratransit service, including comparing it to other models nationwide and developing recommendations for service enhancements.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Institute at the University of Maryland
stakeholders: Riders of the Maryland Transit Administration's ADA MobilityLink paratransit service, including individuals with disabilities and transportation users outside fixed routes.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it focuses on transportation service improvements.

Title: Economic Development - Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program and Tax Increment Financing
Synopsis: Establishing the Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program in the Maryland Economic Development Corporation to make loans for targeted investments in real estate and infrastructure projects located in sustainable communities, priority funding areas, and transit-oriented development areas; establishing the Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Fund; authorizing the Corporation, with certain approval of a certain governing body, to pledge certain revenues generated within a certain area for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program and Fund in Maryland to provide loans for targeted real estate and infrastructure projects that promote community development, transit-oriented development, and inclusive economic growth, especially in underutilized areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Economic Development Corporation (MEDCO)
stakeholders: Real estate developers, local governments, communities in priority funding areas, transit-oriented development areas, and sustainable communities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support infrastructure and real estate projects that can stimulate economic activity and job growth, which may help reduce small business failures in targeted areas.

Title: Allegany County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class BWLT Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting Permit
Synopsis: Authorizing a Class BWLT beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit to be issued by the Board of License Commissioners for Allegany County.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class BWLT beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit in Allegany County, allowing license holders to permit on-premises tasting events of alcoholic beverages with specific notification and fee requirements.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Allegany County
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders and consumers in Allegany County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a new permit option with a relatively low annual fee, which could support small businesses by enabling them to host tasting events and potentially increase sales.

Title: Maryland-Ireland Trade Commission - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland-Ireland Trade Commission in the Department of Commerce to study and make recommendations regarding bilateral trade relations and investment opportunities between Maryland and Ireland; and requiring the Commission by December 1 2025, to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland–Ireland Trade Commission within the Department of Commerce to study and promote trade relations between Maryland and Ireland, including making recommendations on bilateral trade, investment, and economic cooperation.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Maryland businesses, Irish-American community, educational institutions, and government agencies involved in trade and economic development between Maryland and Ireland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill focuses on promoting trade and economic cooperation, which can support small business growth, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Employees' and Teachers' Retirement and Pension Systems - Reemployment of Retirees
Synopsis: Repealing a certain exemption from certain reemployed retiree earnings offsets for certain retirees of the Employees' and Teachers' Retirement and Pension Systems; repealing certain requirements that certain participating employers pay certain offsets under certain circumstances; establishing an exemption from a reemployed retiree earnings offset for retirees of the Teachers' Pension System who are reemployed by certain employers if the retiree's salary is funded from certain sources; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises rules regarding reemployed retirees of the Employees' and Teachers' Retirement Systems in Maryland, including exemptions from retirement allowance offsets when retirees are reemployed under certain conditions, especially when funded by non-State sources or through joint employer agreements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Retirees of the Employees' and Teachers' Retirement Systems, local school systems, and state government agencies involved in employment of retirees.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for exemptions, especially for positions funded by non-State sources or through joint employer agreements, could facilitate employment opportunities for retirees, potentially supporting small business and local education employment.

Title: State Retirement Agency - Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion and Governance Program
Synopsis: Establishing that the Executive Director of the State Retirement Agency shall employ a Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion of the State Retirement Agency; requiring the Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion to identify and minimize barriers to ensure access and opportunities to underrepresented groups; requiring the Executive Director to terminate the Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion within the Maryland State Retirement Agency, assigns responsibilities to promote access and opportunities for underrepresented groups, and creates a governance program within the Investment Division to incorporate environmental, social, and governance factors into investment decisions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency, specifically the Executive Director and the Chief Investment Officer
stakeholders: Employees and leadership of the Maryland State Retirement Agency, underrepresented groups seeking access and opportunities, and the investment community involved with the State Retirement Agency
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion, as well as governance in investments, may indirectly support small businesses, especially minority-owned businesses, but it does not explicitly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Baltimore County - Sheriff - Salary
Synopsis: Altering the annual salary of the Sheriff of Baltimore County.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual salary of the Sheriff of Baltimore County starting from 2024, with specific salary amounts for 2024 and 2025, and a scheduled increase for 2026, continuing with adjustments in subsequent years.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Government, specifically the County Council and the Sheriff’s Office
stakeholders: The residents of Baltimore County, law enforcement personnel, and local government officials
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Public and Nonpublic Middle and High Schools - Venue-Specific Emergency Action Plans for Athletic Facilities (The Bailey Bullock Act)
Synopsis: Requiring that each public middle school and high school alter the venue-specific emergency action plan for athletic facilities to incorporate a cardiac emergency response plan; requiring each nonpublic middle school and high school that receives State funding to develop a venue-specific emergency action plan for athletic facilities; specifying the contents of a nonpublic venue-specific emergency action plan; and requiring that the emergency action plans be reviewed and updated annually.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland public middle and high schools to develop and implement a comprehensive cardiac emergency response plan for athletic facilities, and nonpublic schools receiving state funding to develop venue-specific emergency plans including a cardiac response component. These plans must include procedures for responding to sudden cardiac arrest, coordination with emergency services, training for staff, and placement of defibrillators.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education, in collaboration with local school districts and athletic programs.
stakeholders: Students, student athletes, school staff, coaches, and parents of students participating in school athletic activities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets school athletic programs and does not directly impact small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Condominiums - Mandatory Insurance Coverage - Detached Units
Synopsis: Altering the types of elements and units for which a council of unit owners is required to maintain certain property insurance; requiring the council of unit owners to annually notify, in writing, owners of detached units of certain property insurance obligations; limiting instances when an owner of a detached unit within a condominium is required to carry homeowners insurance on the entirety of the unit; and authorizing a council of unit owners to carry homeowners insurance on the entirety of all units located within a certain condominium.
bill_summary: The bill requires condominium councils to maintain property insurance for attached, multifamily, and detached units, and to notify owners of detached units about insurance obligations. It also clarifies when owners of detached units must carry homeowners insurance and allows councils to insure all detached units collectively.
responsible_party: Condominium councils and the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Owners of units within condominiums, especially those with detached units, and condominium associations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions on insurance and damage repair could help reduce the financial risks and failures of small condominium associations and unit owners by clarifying insurance responsibilities and procedures.

Title: Consumer Protection - Telephone Solicitation - Exemptions and Remedies
Synopsis: Establishing that certain provisions of law that prohibit a person from making or causing to make a certain telephone solicitation that involves using a certain automated system or playing a recorded message do not apply to a noncommercial telephone solicitation for public opinion research; authorizing a certain called party who is aggrieved by a person who violates certain provisions of law to bring an action to enjoin further violations and to recover certain damages; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies exemptions and enforcement provisions related to telephone solicitation laws in Maryland. It specifies that certain noncommercial calls, including public opinion research, are exempt from restrictions on automated calls and recorded messages. The bill also allows aggrieved called parties to sue for damages and enjoins further violations, and it prohibits waivers of these requirements and remedies.
responsible_party: Maryland State Attorney General's Office and Public Utilities Commission
stakeholders: Consumers in Maryland who receive telephone solicitations, including residents and businesses, as well as organizations conducting lawful solicitations and public opinion research.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it primarily addresses consumer protection and solicitation practices.

Title: Public Health - Kratom Consumer Protection Act
Synopsis: Requiring a retailer that prepares, distributes, sells, or exposes for sale a kratom product to disclose the factual basis on which the representation is made; establishing prohibitions related to the preparation, distribution, and sale of kratom products, including prohibitions related to the sale of kratom to individuals under the age of 21 years and the marketing of kratom to minors; establishing certain penalties for violations of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for the sale and marketing of kratom products in Maryland, including disclosure requirements, restrictions on sale to minors, and prohibitions on certain types of advertising. It also mandates reporting on adverse health events related to opioid-like substances.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health in collaboration with the Maryland Hospital Association
stakeholders: Kratom consumers, retailers, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's regulations could impact small businesses that sell kratom by imposing compliance requirements and restrictions, potentially reducing failures related to legal violations.

Title: Public Health - Tianeptine Consumer Protection Act
Synopsis: Prohibiting a retailer from distributing, selling, exposing for sale, or advertising for sale a tianeptine product to an individual; and establishing a penalty for a retailer who violates the Act of a fine of up to $5,000 or imprisonment for up to 90 days or both.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for the sale and marketing of tianeptine products in Maryland, including disclosure requirements, age restrictions, and advertising limitations to protect consumers, especially minors.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Health shall adopt regulations to carry out the provisions of this act.
stakeholders: Consumers of tianeptine products, minors, retailers, manufacturers, and distributors involved in the sale and marketing of tianeptine products in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on consumer protection and advertising restrictions, which are unlikely to have a significant direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Natural Resources - Fisheries - Oyster Management
Synopsis: Repealing a provision of law prohibiting the Department of Natural Resources from taking any action to reduce or alter the boundaries of certain oyster sanctuaries until the Department has developed a certain updated fishery management plan for oysters; requiring the fishery management plan to end the overfishing of oysters in all areas and regions of the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries where overfishing has occurred; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates oyster management laws in Maryland, including developing a new fishery management plan to end overfishing, increase oyster populations and habitat, and facilitate sustainable harvests. It also repeals restrictions on boundary changes of oyster sanctuaries and allows dredging by power boats in certain areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources in coordination with the University of Maryland Center for Environmental Science and the Oyster Advisory Commission.
stakeholders: Oyster fishers, environmental agencies, and residents of Maryland, especially those in Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to promote sustainable oyster harvesting practices, which could support the long-term viability of oyster businesses and related industries, potentially reducing small business failures related to resource depletion.

Title: Baltimore City – Alcoholic Beverages – License Extensions
Synopsis: Extending until July 1, 2025, the expiration date of certain alcoholic beverages licenses in Baltimore City that are issued for certain areas for certain transferal and renewal purposes under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill extends the expiration dates of certain alcoholic beverage licenses in Baltimore City until July 1, 2025, under specific conditions, including community agreements and safety measures.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Department or relevant local licensing authority
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, Baltimore City residents, community associations, and local businesses involved in alcohol sales
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides temporary license extensions and conditions that may help small alcohol businesses maintain operations and avoid failure during the extension period.

Title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Academic Program Approval and Institutional Mission Statements - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, the Department of Commerce, and the Maryland Higher Education Commission to each have a certain staff member who performs certain duties related to defining, identifying, and compiling data regarding the workforce needs in the State; requiring the Commission to establish a Program Review Process Advisory Council; authorizing the Commission or an institution of higher education to file an objection to implementation of a proposed online program under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Higher Education Commission, the Maryland Department of Labor, and the Department of Commerce to collaborate on workforce data collection and analysis, updates the process for academic program approval, establishes a grant fund for collaborative new graduate programs, and updates the State Plan for Higher Education to better align academic offerings with workforce needs, including online and emerging programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission, Maryland Department of Labor, Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Higher education institutions, students, workforce development agencies, and the populations seeking advanced degrees and workforce training in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on workforce data and program collaboration aims to better align educational programs with market needs, which could reduce the failure rate of small businesses by ensuring a more skilled workforce and relevant academic programs.

Title: Electricity – Tariffs, Distributed Energy Resources, and Electric Distribution System Support Services (Distributed Renewable Integration and Vehicle Electrification (DRIVE) Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a certain electric company to file certain time-of-use tariffs with the Public Service Commission by July 1, 2025; requiring a certain electric company to attempt to achieve a certain enrollment target for certain tariffs by January 1, 2028; authorizing the Commission to require the automatic enrollment of certain customers in a time-of-use tariff on an opt-out basis; requiring the Commission to certain adopt regulations on or before May 1, 2025; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a comprehensive framework for transitioning Maryland's electric customers to time-of-use tariffs, promoting beneficial electrification, integrating distributed energy resources, and supporting electric vehicle infrastructure. It includes programs for pilot projects, incentives, and regulations to enhance the efficiency, reliability, and environmental sustainability of the electric system.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and electric utilities (including investor-owned, municipal, and cooperative utilities)
stakeholders: Electric utility customers in Maryland, including low- and moderate-income households, and owners of distributed energy resources such as solar and energy storage systems.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's programs for incentives, pilot projects, and system support services aim to improve system reliability and reduce costs, which could help small energy-related businesses and system owners avoid failures.

Title: Health Insurance - Breast and Lung Cancer Screening - Coverage Requirements
Synopsis: Including image-guided breast biopsy in the definition of "supplemental breast examination" for the purpose of certain provisions of law requiring insurers, health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for supplemental breast examinations; clarifying that coverage requirements for lung cancer screening apply to follow-up diagnostic imaging; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance plans in Maryland to cover additional screening procedures for breast and lung cancer, including image-guided breast biopsies, without requiring prior authorization or imposing copayments, coinsurance, or deductibles, with certain exceptions for high-deductible plans.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Individuals with health insurance in Maryland, especially those at risk for breast and lung cancer
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By mandating coverage for cancer screenings and procedures without prior authorization or additional costs, the bill may reduce financial barriers and improve early detection, potentially decreasing small business failure related to health costs.

Title: Clean Water Commerce Account - Contracts for the Purchase of Environmental Outcomes
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment, in entering into a certain contract under the Clean Water Commerce Account for the purchase of an environmental outcome, to allow for nonuniform payment schedules for certain purposes; and authorizing the Department to require a certain payment or certain financial protections for contracts of a certain size to ensure certain outcomes.
bill_summary: The bill updates the rules for the Clean Water Commerce Account, allowing the Department of the Environment to use flexible payment schedules and financial incentives for projects that reduce nitrogen loads in support of Chesapeake Bay cleanup efforts. It also authorizes financial protections for large contracts to ensure environmental outcomes are achieved.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Projects and owners involved in environmental water quality improvements, Chesapeake Bay restoration efforts, and local communities benefiting from improved water quality.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for flexible payment schedules and financial protections aim to support project owners, including small businesses, in successfully completing environmental projects, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - License Applications - Notice
Synopsis: Altering a certain notice requirement before the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County may approve an application for an alcoholic beverages license; and authorizing the Board to fulfill the notice requirement by posting online notice of an application hearing for an alcoholic beverages license at least 14 days before the application hearing date.
bill_summary: The bill allows the Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners to fulfill the notice requirement for alcohol license applications by posting online a notice of the application hearing at least 14 days before the hearing, instead of only publishing notices in newspapers.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Businesses applying for alcoholic beverage licenses in Baltimore County and residents of Baltimore County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By providing a more accessible and potentially more timely notice process through online posting, the bill may help small businesses navigate licensing procedures more effectively, reducing the risk of failure due to procedural issues.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Manufacturers and Dealers - Delivery of Vehicles
Synopsis: Establishing that certain requirements for motor vehicle manufacturers, distributors, and factory branches to deliver new motor vehicles to licensed dealers apply after receipt of an electronic order.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for motor vehicle manufacturers, distributors, and factory branches to deliver new vehicles to licensed dealers after receipt of an electronic order or acceptance of an allocation, and clarifies related dealer rights and allocation fairness.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant motor vehicle regulatory agency
stakeholders: Motor vehicle dealers, manufacturers, distributors, and factory branches in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to ensure fair and timely delivery of vehicles to dealers, which can help small dealerships operate more reliably and reduce their risk of failure.

Title: Economic Development - Tourism Zones - Designation and Benefits
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipality to designate, by law, an area within that political subdivision as a tourism zone under certain circumstances; providing that the designation of an area as a tourism zone may not preclude the area from also being designated as an arts and entertainment district; authorizing a county or municipality to exempt from the admissions and amusement tax gross receipts from certain admissions or amusement charges levied in a tourism zone; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the designation of tourism zones within Maryland counties and municipalities, allowing for tax benefits such as exemptions from admissions and amusement taxes and property tax credits for qualifying tourism enterprises within these zones.
responsible_party: The local government of each county or municipality, including the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City, is responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Tourism-related businesses and enterprises within designated tourism zones, as well as visitors to these zones.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides tax incentives and exemptions that could help tourism businesses reduce costs and increase profitability, potentially lowering their risk of failure.

Title: School Leadership Training Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the school leadership training program developed by the State Department of Education and the Accountability and Implementation Board to require that the State Superintendent, county superintendents, and the chair and vice chair of the State Board, a county board, and the Accountability and Implementation Board complete the training; combining two leadership trainings into a single training; and providing for the content of the school leadership training.
bill_summary: The bill requires the State Superintendent, county superintendents, and the Baltimore City Chief Executive Officer to complete a school leadership training program at least once during their term. It also mandates that employment contracts for these officials include a provision to complete such training, which can be offered in virtual format. The bill consolidates leadership training into a single program, specifies its content, and establishes the program's structure and participants.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and the Accountability and Implementation Board
stakeholders: State and county education leaders, school principals, and members of the State Board and county boards of education
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, focusing instead on educational leadership training.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Public Education Campaign on Prostate, Lung, and Breast Cancer Prevention
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop and implement a 3-year public education campaign on prostate, lung, and breast cancer prevention that targets communities disproportionately impacted by prostate, lung, and breast cancer on or before December 1, 2026; requiring the Department to implement the public education campaign on or before January 1, 2027; requiring the Governor to appropriate, in certain fiscal years, certain funding to the Department for the public information campaign from the Cigarette Restitution Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to develop and implement a three-year public education campaign focused on the prevention of prostate, lung, and breast cancer, targeting communities disproportionately impacted by these cancers. The campaign includes educational information, promotion of screenings and clinical trials, and information on legislation to reduce cost barriers, with efforts to partner with healthcare providers and organizations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Communities disproportionately impacted by prostate, lung, and breast cancer in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill allocates funding from the Cigarette Restitution Fund to support cancer prevention and health programs, which may indirectly support small businesses involved in healthcare and community services, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Electricity - Offshore Wind Projects - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to open a revised Round 2 proceeding on June 1, 2024, to evaluate certain offshore wind projects; prohibiting the Commission from approving an application for an offshore wind project unless the application includes commitments for in-State expenditures and investments; requiring the Commission to develop a certain plan to include a schedule of offshore wind energy procurements and proposed amounts of offshore wind energy for procurement through 2031; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's offshore wind energy policies by requiring the Public Service Commission to evaluate offshore wind projects, allowing revisions to project plans, and establishing procurement processes to meet a goal of 8,500 MW of offshore wind capacity by 2031. It also mandates the Department of General Services to procure offshore wind energy through power purchase agreements, with specific terms to support local economic development, environmental protection, and federal funding alignment.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission and Department of General Services
stakeholders: Offshore wind project developers, Maryland residents, local businesses, environmental groups, and workers in the renewable energy sector.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions for community benefit agreements, local content requirements, and support for local businesses, which are intended to promote economic opportunities and reduce the risk of small business failure in the offshore wind industry.

Title: Cosmetologists - Esthetic Services - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "provide esthetic services" to include certain services and to provide that it does not include the diagnosis of illness, disease, or injury or performing ablation of the dermis or hypodermis.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'provide esthetic services' for cosmetologists in Maryland, expanding the scope of services included and clarifying what is excluded, such as diagnosis and ablation of the dermis or hypodermis.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists or relevant licensing authority
stakeholders: Cosmetologists, estheticians, and individuals receiving esthetic services in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying and expanding the scope of esthetic services, the bill aims to support small esthetic businesses and reduce failure rates by providing clearer guidelines and potentially increasing service offerings.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Department of Aging - Earned Income Tax Credit - Distribution of Information and Training
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop a process for providing information about the availability of the State's earned income tax credits to individuals enrolled or participating in certain programs or services, or potential enrollees in certain programs, administered by the Maryland Department of Health; and requiring the Department of Aging to provide training to the Maryland Access Point network to increase awareness of the availability of the State's earned income tax credit.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland health and aging departments to distribute information about the state's earned income tax credit to individuals enrolled in or eligible for certain programs, and to provide training to the Maryland Access Point network to increase awareness of the tax credit.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Department of Aging
stakeholders: Individuals enrolled in or eligible for health and aging programs in Maryland, including seniors, individuals with disabilities, and low-income residents.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but aims to increase awareness of tax credits which could indirectly support low-income individuals and families.

Title: Real Property - Recordation of Instrument With False Information - Penalties and Actions to Quiet Title
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from recording a deed or other instrument that the person knows contains false information; establishing a 3-year limitation on when a prosecution for a violation of the Act may be commenced; establishing a fine not to exceed $500 for a violation of the Act; and authorizing a court to award certain costs and attorney's fees in an action to quiet title if the action or a defense to an action is based on the alleged recordation of a deed containing false information.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits recording deeds or instruments with false information, establishes penalties for doing so, and provides procedures for quiet title actions, including costs and evidence requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and land records offices, with enforcement by the Maryland State's Attorney's Office.
stakeholders: Property owners, potential buyers, real estate professionals, and legal entities involved in property transactions in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal as it primarily targets property record accuracy and legal procedures.

Title: Land Use - Southern Maryland Code Counties - Subdivision Regulations - Property Dedication and Fee
Synopsis: Authorizing a Southern Maryland code county to provide in the county's subdivision regulations for a dedication of real property for recreation, or the payment of a fee in lieu of dedication, to be used by the county for the purchase, development, and improvement of real property for recreational facilities.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Southern Maryland code counties to include regulations for property dedication or fees in lieu of dedication for recreational purposes during subdivision processes.
responsible_party: Southern Maryland code counties' subdivision regulations authority
stakeholders: Residents and developers in Southern Maryland counties, and recreational facility users
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal as it primarily pertains to land use regulations for recreational development.

Title: Division of Parole and Probation – Private Home Detention Monitoring – Earned Compliance Credits
Synopsis: Authorizing individuals under supervision by a private home detention monitoring agency to receive earned compliance credits; requiring a private home detention monitoring agency to provide a report of an individual's compliance to the Division of Parole and Probation during the monitoring period; and establishing certain minimum elements to be included in the report.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes individuals under private home detention supervision to earn compliance credits that can reduce their supervision period, establishes reporting requirements for private home detention agencies, and clarifies procedures for abatement and monitoring.
responsible_party: Division of Parole and Probation and private home detention monitoring agencies
stakeholders: Individuals under supervision by probation, parole, or private home detention agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for private home detention agencies include monitoring and reporting responsibilities, which could improve operational efficiency and reduce failure rates.

Title: Allegany County - Alcoholic Beverages - Underage Employees
Synopsis: Lowering, from 18 to 16 years of age, the minimum age of an individual that may be employed by a license holder in Allegany County.
bill_summary: The bill changes the minimum age for employment by alcohol license holders in Allegany County from 18 to 16 years old, and specifies that individuals must be at least 18 to sell or serve beer, light wine, and liquor.
responsible_party: Allegany County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Authority or local licensing department
stakeholders: Underage individuals aged 16 and 17 seeking employment in alcohol-related businesses in Allegany County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill may help small businesses by expanding the pool of potential employees aged 16 and 17, potentially reducing staffing shortages and related failures.

Title: Public Health - Maryland Commission on Health Equity and Commission on Public Health - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Commission on Health Equity to develop and monitor the statewide health equity plan required under a cooperative grant funding agreement with the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation; requiring the Maryland Commission on Health Equity to coordinate with the Maryland Department of Health and the Health Services Cost Review Commission when establishing a certain advisory committee; and altering the reporting requirements for the Commission on Public Health.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Commission on Health Equity as the governance body responsible for developing and monitoring a statewide health equity plan, in coordination with other state agencies, to address social determinants of health and reduce health disparities.
responsible_party: The Maryland Commission on Health Equity, in coordination with the Maryland Department of Health and the Health Services Cost Review Commission.
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, especially those from underserved communities and populations experiencing health disparities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on health equity and social determinants of health may indirectly support small businesses by improving community health and stability, but it does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Housing and Community Development – Continuing the CORE Partnership Fund – Extension
Synopsis: Repealing the termination of the Continuing the CORE Partnership Fund; and requiring the Governor to include an appropriation in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2026 and each fiscal year thereafter of $50,000,000 to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill extends the operation of the Continuing the CORE Partnership Fund, which is used to assist in removing blighted property in Baltimore City, and mandates the inclusion of specific appropriations in the state budget for this purpose through fiscal year 2026 and beyond.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, in conjunction with the Maryland Stadium Authority and Baltimore City.
stakeholders: Residents and communities in Baltimore City, particularly those affected by blighted properties.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on urban blight removal and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Health Insurance - Appeals and Grievances Process - Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring carriers to report additional data on the number of members entitled to health care benefits under a policy, plan, or certificate and the number of clean claims for reimbursement processed by a carrier to Maryland Health Commissioner.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance carriers in Maryland to report detailed data on members, claims, and grievances to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner. It also mandates the establishment of a workgroup to study the appeals and grievances process for health insurance claims, including data reporting, consumer awareness, and the use of artificial intelligence.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and the Health Education and Advocacy Unit of the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Consumers of health benefit plans in Maryland, health insurance carriers, and the Maryland Insurance Commissioner
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on transparency, data reporting, and process improvement aims to enhance accountability and efficiency in health insurance claims, which could indirectly support small health insurance carriers and related small businesses.

Title: Howard County Agricultural Preservation Advisory Board - Term Length - Alteration Ho. Co. 15-24
Synopsis: Limiting the term of a member serving on the agricultural preservation advisory board in Howard County to 3 years; and authorizing members currently serving on the agricultural preservation advisory board in Howard County to complete their terms.
bill_summary: The bill alters the term length for members of the Howard County Agricultural Preservation Advisory Board, limiting new members to a 3-year term and allowing current members to complete their existing terms.
responsible_party: Howard County governing body and Agricultural Preservation Advisory Board
stakeholders: Farmers and landowners involved in agricultural preservation in Howard County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it primarily addresses advisory board member terms.

Title: Health Insurance - Hearing Aids for Adults - Coverage
Synopsis: Requiring insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations that provide certain health insurance benefits under certain insurance policies or contracts to provide certain coverage for certain hearing aids for adults; authorizing a limit on the benefit payable of $1,400 per hearing aid every 36 months; and authorizing an insured or enrollee to choose a certain hearing aid and pay a certain amount for the hearing aid without financial or contractual penalty to the provider of the hearing aid.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance providers in Maryland to cover hearing aids for both minors and adults, with specific provisions for coverage limits and the ability for individuals to pay extra for higher-priced hearing aids.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or the relevant health insurance regulatory agency
stakeholders: Adults and minors with hearing impairments who are covered under health insurance plans in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By establishing clear coverage requirements and limits for hearing aids, the bill may help reduce the financial burden on small health insurance providers, potentially decreasing small business failure related to insurance coverage costs.

Title: Wicomico County - Alcoholic Beverages - Monopoly of Liquor Control Board and Dispensary - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the monopoly of the Liquor Control Board for Wicomico County and its dispensaries on the sale and distribution of certain liquor at wholesale in the county; authorizing the holders of certain alcoholic beverages licenses to purchase alcoholic beverages from a dispensary or a wholesaler; repealing the prohibition on delivery of certain liquor by certain wholesalers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the monopoly of the Wicomico County Liquor Control Board on the sale and distribution of certain liquor, allowing license holders to purchase alcohol from dispensaries or wholesalers and removing restrictions on delivery. It also modifies licensing and sales regulations for alcoholic beverages within Wicomico County.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Liquor Control Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, retailers, and consumers in Wicomico County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill potentially reduces barriers for small businesses by allowing them to purchase alcohol from dispensaries or wholesalers and by removing certain restrictions, which could improve their operational flexibility.

Title: Wicomico County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B Beer, Wine, and Liquor Licenses - Purchases From Licensed Wholesalers and Self-Distribution
Synopsis: Authorizing a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license holder to purchase liquor for retail sale from a licensed wholesaler; and authorizing a Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant license holder that has been issued a Class 9 limited distillery license to sell certain products manufactured under the distillery license in a manner consistent with the underlying Class B license for on- and off-premises consumption.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain license holders in Wicomico County to purchase liquor from licensed wholesalers, allows a limited distillery license holder to sell and produce specific spirits under certain conditions, and permits a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license holder with a Class 9 distillery license to sell products manufactured under that license.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Alcoholic Beverages Board and the Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Administration
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol retailers, distillery license holders, and consumers in Wicomico County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides expanded purchasing and sales options for license holders, potentially reducing operational challenges and failure risk for small alcohol businesses.

Title: Howard County - Payment in Lieu of Taxes Agreements - Moderate Income Housing Ho. Co. 8-24
Synopsis: Authorizing certain owners of real property and the governing body of Howard County to enter into payment in lieu of taxes agreements for maintaining a certain number of moderate income housing units at the property; requiring the County Executive of Howard County to publish on the county's website the methodology used to calculate the negotiated payment amount under a payment in lieu of taxes agreement authorized under the Act and to reevaluate the methodology at least once every 5 years; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Howard County to enter into agreements with property owners for payment in lieu of property taxes, provided the property maintains a certain number of moderate income housing units. It also requires the County Executive to publish and periodically update the methodology for calculating negotiated payment amounts and ensures agreements follow this methodology.
responsible_party: Howard County Government, specifically the County Executive and the governing body of Howard County
stakeholders: Property owners, moderate income households, and residents of Howard County benefiting from affordable housing programs
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on housing and tax agreements, not directly on small businesses, so its impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Natural Resources - Gwynns Falls State Park - Focus Group, Advisory Committee, and Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources and Baltimore City to convene focus group meetings on the establishment of the Gwynns Falls State Park with community members and stakeholders that reside or operate in the vicinity of the proposed State park; requiring the Department and Baltimore City to establish a stakeholder advisory committee; and requiring the Department to submit a report to the General Assembly by December 1, 2025, on properties suitable for inclusion in the State park and certain funding requirements.
bill_summary: The bill establishes Gwynns Falls State Park as a partnership park between the Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Baltimore City, including properties owned by both entities. It mandates surveys, focus groups, and an advisory committee to guide park development, and requires a report on suitable properties and funding needs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Baltimore City
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, local community organizations, environmental groups, historic preservation groups, and neighborhood residents near the park
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve park facilities and community engagement, which can support local businesses, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: State Board of Cosmetologists - Membership - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the State Board of Cosmetologists by adding one licensed esthetician and decreasing the number of consumer members from two to one.
bill_summary: The bill alters the membership composition of the Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists, including the addition of a consumer member and changes to the appointment process.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists within the Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation
stakeholders: Licensed cosmetologists, estheticians, cosmetology school educators or owners, and the general public
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's changes are administrative and do not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Brewery and Distillery Licenses
Synopsis: Establishing in Frederick County a Class DBR brewery license and a Class DDS distillery permit; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue to the holder of a certain brewery license a Class DBR license to sell certain amounts of beer for on-premises consumption; authorizing the Board to issue to the holder of a certain distillery license a Class DDS permit to sell certain amounts of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new licensing options in Frederick County for breweries and distilleries, including Class DBR brewery licenses and Class DDS distillery permits, allowing on-premises sales of beer and spirits, respectively.
responsible_party: Frederick County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Breweries, distilleries, and consumers in Frederick County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By creating specific licenses and permits for breweries and distilleries, the bill aims to support small alcohol producers and reduce their risk of failure.

Title: Education - School Employee Antibias Training - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to develop guidelines for an antibias training program for school employees; requiring each county board of education to offer training based on the guidelines;  requiring each county board, every other year, to provide antibias training to each public school employee whose job duties include frequent interaction with students; requiring that antibias training be job-embedded, paid professional development training that is provided during nonteaching time; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates annual antibias training for school employees and nonpublic school staff in Maryland, focusing on the prevention of antisemitism and Islamophobia. It requires the development of training guidelines, the implementation of training programs, and an assessment of Holocaust education in schools.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education in consultation with the Professional Standards and Teacher Education Board
stakeholders: School employees, students, and staff in Maryland public and nonpublic schools, including higher education institutions
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; its focus is on education and antibias training.

Title: Labor and Employment - Noncompete and Conflict of Interest Clauses for Veterinary and Health Care Professionals and Study of the Health Care Market
Synopsis: Applying to certain veterinary and health care professionals certain provisions of law stating that certain noncompete and conflict of interest provisions in certain employment contracts are null and void as being against the public policy of the State; establishing certain prohibitions regarding noncompete and conflict of interest provisions for certain health care employment contracts and similar documents and agreements; and requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to study certain issues related to the health care market in the State.
bill_summary: The bill restricts noncompete and conflict of interest clauses in employment contracts for veterinary and health care professionals, making them null and void if they restrict employment or self-employment in certain conditions. It also requires a study on the impact of private equity on the health care market in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Veterinary and health care professionals, patients, health care providers, and the broader health care system in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on noncompete clauses may reduce barriers for veterinary and health care professionals to change jobs or start their own practices, potentially lowering small business failure rates.

Title: Public Schools - Public School Construction - Funding and Administration
Synopsis: Establishing that the State share of eligible costs for certain school construction projects that meet certain criteria is 100%; repealing the provision of law that would have repealed the School Safety Grant Program on June 30, 2026; reducing the appropriation for the Nancy K. Kopp Public School Facilities Priority Fund to $70,000,000 annually beginning in fiscal 2027; altering the uses of the Fund, giving the highest priority to schools with a severe facility issue; establishing the Workgroup on the Assessment and Funding of School Facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates funding and administrative procedures for public school construction in Maryland, including establishing the State share for certain projects, repealing the School Safety Grant Program, creating a Workgroup on the Assessment and Funding of School Facilities, and modifying funds and priorities for school facilities and safety improvements.
